story:
The Nandi Bear Tenants

Hello, I've been making comics, music and films since I was 7 years old... almost 35 years ago now. It's all very low budget and basically home made. I work at an elementary school with grades 1 through 6 and in class I have been teaching the kids how to make comics and films and other creative things like that for several years, I also teach private art classes and run my own art camps every summer. Three years ago I made 'The Nandi Bear Tenants' It was a graphic novel about superheroes and talking cats and all sorts of exciting things. Since then it has become a favourite book of many young people (And old people), Especially at the school where I work. I have had constant requests for a sequel. So here it is. :)

Before I made The Nandi Bear Tenants, I got excited about all the old comics I made when I was a kid and decided to make a series of cartoons about one of the old superheroes I made up when I was a kid who was based on a real cat I had (We're talking 1985...) Anyway, I had such an amazing time bringing Dorriss Doom and her friends to life, that that was another reason I wanted to focus on making comics again for a while. Dorriss Doom premiered at that year's Calgary comic and entertainment expo. It was a huge hit and I had kids asking for my autograph the rest of the weekend. It was bizarre and awesome. Bottom line is, people love Dorriss Doom. And this comic is gonna rock. 

Watch my Dorriss Doom cartoons:

http://youtu.be/GIlj-suKN1Q  

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am hand drawing every page and colouring it with watercolour paints. I am scanning the finished pages and doing the text on my computer (Using a font I made myself.) The whole story is 61 pages long, and I anticipate it will take me a few more months to make it all. All together I plan on it being a 67 page book. I want to get it printed properly and will be going through createspace to get that done, as they have reasonable prices and also have your book for sale on amazon.com and make it available to librarys and schools. The money I am trying to get will go towards the printing of as many copies of the comic as I can get. I will use these copies to give to the people who funded the project and also have some to give away and sell at comic conventions. 

 

The Story

This chapter in the unfolding saga of the Nandi Bear Tenants find some of our heroes minding a new shop that has been built into Nandi Bear Manor, and the other group of heroes trying to solve a serious mystery that leads them to mind blowing adventures on the moon and accross the universe. All the known portals to the Peanut Butter Dimension have been closed up tight, which is not just mysterious, it also means that our hero, the tough and.. tough Naiad Bear's brother Galaxy Peanut Butter Bear is now trapped! Not only do they need to meet new friends like the amazing Captain Trash, Rose, the customer, and the goo spitting Raca, but they will go up against Dinosaurs from space, and travel to the moon to meet the mysterious Moon Twins! Who is behind the closure of the Peanut Butter Dimension, and why? Dorriss Doom, Naiad, Veltrax, Oliver, Klor and the rest of our exciting team of heroes will find out! And possibly do some hot yoga at some point.

 

Every donation no matter how small will receive access to the behind the scenes facebook group, where I will be posting cool pictures of my progress as I make the comic.


Also, if I can make my $500 goal, I will send out a special home made Nandi Bear Tenant T-shirt to the first 10 people that helped out! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign! 

And go visit my website and watch tons of movies and listen to and download a bunch of music or something.. or follow us on facebook. I do so much stuff all the time and basically give it all away for free.. 

http://scentertainment.ca  

SC Entertainment on Facebook  

It would be lovely if I could print out some more of these comics. They have made such exciting difference in many kids lives, and my own. I have taught kids to read using the first book, It's very exciting to me to be doing something like this.

story:
THE STORY OF THE DREAMING CITY

"The Dreaming City" is a graphic adaptation of the first Elric story by Roy Thomas and P. Craig Russell. The first two parts were published initially in Epic Illustrated magazine before the whole five-part adaptation was completed in Marvel's second graphic novel, which was released in 1982.

P. Craig Russell hand-colored the original art and it is a true high point of his accomplished and extensive career. The original art pages are not lettered (the lettering was done on separate sheets of paper) so they are clutter-free and glorious to look at. The pages have been kept in a climate-controlled environment at the Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum in Columbus, Ohio and they are in great shape. The colors are beautifully vivid,—even more so than in previously printed versions.

 


THE RESTORATION

We are attempting to restore this great work by making high-resolution scans of the original unlettered, hand-colored art (nearly 60 pages worth). Some pages also have to be sent out to a professional gallery to be scanned due to their oversized dimensions. For posterity's sake, we also need to scan each and every corresponding page of lettering so that it can be combined with the color art for any future presentations of this material (which is another 60 scans).

A number of the lettered pages are missing from the archive, so we also need to hire a professional comics letterer to recreate them so that they match the style of the originals. There will be many other lettering tweaks and corrections made that were missed in the original presentation. Also, a few pages were not kept with the bulk of the originals at the Cartoon Library and Museum, One page in particular was kept framed in a non-UV safe frame and the colors have faded and shifted considerable. These pages will have to be gone over by the artist and recolored by hand so that they are closer to their original beauty.

On top of the scanning and restoration, we also have to cover the cost of multiple all-day road trips down to Columbus, Ohio to retrieve and return the original art elements. These, along with many other expenses, ultimately add up to an unfortunately sizable amount.

This campaign will allow us to cover all of the costs of this expensive restoration and will also enable us to provide our valued pledge partners with a number of unique perks to thank them for making it all possible. Perhaps best of all is the fact that it will enable us to provide the restored files to Titan Comics for use in an upcoming new hardcover edition . . . so this amazing masterwork of comic art can be enjoyed by a whole new generation!

story:
Short Summary

 After a successful crowdfunding campaign for issue 1.  The boys from Hawaii and California are back to deliver more supernatural horror!  This time they are crowdfunding to print the long awaited second issue, The Hexing Part 2: Fire With Fire.  By backing the second installment of The Hexing, you will help continue the story of the first horror comic set in the state of Hawaii. Each contribution you make, helps complete a story that has been eight years in the making. More importantly, it helps bring the talented creative team closer to achieving their dreams.  

What We Need & What You Get​

Our crowdfunding goal is $6100, which  will cover printing cost for shipping supplies, rewards, legal fees. Most importantly your contributions will help pay for the artist to start work on The Hexing Part 3: Rubicon.



We have a lot of cool and awesome perks this time around. Digital downloads for both PDF and CBR. Social Media Shoutouts, Signed Copies, Variant Covers, Pin Set, new T-shirts, Poster, Plush Dolls, Speaking Role in the comic, and original artwork.  All waiting for you the backers! This time around we are also offering International Shipping. 

The Impact

The first issue of The Hexing was praised for its uniqueness.  It is a horror story set in the most unlikely of places. Yet, it honors the culture and local people of the 808 state. By portraying the communities of Hawaii accurately.  

Horror fans have also praised The Hexing for staying true to the horror genre.  With its homages to classic horror films and books such as, Serpent and The Rainbow, The Craft, Friday the 13th and Tales from The Crypt. 

We have also been receiving praise for drawing inspiration from Filipino mythology and folk magic.  With monsters inspired by the Aswang and Manananggal. 
 

Risks & Challenges

One of the greatest risks to any crowdfunding is never getting your rewards.  We made our fulfillment for our last crowdfunding.  It was a great learning experience and we look forward to applying what we learned to make our fulfillment process more efficient!  The Hexing team is currently working on the artwork for issue 2 and look forward to delivering your comic on time.  

To ensure that your prizes arrive on time, we will be shipping our rewards with USPS Priority Shipping, so that your package is insured and has a tracking number.

Some of the companies we are using to print our rewards are Kablam Digital Printing, Budsies, Greco Printing, Vista Print, and Pure Buttons. Each of these companies have a history of creating quality products and delivering on time. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not donate, but want to support our project,  please Like and share our social media accounts! Sharing our project on your timeline helps us reach the widest audience possible.  Also check out our website for all the latest updates. Where you can also see samples from our comic. 

https://www.thehexing.com

https://twitter.com/TheHexingComic/

https://www.instagram.com/thehexingcomic/

https://www.facebook.com/thehexing/

 

The Team
Michael McGarvey: Writer & Creator 

Andrew Wright: Editor 

Jose Marzan: Pencils 

Élan Heredia: Art

Shane Curran: Character Designs

story:
Enter: Raymond Fox, a clumsy and sarcastic, teenage fox in a world of anthropomorphic animals, who most seem to have special abilities and powers. Raymond, himself, is a stubborn vigilante of the capital municipality, Meva City.

Ray posses the ability to manipulate heat and plasma energy. Combined with his powers, he’s a skilled mixed martial artist, has unmatched agility, and he’s deceptively cunning. Unfortunately, his clumsiness and carefree attitude,  makes matters worse for him and others. He’s been a vigilante for only 3 months, and the entirety of Meva City hate his guts for his mishaps, labeling him a mischievous ARSONIST rather them calling him a hero.

His #1 motive is to prove himself worthy of his gifts and reconcile his mistakes. In the first 2 chapters,  Ray’s on a journey discovering himself and learning what it really means to be a sacrificial hero!











Hey Everybody!

Thanks for being invested in this project! My name is Christopher Scott, also referred to as ScottyArtz or BoScotty. I am an amateur comic book illustrator, freelance artist, and designer. I graduated from the Illinois Institute of Art-Chicago in 2015 with a Bachelor’s of Fine Arts in Illustration and Design.  Ray Fox is my first completely project. The first 2 Chapters are completed and free to read at RayFoxthecomic.com. I intend to get them ready for Ray Fox's first printed book!

I actually came up with Ray Fox when I was 10 years old.  I was fascinated with action cartoons about anthropomorphic animals like the Mighty Ducks, Swat Kats, and the 2k3 Ninja Turtles. When I got older I got inspired by more serious/darker storytelling from the likes of Western comics like Spider-man and X men to Eastern comics like the long running One Piece, and the classic, original Dragon ball. To this day, I still believe that there's so much potential for a series like Swat Kats to have more thematic story telling like Spider-man. That’s what inspired me to make this story. 

Ray Fox is a Action/Adventure story of comedic antics and drama. It is intended for young adults and up.  

 



$3500 is needed to produce the first 2 chapters of Ray Fox in Print and to ship them to Backers. The book will be a 140+ page black & white soft gloss cover graphic novel. Every backer who pledges $20 or more will have an autographed copy of the book! When the goal is reached, and the books are received, retail price will be $25




More information On perks can be found on the right side!

If you're a retailer, contact me for special bulk pricing





$6000 | Hard Cover! The comic will now be hard cover!
 
$17,000 | Hard Cover in Color! If this goal is reached, not only will it be hard cover but every non colored page in the book will be in color!

$25,000 | ???

$50,000 | ???






I've been improving my art for the past 10 years, with the last six dedicated to Ray Fox. Of all the things I've worked on since starting college, Ray Fox has taken up all my focus.

Risks and challenges

Book production, especially when you're producing on your own, will always have its hassles. Especially when this will be the artist's first time doing something like this. Believe me, this has been pretty daunting to me, but above all, I am more thrilled than anything! I've done as much as I could to effectively plan out an effective timeline to keep things going along as smoothly as possible. As stated before in this campaign, the comic is already completed and available to read online. I have a tendency to complete every project I've been serious about. :) The only work that has to be done, besides some of the rewards (which are simple enough for me), is getting the whole comic in color if that stretch goal was to be met. 

I’ve already talked to a printer and I’m one step away from making this happen. I really hope you can support this comic and make my dream a reality!

story:
RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN!

"Two Army Veterans crash in a mystical jungle populated by a lost tribe of Warrior Women that hunt men, enslave them and then kill them. They must escape, submit to survive, or die trying!”  

RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN! is 100% finished.

Because of prior demand, we reprinted issue 1.   We want to make sure everyone is familiar with this story before we launch issue #2.

Cover by Geebo Vigonte

Ravage: Kill All Men! page 1

 

Ravage: Kill All Men! page 2

 

Ravage: Kill All Men! page 3

 

Ravage: Kill All Men! page 4

 

Ravage: Kill All Men! page 5

 

Ravage: Kill All Men! page 6

CREATIVE TEAM

MR. CHUCK DIXON
Chuck Dixon is a veteran comic book writer with thousands of titles to his name including a record run on BATMAN at DC Comics (where he co-created the villain BANE) and seminal work on Marvel’s The Punisher.

BENJAMIN L HENDERSON
Benjamin L Henderson, Writer of over 50 original titles such as RAVAGE: KILL ALL MEN, The Magus: Inner Demons, and OFFWORLDER. 

JIMBO SALGADO
Jimbo is Art Director and Artist. Jimbo has a unique and innovative expression all his own. His works include DC Batman Arkham Unhinged, Team 7 #3, Judge Dredd #7, Toy Packaging Art for Hasbro Publishing, Transformers More than Meets the Eye Annual work for IDW Publishing, Trading Card Work for Upperdeck Entertainment, He is also a Cover Artist for Different Publishing Studios like Heavy Metal Magazine, Zenescope Entertainment, Titan Comics, and Valiant Entertainment.

BRYAN ARFEL MAGNAYE
Bryan Arfel Magnaye is a comic book colorist wizard! He graduated in multimedia arts and design for post-secondary education as well as many seminars and trainings. He has worked for Glasshouse Publishing, God n Bone Animations, and Zenescope Entertainment.

 

THE STORY

The RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN saga takes place in the mystical land of The PROTECTORI, home to an Ancient Race of Warriors that are sworn to stop the Evil of The LIZZARSIN, The FIRST ONES, members an ancient Cult from a long-forgotten race that worship nothing but their lust and the One-Eyed Demon. The Evil GENERAL RAK of the LIZZARSIN has spent an eternity hunting the Queen Of The Protectori and her Warriors.

The "General" and his warriors, attack all those that look, think or feel differently, Children, The Sick, The Elderly Protectori Women in the Old Temples, nothing is held sacred to the snakelike "warrior" cult. The tears of the Old feed their dark souls while the cooked bodies of children feed their bellies. All those that are not a part of their hive are an abomination to be ridiculed, attacked and enslaved. 

Project Status

RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN Redux Issue #1 printed and in hand!!  These are left-overs from our Kickstarter campaign.

SHIPPING

We ship with Gemini and only Gemini. Gemini today and Gemini tomorrow. Gemini all day.  Did we mention we only use Gemini mailers?

All books will be bagged/boarded and secured in Gemini mailers.

For international shipping there are so many variations it's difficult to setup shipping for every one.  If you are outside the US and would like a shipping quote, please contact us with your shipping address and we will calculate shipping options for you.

PERKS

$5 - Digital PDF Copy

$14 - Swag Bundle.  Comes with:

  • Ravage: Kill All Men! Redux Issue #1
  • print of the cover by Geebo Vigonte
  • print of the Kickstarter exclusive cover by Lorenzo Thellier d'Auzers
  • coaster
  • 2021 calendar
  • wooden bookmark
  • sticker designed by Patrick Thomas Parnell.

$5 - Scratch & Dent copy.  We have a few copies with damage that occurred in shipping.  The pictures below show 2 examples of the type of damage.  The first one is the worst we found.  The last 2 show front and back of the same copy --his is one with the least damage.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!

Risks and challenges

The project is completed and books are in hand. As soon as the funds are received from Indiegogo we will begin shipping.  The only risk on this campaign is how the USPS treats your package.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute to our campaign, that is wonderful!  If you cannot contribute by becoming a backer, you can still help spread the word.  Please use the share links at the top of the page to help get the word out to others who may be interested in backing this campaign.  

In either case, we appreciate your support.

Ravage: Kill All Men! page 4
 

Ravage: Kill All Men! page 5
 

Ravage: Kill All Men! page 6
CREATIVE TEAM
MR. CHUCK DIXONChuck Dixon is a veteran comic book writer with thousands of titles to his name including a record run on BATMAN at DC Comics (where he co-created the villain BANE) and seminal work on Marvel’s The Punisher.
BENJAMIN L HENDERSONBenjamin L Henderson, Writer of over 50 original titles such as RAVAGE: KILL ALL MEN, The Magus: Inner Demons, and OFFWORLDER. 
JIMBO SALGADOJimbo is Art Director and Artist. Jimbo has a unique and innovative expression all his own. His works include DC Batman Arkham Unhinged, Team 7 #3, Judge Dredd #7, Toy Packaging Art for Hasbro Publishing, Transformers More than Meets the Eye Annual work for IDW Publishing, Trading Card Work for Upperdeck Entertainment, He is also a Cover Artist for Different Publishing Studios like Heavy Metal Magazine, Zenescope Entertainment, Titan Comics, and Valiant Entertainment.
BRYAN ARFEL MAGNAYEBryan Arfel Magnaye is a comic book colorist wizard! He graduated in multimedia arts and design for post-secondary education as well as many seminars and trainings. He has worked for Glasshouse Publishing, God n Bone Animations, and Zenescope Entertainment.
 
THE STORY
The RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN saga takes place in the mystical land of The PROTECTORI, home to an Ancient Race of Warriors that are sworn to stop the Evil of The LIZZARSIN, The FIRST ONES, members an ancient Cult from a long-forgotten race that worship nothing but their lust and the One-Eyed Demon. The Evil GENERAL RAK of the LIZZARSIN has spent an eternity hunting the Queen Of The Protectori and her Warriors.
The "General" and his warriors, attack all those that look, think or feel differently, Children, The Sick, The Elderly Protectori Women in the Old Temples, nothing is held sacred to the snakelike "warrior" cult. The tears of the Old feed their dark souls while the cooked bodies of children feed their bellies. All those that are not a part of their hive are an abomination to be ridiculed, attacked and enslaved. 
Project Status
RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN Redux Issue #1 printed and in hand!!  These are left-overs from our Kickstarter campaign.
SHIPPING
We ship with Gemini and only Gemini. Gemini today and Gemini tomorrow. Gemini all day.  Did we mention we only use Gemini mailers?
All books will be bagged/boarded and secured in Gemini mailers.

For international shipping there are so many variations it's difficult to setup shipping for every one.  If you are outside the US and would like a shipping quote, please contact us with your shipping address and we will calculate shipping options for you.
PERKS

$5 - Digital PDF Copy

$14 - Swag Bundle.  Comes with:

Ravage: Kill All Men! Redux Issue #1
print of the cover by Geebo Vigonte
print of the Kickstarter exclusive cover by Lorenzo Thellier d'Auzers
coaster
2021 calendar
wooden bookmark
sticker designed by Patrick Thomas Parnell.


$5 - Scratch & Dent copy.  We have a few copies with damage that occurred in shipping.  The pictures below show 2 examples of the type of damage.  The first one is the worst we found.  The last 2 show front and back of the same copy --his is one with the least damage.



THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!
Risks and challenges
The project is completed and books are in hand. As soon as the funds are received from Indiegogo we will begin shipping.  The only risk on this campaign is how the USPS treats your package.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can contribute to our campaign, that is wonderful!  If you cannot contribute by becoming a backer, you can still help spread the word.  Please use the share links at the top of the page to help get the word out to others who may be interested in backing this campaign.  
In either case, we appreciate your support.

story:
Babylon Working follows a crew of misfit space pirates who call themselves Babylon. The crew attempts to pull off an easy job of stealing the cargo of an ancient cult. Little did they know that the cargo was housing an elder god. Now every collector, cult, and fearmongering zealot is after them.

WHAT ARE YOU BACKING?

  • This is a 32 page full color comic, single (second) issue of a series.
  • Sci-Fi genre
  • Mature Readers

PREVIEW

 

Read The First 11 Pages Of Issue 1

story:
Denny Anderson's "Reality Check World Tour" Comedy Show

Thank you for visiting and considering helping me relaunch my comedy career...I am Denny Anderson, and I have developed a Stand Up Comedy routine titled Denny Anderson's "Reality Check World Tour" Comedy Show, and am ready to take this act on the road for it's world tour. This act has been developed for the last 6 months, and I have performed this show at 5 different towns and cities here in Colorado. Now...time...yes...;) The world is about to experience THE very first actual Jedi Master working the Light Force with the use of laughter. As a Jedi...I cannot and will not lie, and this makes for some great laughs, and some eye openers too. A cross between George Carlin and Don Rickles, I place everyday lies on the table...Exposed for all to see...In the end my audience will see some light in this darkness that engulfs this planet these days. I have no borders as a Jedi...Tis why it is a world tour. So...Please help me shoot for the stars once again, and ride along with me! I never forget a friend...

The Impact

I am out to set the world straight on issues like lieing to kids about Santa Clause the Sith. And The dreaded tooth faeiry get it as well. I am very colorful in my Jedi Performance Garb, and use big clown shoes in my performances. People leave my show feeling happy and reflective about what was told to them that night. Laughter is the best therapy..It'll cure what ails ya!

What We Need & What You Get

I have a manager who will be overseeing these funds. Her name is Lelie Carrol and she is a professional healer, and small business owner here in Ft. Collins CO. She will distribute the funding for this tour on an as needed basis, and make sure your money goes to where it need to make this a success.

We will be requiring $50,000.00 for a North American Tour, and that is all this campaign will address. The European jeg of the tour will be self sufficient by the time we begin touring there. But we need to get off the ground. This money will be used for travel and lodging expenses, as well as renting performance halls to perform this revenue generating act in. I plan in profiting by Box Office Ticket Sales, and merchandising...{"How High Are You" tee shirts...mugs...keychains}

Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others'  PLEASE! If you don't have the money? Don't feel bad...NEITHER DO I! ha ha he he! But you can share this on your favorite social networking page...I'd dig it big time!

story:
The Nesting Dolls started in the fall of 2011 out of a love for improv and a desire to play with different funny women in the Austin Improv community. Since then, they have played all over Austin at different improv theaters, and co-hosted a weekly Thursday run at ColdTowne Theater in April.
 
Now it's time for these dolls to spread their wings and fly to the east cost and show them what Austin improv is made of! From June 29th - July 1st The Nesting Dolls will be soaking in the New York City sun and watching more improv that you can possibly dream of.
 
The Del Close Marathon was started in 1999 in memory of Del Close. Since then, improv troupes from all over the world have taken the stage during the festival to honor Del and all he did for improv.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2000 dollars to help us get to NYC, pay for our hotels, and feed us through the weekend. (this will be divided up evenly for those going to NYC)

For contribtuing to this we have many perks to offer, from singing a personalized song for you to hosting a pot luck dinner in your honor.
 

This is a huge honor for us to be asked to play at the Del Close Marathon. With your help you would help make some pretty big dreams come true.

 

If you can't help, we totally understand, but please help us spread the word. Send this link to anyone you know who likes ladies, comedy, funny stuff, hip hop, Back to the Future, potluck dinners, potluck lunches, and everything.

 

Thanks so much,

Love,

Always,

and Forever,

The Nesting Dolls

story:
RUBBER NECKER #6

It's your old pal Nick Bertozzi here. I've written and drawn a new 32-page issue of my Harvey Award-winning  comic series Rubber Necker. If you'd like to read a copy of the full-color Rubber Necker #6, help me print it up. 

Did you miss Rubber Necker #5 last year? Don't worry, I have copies left. There's a reward level that includes #5 and #6.

Are you new to Rubber Necker? Don't worry about that either, I have a few print copies left but I'm also offering a digital download of issues 1-4 with every reward level. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need $1,000.00 to print the full-color book and another $500 to ship it out to you.

There shall be myriad rewards for your patronage: the aforementioned digital download, original art, big posters, little posters, fingernail trimmings, portfolio reviews, and manuscripts.

    Risks & Challenges

    It'll be very difficult to print the book if we don't reach the $1500 goal. It wouldn't break me, but it'd hurt financially. But it won't come to that.  I've successfully crowd-funded comics before–you folks helped me print my hardcover Persimmon Cup graphic novel last year. And I've got a small box of awards, a couple of appearances on the NY Times Bestsellers list, and you to tell me that you like reading the comics I make.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Help print up a good read and if you can't afford to pitch in, you can help me by letting your friends know about the campaign

    Thank you!

story:
About Top Secret Press

My name is John Daniel Taylor IV, owner of Top Secret Press. For over ten years, I have been creating, writing and selling comics with the help of the best talented Artists around. A fully established publishing house, Top Secret Press publishes comics by talented creators & writers, as well as our own line of Comics, Playing Cards, Prints, Magazines & Graphic Novels.

Top Secret Press has a number of great comics planned in the future! With the success of this Indiegogo Project, we hope to be able to move forward on a great number of these projects while giving our stockroom a little space! We're hoping You guys can help us make this happen!

 

Top Secret Press 10th Anniversary!

Here we are ten years later! Most likely the majority of you have no idea about Top Secret Press as to who or what, we are, then again ~ you just might!  Anyway, I thought we'd give you a FREE PREVIEW of some of our comic titles in the form of a 100 Page Giant Digital Edition with a great retro cover by TSP Artist Rafael Lanhellas!

Download Link:  ???? ?? ?? ?????? ?????

Perks ~ we have PERKS!

  • We have picked a goal; Funding is Flexible!
  • Even if we don't reach the goal, we deliver the Perks!
  • All the Perks are In Stock ~ there will be very little waiting for delivery!
  • PDF's will be shipped when Indiegogo Funds Clear (as soon as 2 weeks after Funding ends)
  • Physical copies will be mailed 2-3 weeks after the end of Indiegogo Campaign.
  • The wait time for products is short and sweet!

How You can Help!

We are expanding! Which means we need more space and resources to continue creating exciting new comics! The goal of this Indiegogo is to eliminate overstock & to make room for new projects.  Overstock hurts because it is money sitting; always a problem with publishing comics!  Here's a chance for YOU to get a Great Perk from 20% - 60% OFF our normal price!


About Add Ons...

There's quite a few. While this campaign is a little different from our last, there are almost as many Add Ons as Perks! Alternate Covers ~ Signed Covers Special Limited Covers ~ These are all fairly limited at this point! 

What is the different about the Add On's this time? I have split most of the Add On's between the Perk and Add On section's. So, if it appears Sold Out as a Perk, we may still have it as an Add On.  I thought it would be the best way to allow everyone a chance to get something great!

 If there is something we missed, or something you think we should add ~ email us and let us know!

Risks & Challenges

Top Secret Press has delivered every one of their over 40+ crowd-funded projects! Including Playing Cards, Sketch Books, Comics, Buttons, Postcards, Magazines, Artwork and more. Every day we reach out to new fans all over the world!

The only challenge is deciding which Perk to pledge! All items listed are ready to sell, they just need to be packed and mailed. We have a proven track record of sales for over seven years, so you can go for it, and know you WILL get your items!

It's all up to you guys now ~ Thanks!

John Daniel Taylor IV
Editor in Chief / Owner
Top Secret Press

WEB SITE: www.topsecretpress.com
FACEBOOK: www.facebook.com/topsecretpress
TWITTER: https://twitter.com/TSPCMX 
INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/tspcmx
TUMBLR: http://topsecretpress.tumblr.com

                                                    Keep scrolling ~ There's MORE!



Playing Card Decks

TSP created a variety of Premium Playing Card Decks featuring characters from our comics as well as Decks featuring Top Artists in the field of comic art! Two decks that stand out are the Sci-Fi Angel Series & The Claudio Aboy Elite Series. These decks are quality ~ Artwork by Artist Claudio Aboy (Heavy Metal Magazine, Official Star Wars). We also created a beautiful deck with Artist Atilio Gambedotti. Atilio has been in the field of art for over twenty years!

Some of these decks are listed as Add Ons, while other come in a Set of 6.

Trading Card Sets

TSP made two Limited Trading Card series ~ one in 2014; one in 2019. Both sets highlight covers from various Top Secret Press Comic Titles! These Trading Card Sets are Add Ons!

7th Sister, Devil's Back, Betty Wicked, 3CORPS, Legend: HE, The Strange ~ they're here!  

                                                 Keep scrolling ~ There's MORE!

Artwork #2 – Issue #1 Cover Art in a Three Postcard Set by Rafael Lanhellas

Artwork 21 – Betty Wicked #4, Page 1 by Carlos Paul

Artwork 24 – Betty Wicked #4, Page 5 by Carlos Paul

Artwork 29 – Legend: Hell's Executioner #2, Cover C by Rafael Lanhellas

Artwork 36 – Legend: Hell's Executioner #2, Page 1 by Rafael Lanhellas


Artwork 37 – Legend: Hell's Executioner #2, Page 4 by Rafael Lanhellas

Top Secret Press creates because we love the genre! Presenting comics like Silvio Spotti's Sword of Justice and continuing to publish Betty Wicked, The Devil's Back and other titles...  With the continued support of Backers, Fans and those that follow our line, ~ YOU ~ we can continue to branch out with more titles, expanded lines, and stories that engage the readers. 

~ THANKS for LOOKING ~  JDT / Top Secret Press

Artwork 26 – Betty Wicked #4, Page 16 by Carlos PaulArtwork 27 – Betty Wicked #4, Page 19 by Carlos PaulArtwork 28 – Betty Wicked #4, Page 24 by Carlos PaulArtwork 29 – Legend: Hell's Executioner #2, Cover C by Rafael LanhellasArtwork 30 – Legend: Hell's Executioner #1, Page 1 by John HowardArtwork 31 – Legend: Hell's Executioner #1, Page 21 by Rafael LanhellasArtwork 32 – Legend: Hell's Executioner #1, Page 22 by Rafael LanhellasArtwork 33 – Legend: Hell's Executioner #1, Page 23 by Rafael LanhellasArtwork 34 – Legend: Hell's Executioner #1, Page 24 by Rafael LanhellasArtwork 35 – Legend: Hell's Executioner #1, Page 25 by Rafael LanhellasArtwork 36 – Legend: Hell's Executioner #2, Page 1 by Rafael LanhellasArtwork 37 – Legend: Hell's Executioner #2, Page 4 by Rafael Lanhellas
Top Secret Press creates because we love the genre! Presenting comics like Silvio Spotti's Sword of Justice and continuing to publish Betty Wicked, The Devil's Back and other titles...  With the continued support of Backers, Fans and those that follow our line, ~ YOU ~ we can continue to branch out with more titles, expanded lines, and stories that engage the readers. 
~ THANKS for LOOKING ~  JDT / Top Secret Press

story:
Now Available: Original Art by Peter Gilmore

The Ardanna Companion

This supplemental behind-the-scenes book features design sketches, page layouts, notes, script pages, samples from the original novel, and more! These will not be released elsewhere and are exclusive to The Ardanna Companion. 

24 pages; black & white

Note: This item is also available as an Add-On at checkout with no additional shipping cost. IF YOU ARE ALREADY A BACKER, CONTACT ME WITH YIUR BACKER NUMBER AND I WILL SEND YOU A LINK TO A SECRET PERK WITH FREE SHIPPING.

The Story

Ardanna #0 is your introduction to a sword & sorcery world of savage steel, beautiful heroines, dark magic, wicked creatures, and lost legends.​

Obsessed with uncovering clues that would prove his stolen birthright, Sabian traveled the globe cutting himself on broken hearts. During his voyages, however, the fragments he discovered began to reveal part of a larger history that has seemingly been erased by those who have been in power for the past 200 years.

Now, having been inspired by his many stories as a child, Ardanna begins her search for her missing father, while attempting to complete his work in discovering their lost lineage - and through it - a history that has been stolen from the world.

Ardanna #0 will be a full-length comic book (24 pages of art/story), in glorious color, with plenty of bonus content.

The adventures of Ardanna contain classic sword & sorcery violence, suggestive themes, likely alcohol use, and is suggested for readers ages 13+.

Campaign Goals

Ardanna #0 is nearly finished and now we want to share it with you! The campaign goal is a flexible $3,500 and we just need to know how many to print, so that's where you come in!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't back us right now, you can also help by following and sharing this campaign on your social media!

story:
THE BOOK


Slaves for Gods is a comic book series heavily influenced by science fiction movies of the eighties. Steeped in conspiracy theory, and told through parallel story lines, it follows two computer programers and an anarchist group, all fighting to bring down a corrupt corporation lead by a maniacal CEO Gasoline Face. 



WHO WE ARE


These Machines Are Winning is a constantly evolving art collective of musicians, writers, comic artists, editors, producers, filmmakers, engineers, and actors. By utilizing multiple mediums, we are able to create a fully immersive experience into the world of Slaves For Gods. 



WHERE WE ARE NOW


We are extremely fortunate to be working with interior artist Aaron Minier (DC Wildstorm’s Push, Black Rose), colorist/letterer Jodi Wynn (Lazarus), as well as cover artists JOCK (Wytches, The Losers), Charlie Adlard (The Walking Dead), James O'Barr (The Crow), Antoine Dodé (The Crow: Curare), and Dustin D'Arnault (Outlaw Territories Vol. 3). We also have numerous splash pages with "quotes" by some of our biggest influences: John Carpenter (Escape From New York, The Live), Travis Walton (Fire in the Sky), ''Apollo 14''  Astronaut  Ed Mitchell, and ''Canadian Prime Minister of Defense''  Paul Hellyer (All who we made personal connections with). We have self-funded, and completed 3 albums, (all of which are available through this campaign), six cinematic music videos, and the first two books of the comic series (Excluding color and letters). Your contributions will get our artists back to work, and help us get the finished product to publishers. 



WHAT YOU CAN GET

We are doing something different with our perks for this campaign. Because our goal for Slaves For Gods is publication through a major distribution company, we do not want to offer the finished product through one of the tiers, not knowing how long the process will take. Instead, our tiers consist of pre-orders for two new albums and merchandise exclusive to this campaign, including t-shirts, hoodies, and original artwork. What is exciting about our merchandise is that every piece has original artwork from comic artists such as JOCK, James O'Barr, Toshio Maeda, Antoine Dodé, and Aaron Minier (All artwork will appear in Slaves for Gods).



ARCHITECT OF DECAY - CD / LIMITED COLORED CASSETTE 

Finalized Art Coming Soon by Legendary Japanese Manga Artist, Toshio Madea "The Tenticle Master" ( includes poster of original cover art )

 Guest Appearances from Sarah Jaffe, Phil Karnats (Secret Machines), Nikki Cage (True Widow), Austin Jenkins (White Denim), Taylor Rea, Dan Phillips (True Widow), Dave Trumfio (The Pulsars) and Charles Mooney III (The Toadies)

Featuring: ''Trapped in the Abyss'' w/ Sarah Jaffe and Taylor Rea  &  ''Honeycomb Kisses'' w/ Nikki Cage and Taylor Rea 

EXPLODING PLASTIC/IDOL RECORDS



EXCLUSIVE SLAVES FOR GODS

T-SHIRT

Campaign Exclusive ''SLAVES FOR GODS'' T-shirt, All Sizes 

Artwork by Award Winning British Artist JOCK (Wytches, The Losers)




DEFENDER I - VINYL PACKAGE 

Defender 1 :  180 Gram LP on Black Vinyl w/ CD and Limited  Poster. 

Artwork by Award Winning British Artist JOCK (Wytches, The Losers)

Featuring ''Fornication'' w/ Taylor Rea and ''Brains Inside Your Head'' w/ Harry Wrigley (Polyphonic Spree) and Dave Trumfio (The Pulsars)

EXPLODING PLASTIC/IDOL RECORDS



EXCLUSIVE KURU PRE-ORDER 

KURU LP 180 Gram Black Vinyl w/ Download Card and Two Limited Posters 

Artwork  by James O’Barr (Creator of The Crow), French Artist Antoine Dodé (The Crow: Curare), Aaron Minier (DC Wildstorm's Push), and Clayton Stillwell (Concept Artist: The Book of Life)

KURU is a collection of songs from These Machines Are Winning, True Widow, and DND (A new side project from Dave Trumfio), with major contributions from:  Phil Karnats (Secret Machines), Kevin Howard (TMAW)  Rick Nelson (Afghan Whigs)  and Kaputter 

Featuring  True Widow’s ''Moon 1'' and ''Halloween Now'' Co-Written by James O'Barr

EXPLODING PLASTIC/IDOL RECORDS



EXCLUSIVE KURU PRE-ORDER 

KURU LP 180 GRAM ORANGE Vinyl w/ Download Card and Two Limited Signed  Posters by James O'Barr and Clayton Stillwell

Artwork  by James O’Barr (Creator of The Crow), French Artist Antoine Dodé (The Crow: Curare), Aaron Minier (DC Wildstorm's Push), and Clayton Stillwell (Concept Artist: The Book of Life)

KURU is a collection of songs from These Machines Are Winning, True Widow, and DND (A new side project from Dave Trumfio), with major contributions from:  Phil Karnats (Secret Machines), Kevin Howard (TMAW)   Rick Nelson (Afghan Whigs) 

Featuring  True Widow’s ''Moon 1'' and ''Halloween Now'' Co-Written by James O'Barr

EXPLODING PLASTIC/IDOL RECORDS




EXCLUSIVE SLAVES FOR GODS HOODIE 

Campaign Exclusive ''SLAVES FOR GODS'' HOODIE, All Sizes 

Artwork by British Award Winning Artist JOCK (Wytches, The Losers)


ORIGINAL COMIC PAGES 

Original SLAVES FOR GODS Comic Pages by Aaron Minier

A Rare chance to own a piece of the comic, only 5 pages are offered!

(Pages chosen in order of contribution.)


BONUS ORIGINAL COMIC PAGES  

Original SLAVES FOR GODS Comic Pages by Aaron Minier

Due to demand we've added 5 pages bonus pages!

(Pages chosen in order of contribution.)



RARE SPACE PRINT 

Signed and Numbered 7.25" x 4.26" Archival Prints by JOCK                     (Wytches, The Losers). 

Prints were sent into space during the filming of "LSD In Metallic Form” Video. FOR REAL!!!

 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even if you cannot contribute directly, you can still help! Please Tweet, re-link, or share this campaign on Facebook. Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to help spread the word! 


I DON'T HAVE A PAYPAL ACCOUNT, CAN I CONTRIBUTE?

If you have a debit or credit card you can contribute to the campaign, even without a PayPal account. Follow the steps to payment on Indiegogo website and click on "GO TO PAYPAL". Don’t worry if you don't have a PayPal account! You'll land on the payment page and there you can choose your own way to pay: PayPal or directly with credit or debit card.


INTERNATIONAL ORDERS

Shipping is included within the continental US only. For non continental US contributors, please contact us to define shipping costs (depending on items weight and country of residence).


THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

story:
We first would like to thank you, our audience and investors, for taking the time to check out our project. Our team knows that there are many worthy projects that you can put your money towards, and we humbly ask that you’ll invest in this one!


This is the launch of our first independent comic, and it’s quite a task. When we set out to create Phoenix Origins, we understood that crowd-sourced funding would be the perfect vehicle for not only funding the final stage of our project, but also for delivering our completed comic into the hands of our audience: comic enthusiasts like you!


Our project’s fundraising goal of $6500 will cover the cost of production, shipping, and payment for our all-star caliber artists (more details below). Our goal is ensuring that our final product is professional, our stories compelling, and our characters well-developed. Also, we want to ensure that our finished physical print run will be of the highest quality for our investors.


The initial funding for our project came out of pocket from Sean, Alex, and Keith as we tested out artists. We’re just 3 guys from Queens, NY who have a very well thought out, well planned out idea that we’d like to turn into a great comic series.


We’d like to make it clear to you that we’re not paying ourselves out of this funding campaign, and we’re bringing this to you at the actual cost of production in order to quickly develop and deliver the first issue of our comic. Ultimately, we would like to make money by selling future issues of this series, and develop the full arc of this story. We are exploring digital delivery options via Comixology and/or other avenues for future installments.


Publishing a comic book has been a life-long dream for us. With your help, we’re going to make that dream a reality, and produce something truly awesome.


STORY



The Continent of Xenos is being torn apart by a savage war. The indigenous Elves, warriors and magicians of the highest caliber are busy exterminating the fledgling society of humans. Cities are ravaged, and entire kingdoms are eradicated overnight. The Humans of this world band together under a great king, Thalion, to turn the tides of war in the favor of humankind. Isaac is just another warrior, with a loving family left behind in a peaceful town - far from the front lines. Isaac is destined to either live or die by his sword until the Gods chose another path for him.


One fateful night Isaac fell into Death's embrace, mortally wounded, before the Gods revoked his right to die. Fearing for the survival of their human followers, the Gods anoint him their champion, the Immortal Phoenix. Now fighting not only for his Kingdom, but as the hand of his Gods, the Phoenix wages war against the mightiest of Elves, Vakarian, whose knowledge of the Arcane makes him the only person on the continent with the potential skillset to bring the Phoenix to an end.


Led by the Crown-Princess and General of the armed forces Arya, the Elves seek to reclaim the continent which they have lost to the humans. The inevitable showdown will have world-altering, cataclysmic consequences.



----


Our project, Phoenix Origins, aims to become a full-color, monthly comic series distributed digitally. It's high fantasy to the core, in a completely unique and original world. The complexity and depth of the world itself, and the people who live there make the entire story feel organic, and tangible.


Phoenix Origins is a classic hero's tale - but with a giant twist. We explore the darker side of being a hero, when the choices our hero is faced with range from bad to worse. What happens after your destiny-bound immortal hero accomplishes what it is he is set out to do. What questionable choices must a good character make for the greater good, and at what cost?


This project is the first installment in the overarching, multimedia universe that we call the Phoenix Project, with further chapters of this world’s chronology already being penned by our creative team.


The universe that the Phoenix inhabits lives and breathes on its own. The true magic of this world is that it is open to interpretation. This story arc, the origins of Isaac, the first immortal Phoenix, is only glimpse of our world. Isaac’s tale will introduce many other characters in his travels, some friendly, most dangerous, all self-motivated.


A hero is only as interesting as the obstacles he must overcome, and Vakarian is Isaac’s nemesis. Vakarian’s history is a darker tale that speaks of his repeated attempts at redemption, and the cruel hand that fate can deal to one person. Constantly bludgeoned by the cataclysmic world events, forces of nature beyond his control, and also his own choices, Vakarian is not necessarily an antagonist, rather another tortured character on the other side of the global battle - one who some of our friends have related to more than Isaac!


Our world operates in shades of gray. It's up to you to decide which side is right and just when all of the cards are on the table.



BEHIND THE STORY



The roots of the Phoenix Origins go back over a decade, when our lead writer, Keith R. Sokol, was first introduced to J.R.R. Tolkien’s Lord of the Rings, and to George R.R. Martin’s Tales of Ice and Fire. Since having his eyes opened to those touchstone, densely woven tales of destruction, warfare, and salvation, Keith has long been writing short stories and novellas set in his own fantasy worlds. The more he wrote, the more the tales became connected through the geography, populations, and arcane religions, and the universe where our tale takes place was forged.


The Phoenix, as a character, began to develop and mature as Keith was introduced to ancient mythology, and as he further studied world religions. With roots in Old and New Testament gravitas and the colorful history of Greek and Roman mythology, our protagonist the Phoenix - as a hero of legend - was born.


Keith met Sean Torney in April, 2013 at an event for the local video game retailer that Keith was working for. They instantly bonded over a mutual interest in games, movies, books, and Sean’s beautiful dog Kali (who is a huge Firefly fan, and is the team’s nerdy muse).


.


Sean Torney is a leader at heart. It's something Sean further developed while serving in the U.S. Air Force. It turned out that Sean and Keith were attending the same college, and Sean asked Keith to write reviews for upcoming games on his newly launched website, Tornstar Plays (which draws its name from Sean’s gamer tag on XBox Live). Keith was introduced to Alexander Ally as part of that project. Keith brought them up to speed on the mostly-written manuscript of his Phoenix novel that he’d been working on for about three years, and both Sean and Alex fell in love with the universe of the Phoenix.


Sean and Alex collaborated with Keith to create new characters and expand existing ones, and together, they scripted events in the world Keith had created. We originally set out to create a video game (more on that later!), and ultimately decided to introduce this world to our audience in comic book form - before giving them the opportunity to interact with it!


While it's true that he is the creator and writer of Phoenix Origins, nobody has ever accused Keith of being a good artist. Stick figures are pretty much the limit of his artistic talent.


Exploring how to bring this project to life, Sean brought in his life-long friend Jason Allen, an Emmy Award winning cinematographer and producer, who has previous marketing experience directing and producing crowd-funded projects. Jason put us in touch with experienced independent comic producers Kurt Christensen and Reilly Brown (Power Play), Vito Delsante (Stray), and Dan Hosek (File 13) to help build our project’s game plan, and now we’re ready to take things to the next step.


The crew formed a company, Tornstar Development LTD. Alex is the business mind behind the effort - determining operating and production costs, taking meetings with potential collaborators, handling legal paperwork, setting and tracking deadlines to ensure that this project (and others in the works) get made quickly, and efficiently!


Keith, Sean, and Alex ventured to New York Comic Con Special Edition earlier this summer where we met Scott Ambruson after interviewing numerous artists.  Scott was a perfect match for the project, and joined the Tornstar Development team as our lead illustrator. He is a regular fixture on the East Coast Artist Alley circuit, specializing in fan art, pinups, and cover art.  His pinup work is most notably unique for his “two worlds collide” style - badass, yet classically beautiful female warriors. Scott’s professional work includes being the Co-creator of the characters Detectives Damion Chase and Kristen Hunt of Chase and Hunt prominently featured in the CRIME WAVE ANTHOLOGY comic book (published by 3JProductions).  He has done work on the comic book TRAILER PARK of TERROR, by Imperium comics.  Scott is currently doing covers for titles including the comic books AXTECA, (published by Red Stylo Media), and DESTINY QUEEN of THIEVES (published by Scare Tactix Graphix).


The entire physical world of the Phoenix is fully mapped out. Additionally, we have already written multiple comic book story arcs, scripts for an RPG video game, and script outlines for potential web series, short films, and we’re working on a feature length story as well! This universe can extend far into the future with the amount of content we have created already... Phoenix Origins is only the first step into that larger world!


We’re very excited to share our universe with you. Enjoy the book, and thank you in advance for all of your help promoting and funding Phoenix Origins!




RISKS/CHALLENGES


The inherent challenge in funding a creator owned comic as a first time comic producer is a lack of publicity/exposure. We have worked extremely hard to build relationships with established artists who want to support us on their social media in advance of this campaign, but you can help us further! Please share this with your friends and family and post links to our IndieGoGo campaign on your social media - it could be that little bit extra exposure from YOU that helps fund this project!


Our next hurdle has been that creating a comic from scratch has a huge learning curve. That said, so far we are finding our way through that labyrinth with the help of our advisors, and doing our best to anticipate and budget for all production costs.


Finally, our team has a lot of outside-of-comics responsibilities at this point. Between family obligations, school, and our paying jobs, we are all budgeting significant time out of our week - every week - to bring this project to fruition, and we will continue to do everything we can to see it become a success. So far this hasn’t presented a conflict for us as we’ve written and edited the Phoenix Origins series, and we don’t foresee it being an issue as we move into pencil, ink, color, letters, and publishing.


The ultimate goal for the Tornstar Development team is that Keith, Sean, and Alex would like to produce digitally distributed, independent comics on a full-time basis. This project is our first step towards that goal! Ideally we would like for our first issue of Phoenix Origins to be so successful that our team will see a modest profit after the production costs are paid, and also that by distributing and selling our completed first issue, we’ll get the momentum to sustain the whole series through direct sales without further crowdfunding campaigns!


All funds raised by this IndieGogo will go directly towards the completion, publication, promotion, and delivery of our comic, Phoenix Origins.  We have worked out our costs to:

-$180 per page for artwork (pencil, ink, color, and letters)

-$2900 for printing/shipping (comic books as well as concept art prints)


REACH GOALS


All funds above the $6500 goal will help us add content to the first book, but the more you contribute to Phoenix Origins, the more you get!

-If we reach $9500, we’ll add an additional 12 pages to Issue #1. **

-If we reach $10,500, we’ll add in the first 5 pages of Issue #2 on top of that. **

-If we reach $14,500, we’ll be able to bring you Issue #2! **


** Included for all reward levels that include Issue #1!)


As we approach our funding goals, more stretch goals and rewards will be added. We may add in art-work, extend certain story arcs, or create solo books for our characters - detailing their lives before the events of the story!


Even if you can’t contribute money to the project, it’d be tremendously helpful if you share this with friends and fellow comic enthusiasts who might be interested! Thank you in advance for all of your support.

Also, we want to ensure that our finished physical print run will be of the highest quality for our investors. The initial funding for our project came out of pocket from Sean, Alex, and Keith as we tested out artists. We’re just 3 guys from Queens, NY who have a very well thought out, well planned out idea that we’d like to turn into a great comic series.We’d like to make it clear to you that we’re not paying ourselves out of this funding campaign, and we’re bringing this to you at the actual cost of production in order to quickly develop and deliver the first issue of our comic. Ultimately, we would like to make money by selling future issues of this series, and develop the full arc of this story. We are exploring digital delivery options via Comixology and/or other avenues for future installments.Publishing a comic book has been a life-long dream for us. With your help, we’re going to make that dream a reality, and produce something truly awesome. STORYThe Continent of Xenos is being torn apart by a savage war. The indigenous Elves, warriors and magicians of the highest caliber are busy exterminating the fledgling society of humans. Cities are ravaged, and entire kingdoms are eradicated overnight. The Humans of this world band together under a great king, Thalion, to turn the tides of war in the favor of humankind. Isaac is just another warrior, with a loving family left behind in a peaceful town - far from the front lines. Isaac is destined to either live or die by his sword until the Gods chose another path for him.One fateful night Isaac fell into Death's embrace, mortally wounded, before the Gods revoked his right to die. Fearing for the survival of their human followers, the Gods anoint him their champion, the Immortal Phoenix. Now fighting not only for his Kingdom, but as the hand of his Gods, the Phoenix wages war against the mightiest of Elves, Vakarian, whose knowledge of the Arcane makes him the only person on the continent with the potential skillset to bring the Phoenix to an end.Led by the Crown-Princess and General of the armed forces Arya, the Elves seek to reclaim the continent which they have lost to the humans. The inevitable showdown will have world-altering, cataclysmic consequences.----Our project, Phoenix Origins, aims to become a full-color, monthly comic series distributed digitally. It's high fantasy to the core, in a completely unique and original world. The complexity and depth of the world itself, and the people who live there make the entire story feel organic, and tangible.Phoenix Origins is a classic hero's tale - but with a giant twist. We explore the darker side of being a hero, when the choices our hero is faced with range from bad to worse. What happens after your destiny-bound immortal hero accomplishes what it is he is set out to do. What questionable choices must a good character make for the greater good, and at what cost?This project is the first installment in the overarching, multimedia universe that we call the Phoenix Project, with further chapters of this world’s chronology already being penned by our creative team.The universe that the Phoenix inhabits lives and breathes on its own. The true magic of this world is that it is open to interpretation. This story arc, the origins of Isaac, the first immortal Phoenix, is only glimpse of our world. Isaac’s tale will introduce many other characters in his travels, some friendly, most dangerous, all self-motivated.A hero is only as interesting as the obstacles he must overcome, and Vakarian is Isaac’s nemesis. Vakarian’s history is a darker tale that speaks of his repeated attempts at redemption, and the cruel hand that fate can deal to one person. Constantly bludgeoned by the cataclysmic world events, forces of nature beyond his control, and also his own choices, Vakarian is not necessarily an antagonist, rather another tortured character on the other side of the global battle - one who some of our friends have related to more than Isaac!Our world operates in shades of gray. It's up to you to decide which side is right and just when all of the cards are on the table.BEHIND THE STORYThe roots of the Phoenix Origins go back over a decade, when our lead writer, Keith R. Sokol, was first introduced to J.R.R. Tolkien’s Lord of the Rings, and to George R.R. Martin’s Tales of Ice and Fire. Since having his eyes opened to those touchstone, densely woven tales of destruction, warfare, and salvation, Keith has long been writing short stories and novellas set in his own fantasy worlds. The more he wrote, the more the tales became connected through the geography, populations, and arcane religions, and the universe where our tale takes place was forged.The Phoenix, as a character, began to develop and mature as Keith was introduced to ancient mythology, and as he further studied world religions. With roots in Old and New Testament gravitas and the colorful history of Greek and Roman mythology, our protagonist the Phoenix - as a hero of legend - was born.Keith met Sean Torney in April, 2013 at an event for the local video game retailer that Keith was working for. They instantly bonded over a mutual interest in games, movies, books, and Sean’s beautiful dog Kali (who is a huge Firefly fan, and is the team’s nerdy muse).. Sean Torney is a leader at heart. It's something Sean further developed while serving in the U.S. Air Force. It turned out that Sean and Keith were attending the same college, and Sean asked Keith to write reviews for upcoming games on his newly launched website, Tornstar Plays (which draws its name from Sean’s gamer tag on XBox Live). Keith was introduced to Alexander Ally as part of that project. Keith brought them up to speed on the mostly-written manuscript of his Phoenix novel that he’d been working on for about three years, and both Sean and Alex fell in love with the universe of the Phoenix.Sean and Alex collaborated with Keith to create new characters and expand existing ones, and together, they scripted events in the world Keith had created. We originally set out to create a video game (more on that later!), and ultimately decided to introduce this world to our audience in comic book form - before giving them the opportunity to interact with it!While it's true that he is the creator and writer of Phoenix Origins, nobody has ever accused Keith of being a good artist. Stick figures are pretty much the limit of his artistic talent.Exploring how to bring this project to life, Sean brought in his life-long friend Jason Allen, an Emmy Award winning cinematographer and producer, who has previous marketing experience directing and producing crowd-funded projects. Jason put us in touch with experienced independent comic producers Kurt Christensen and Reilly Brown (Power Play), Vito Delsante (Stray), and Dan Hosek (File 13) to help build our project’s game plan, and now we’re ready to take things to the next step.The crew formed a company, Tornstar Development LTD. Alex is the business mind behind the effort - determining operating and production costs, taking meetings with potential collaborators, handling legal paperwork, setting and tracking deadlines to ensure that this project (and others in the works) get made quickly, and efficiently!Keith, Sean, and Alex ventured to New York Comic Con Special Edition earlier this summer where we met Scott Ambruson after interviewing numerous artists.  Scott was a perfect match for the project, and joined the Tornstar Development team as our lead illustrator. He is a regular fixture on the East Coast Artist Alley circuit, specializing in fan art, pinups, and cover art.  His pinup work is most notably unique for his “two worlds collide” style - badass, yet classically beautiful female warriors. Scott’s professional work includes being the Co-creator of the characters Detectives Damion Chase and Kristen Hunt of Chase and Hunt prominently featured in the CRIME WAVE ANTHOLOGY comic book (published by 3JProductions).  He has done work on the comic book TRAILER PARK of TERROR, by Imperium comics.  Scott is currently doing covers for titles including the comic books AXTECA, (published by Red Stylo Media), and DESTINY QUEEN of THIEVES (published by Scare Tactix Graphix).The entire physical world of the Phoenix is fully mapped out. Additionally, we have already written multiple comic book story arcs, scripts for an RPG video game, and script outlines for potential web series, short films, and we’re working on a feature length story as well! This universe can extend far into the future with the amount of content we have created already... Phoenix Origins is only the first step into that larger world!We’re very excited to share our universe with you. Enjoy the book, and thank you in advance for all of your help promoting and funding Phoenix Origins!RISKS/CHALLENGESThe inherent challenge in funding a creator owned comic as a first time comic producer is a lack of publicity/exposure. We have worked extremely hard to build relationships with established artists who want to support us on their social media in advance of this campaign, but you can help us further! Please share this with your friends and family and post links to our IndieGoGo campaign on your social media - it could be that little bit extra exposure from YOU that helps fund this project!Our next hurdle has been that creating a comic from scratch has a huge learning curve. That said, so far we are finding our way through that labyrinth with the help of our advisors, and doing our best to anticipate and budget for all production costs.Finally, our team has a lot of outside-of-comics responsibilities at this point. Between family obligations, school, and our paying jobs, we are all budgeting significant time out of our week - every week - to bring this project to fruition, and we will continue to do everything we can to see it become a success. So far this hasn’t presented a conflict for us as we’ve written and edited the Phoenix Origins series, and we don’t foresee it being an issue as we move into pencil, ink, color, letters, and publishing.The ultimate goal for the Tornstar Development team is that Keith, Sean, and Alex would like to produce digitally distributed, independent comics on a full-time basis. This project is our first step towards that goal! Ideally we would like for our first issue of Phoenix Origins to be so successful that our team will see a modest profit after the production costs are paid, and also that by distributing and selling our completed first issue, we’ll get the momentum to sustain the whole series through direct sales without further crowdfunding campaigns!All funds raised by this IndieGogo will go directly towards the completion, publication, promotion, and delivery of our comic, Phoenix Origins.  We have worked out our costs to:-$180 per page for artwork (pencil, ink, color, and letters)-$2900 for printing/shipping (comic books as well as concept art prints)REACH GOALSAll funds above the $6500 goal will help us add content to the first book, but the more you contribute to Phoenix Origins, the more you get!-If we reach $9500, we’ll add an additional 12 pages to Issue #1. **-If we reach $10,500, we’ll add in the first 5 pages of Issue #2 on top of that. **-If we reach $14,500, we’ll be able to bring you Issue #2! **** Included for all reward levels that include Issue #1!)As we approach our funding goals, more stretch goals and rewards will be added. We may add in art-work, extend certain story arcs, or create solo books for our characters - detailing their lives before the events of the story! Even if you can’t contribute money to the project, it’d be tremendously helpful if you share this with friends and fellow comic enthusiasts who might be interested! Thank you in advance for all of your support.

story:
Golma, a world ruled by 12 nations teeters on the edge of destruction. Draxel, the Emperor of the Nation of Karnarth has unearthed unknown technology that grants great power, but at what cost? The people look to their leaders for protection, but hopelessness and fear spreads as nations topple. Are there any who can contest such power? Surely not a monk, nomad, and bum... Surely...

The Project

-Hi I’m Zach! Thank you for taking the time to check out my project! I started World of Golma in 2013 with a handful of talented writers to create an overview of the world. Last year I began making the first graphic novel in the series and campaigned on Indiegogo. Now 6 months later the project is almost complete and ready to send to editors and the PRINTERS.

What is GOLMA?

-Golma is a graphic novel currently sitting at 100* pages of story inspired by the great flood. 

"And the Lord smelled a sweet savour; and the Lord said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done." Genesis 8:21

-From a very early age I had wondered what the world was like before the flood. I imagined the technology and landscape to me something akin to fantasy and magic. If at the peak of humanities power and corruption, what if it was not wiped from existence? What if there were remnants of that world waiting to be discovered?

 

Characters

-A wide variety of characters populate the world of Golma. Some want to help, some want to help THEMSELVES... So be careful who you trust...

 

PRINTS

-All prints are 11"x17"-

(Zach a1, a2, and a3 are all just the Zach Print, an error on my part).

Ceage O'Seanachain                                                              Matt Weldon

        Twitter  Instagram                                                           Twitter Youtube     

Brad Ashworth                                                                Zach Bradley

Twitter Youtube                                                                     Twitter       

 

Stretch Goals...

Including Kickstarter ($1,882)

REACHED- $1500 - Guest artists pages #underceage

REACHED- $3000 - Special print for all physical purchases

 

 

REACHED- $5000 - extra sketchbook pages!

- $10000 - Talk about it when when we get there...

 

 

Risk and Rewards

-Risk: The only risk made by backing the project is having a slight delay of delivery based on factors that are beyond my control.  

-Rewards: Awesome story, awesome art, awesome community, what is there not to like! 

You made it this far, have some more art!

story:
Brows, Brows, Brows!

Brows [Sarah Baird, Colleen Allerton, Michael Glaviano, Joel Flachsbart, and Andy Ledford] is The New Movement’s first troupe pioneering the latest form to come out of the theater: The Dusty. The form’s premise is simple–no sweep edits, ever. The outcome is an extravagant, free-for-all of intricate connections and relationship webs bringing together the best that “high brow” and “low brow” have to offer for audiences. Since forming in late 2012, Brows has developed a strong following and exciting show experience (including the notorious “brows!” chant). Audiences are conistantly wowed by the speed, dexterity, and intricacy of Brows’ improv, while fellow improvisers will be curious how they can embrace this exciting, new form.

Brows + Del Close = Party Times

Brows was recently accepted to the Del Close Marathon hosted by UCB in New York for a super rad June 30 timeslot. Since none of us are pilots and/or have wings, we're trying to figure out financing to get our happy selves up there and would appreciate your help more than you would know. The funds donated would go to offset the cost of transportation to New York from New Orleans and all those expensive parts of travel that really add up when you multiply them by five.

Perks! We've Got 'Em

We're going to make all this worth your while, of course, with some pretty fantastic perks. Check it out.

Helping Hands

Given cash dollars (thanks, you're a gem!) and still want to help out? Send this link to any fans of comedy, New Orleans, comedy in New Orleans getting some big time New York props, cats named Sherman, dogs named Faye, or onesies.

story:
Short Summary

"Tegan and Sarah are impossible to define.  Equal parts Hip Hop Danceparty and Little House on the Prairie, their show combines narrative with fast-paced absurdity.  Deliberately non-concept, this duo will win you over with charm and skill.  In the time of chimpanzees there was a monkey.  Its name was Tegan and Sarah."

What We Need & What You Get

"We need help with travel and accomodations, and without you this opportunity might be impossible!" 

20$ Donation: Hand-Written Thank You Card

50$ Donation: Video Thank You posted online

100$ Donation: Official Sponsor (Tour mentions and added to press materials)

200$ Donation: All of the above perks, plus use of your name in each set we do for the next year.

300$ Donation: All of the above perks, plus use of a framed photo shrine of you present during every set for a year.

1000$ Donation: A civil partnership with your choice of improviser. (based on availability)

The Impact

Vancouver has a thriving Improv community, and it is important our members get a chance to showcase work in the festival circuit.  Duofest is North America's only festival devoted solely to Improv Duos.  Tegan and Sarah are an Improv Duo.  It's only natural to help them get there.
 
Also: Cheesesteak.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page via social media, and spread the word.

story:
Knight Seeker Vol. 3 Blades of Justice

My name is Eric Cooper and I’m the creator and author of the Knight Seeker novels. I’ve decided to share with you the passion behind my work and the handful of artists, writers, and actors that have come together to present Knight Seeker to the world. This Indiegogo page was created to help fund the costs of the artwork and editing of the 3rd novel called Blades of Justice.

Novel # 3 Blades of Justice is the third installment that you kind people are financial backing which takes place in Philadelphia, the city of Brotherly Love. A vicious axe-wielding vigilante known as Guillotine is wreaking mayhem upon the city. Guillotine takes it upon himself to dispense the ultimate punishment to corrupt individuals who break the law.

            Knight Seeker along with the local authorities try to keep the ever growing body count from escalating as a secret agency of the United States Government adds another element of complexity to the intense situation.

Knight Seeker Vol. 1

Novel# 1 is truly the foundation and the beginning of Knight Seeker, which is based in the real world; present day and present time that dives into the story of our hero. Nygel Spinner is a college kid who comes across an extraterrestrial event that almost ended his life, but through the chaotic episode he survived and was forcefully given alien devices and superhero human abilities to become the ultimate hunter. As Nygel starts to discover his newly found powers evil is at work as an ancient demon sorcerer named Warlord Sage is resurrected in our time and uses his mystical dark powers to establish himself as the drug lord of New York City in attempts to take over the drug territories on the East Coast. With the help of his mutant henchman Tygron, Sage is closer in achieving his goal, and destined to open the gates of hell to destroy all of mankind. (There are 316 page and 50 illustrations)

Knight Seeker Vol. 2

Novel #2 Crimes of Passion begins at the Vatican when it was first being constructed, and an artifact is stored in a vault to be locked away from the world. That is until present day when the artifact is removed from the Vatican vault and is placed on display for a charity event in New York City.

            The City of New York is placed on lock down as two powerful mutants run rampant through the Big Apple. One of the mutants is named Graviton an exiled Roman Catholic Priest who is trying to reconnect to his old life after escaping from a hibernation facility. The other mutant that is tied into this action adventure is Sting, a jewelry thief who takes on the task to steal the coveted artifact. Knight Seeker is trapped in the middle of the conflict as the N.Y.P.D, U.S. Marshals, and a high tech task group tries to maintain order in the city. (There are 435 pages and 39 illustrations)

 

Here are the rewards for this program

Watcher Tier $5

 

**All Tiers from Detective and on will receive name acknowledgements in Knight Seeker Vol. 3**

Detective Tier $25

 

Vigilante Tier $40

 

Hero Tier $55

 

Super Villain Tier $70

 

Superhero Tier $100 (Go to KnightSeeker.com to see all Art Prints)

 

Super Warrior Tier $150

 

Knight Seeker Tier $350

story:
A quiet gig in a desolate Hell’s Angels bar unexpectedly turns violent! MALLORY has been abducted! One by one the girls of ANGORA NAPKIN fall prey to the sinister machinations orchestrated by the psychotic über-nerd known only as MR. OTAKU. What diabolical Master Plans does he hold in store for this luscious trio??? 


With the success of the Angora Napkin graphic novel and the animated TV pilot on Teletoon I decided to begin a second Angora Napkin book. The challenge this time was to do it in full colour and serialize it online before publication.

 

On June 1st I began the online serialization of the original Eisner nominated graphic novel at the Angora Napkin website (http://angoranapkin.com/) as a lead up to the sequel, “Harvest of Revenge”.

 

While the hunt is on, at the moment the project is without a commitment from a publisher and as such has been created over the last 2 years completely independent of any source of revenue. This has been very taxing on my ability to work full-time on the book since it’s inception in 2009 and is also very hard on the wallet.

 

The funding for this will help sustain me to the end of the project (there’s still ¾ of the book left to colour) and will help finance the independent printing of the book should a suitable publisher not be found. Not only are you supporting the production of the book, you’ll be subject to a bunch of sweet perks by doing so!

 

So if you haven’t yet had a chance to experience Angora Napkin, then please check out the entire animated pilot online and follow along with the web serials! My hope is that you’ll not only enjoy the crazy world of Angora Napkin but help spread the word to others! I’d love to be able to continue to tell new Angora Napkin stories and the more fans demanding it the better!
