So if you haven’t yet
had a chance to experience Angora Napkin, then please check out the entire
animated pilot online and follow along with the web serials! My hope is that
you’ll not only enjoy the crazy world of Angora Napkin but help spread the word
to others! I’d love to be able to continue to tell new Angora Napkin stories
and the more fans demanding it the better!

story:
Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign for my upcoming comic book series, MGD: Vampire Hunter. This fundraiser will focus on raising funds for issue number one in a five part series. I've already written the script and had it copyrighted, had a promotional image created by the insanely talented Matthew Bowers, and have several publishing ideas in mind. Literally the only thing your donations will go towards is hiring an artist to create issue number one.

I have my degree in media & film and recently I've been steering away from the film side and sticking with media and journalism. This is how and why I've decided to take a stab at the comic book world. During this whole quest I've been helped by the fabulous Lia Scott Price - the author and creator of her own comic book series, Vampire Guardian Angels. If you know her, and love her as I do, then this is just another good reason to help me make MGD: Vampire Hunter a reality; as Lia will be appearing in the comic book as the lead antagonist.

MGD: Vampire Hunter can best be described from a synopsis in a previous press release: "Welcome to the New Jersey Shore, specifically New Point Lake; a quiet little town sandwiched between two of the State’s biggest party spots. Now that the top rated reality show has pulled out of the area, the citizens of Exit 98 had hoped that their lives could return to normal. They were wrong…

Lured by the promise of young, drunk muscle heads and hot, dumb sunbathers, it seems that vampires have set up shop in New Point Lake and are feasting on the locals. Fronted by their leader, a nefarious red head who is way up in the vampire hierarchy, the vampires plan to make the town a breeding ground for their undead army. When the B.E.N.N.Y.S. return for the summer, it will be an all you can eat buffet.

Enter MGD, the State’s – and maybe the country’s – only chance for survival. Mike GD was just your average vampire television fanatic until the last great New Jersey slayer passed the torch on to him. Now he has dedicated his life (sort of…) to stopping the vampires in his city before they grow in numbers and expand their reach. Your typical hard bodied but kind bail bonds assistant by day is MGD: Vampire Hunter by night."

By donating to my comic book campaign you can win yourself some exciting perks including an autographed advanced copy, your name in the ending pages - further cementing your place as a vampire hunter supporter, and even being written into the pages as a cameo or a guest spot in multiple panels with dialogue.

To end things, I really just want to thank you all for support. Whether you read this page, share this page, or actually donate your money to my project, I really do appreciate all your support. This dream could not become a reality without you.

MGD: Vampire Hunter on Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/#!/MgdVampireHunter

story:
UPDATE (August 7, 2016): Circumstances have forced me to move up the date of sending the book to the printers. So from here on the perk of having your name in the book is no longer available. Please accept my sincerest apologies. Anyone who availed of this perk before this date will still have their name in the book. All other perks are still available!

Twenty Years!

Hey comic fans! I'm Dr. Carlo Jose San Juan, a practicing physician and cartoonist! I created the "Callous" comic strip series, currently published weekdays at my website callouscomics.com and daily in the comics page of Manila Bulletin.

The series features Dr. Rianne Nicah who is undergoing a journey of self-rediscovery under the guidance of her Guardian Duck, Cal Duck. It's a lighthearted look at life, both within and outside of the medical field.

"Callous" is celebrating its 20th anniversary this year! Needless to say, a lot has happened in the last two decades. From my meager start with the series in 1996 in my university newspaper, its life as a webcomic since 1997, to finally being picked up by the widest distributed national broadsheet newspaper in my country in 2012."Callous" has been a passion of mine for a great majority of my life. I care deeply for its characters and the overall series. So after 20 years, I feel I should produce a book worthy of the milestone.  In addition, I'll be having enough copies printed to be distributed to major bookstores in Metro Manila and perhaps beyond! And here's your chance to get it!


"Callous - Braving Life One Cup at a Time" will be in full, vibrant color and perfect-bound, containing selected comic strips from 2013 to 2016 (over 300 strips will be in the book!) as well as redrawn and colored comics that were previously published in black-and-white. It will also feature a look back at the last two decades and amazing guest art!

My goal is to raise $1,800 to cover the printing of 1,000 high quality, 8.27" x 5.83" (A5-landscape orientation), full-color, 150+ page softcover books as well as the order fulfillment and shipping of backer rewards.

So here's your chance to pre-order the book!

For supporters from the Philippines, please follow this link for offline pre-ordering instructions! But if you'd like to help fund this book AND get perks, this site is for you!

By the way, just spreading the word to your friends through Facebook, Twitter, and other methods (Indiegogo has some nifty tools for you to share with) will be a huge help too!

THE PERKS!

So here's the stuff that are up for grabs! All tier prices are inclusive of worldwide shipping and all pre-ordered physical books will be signed by me unless otherwise specified!
But wait, there's more! All $80 and above reward tiers get the additional perk of a Callous "Ashcan" set of WAGON Webcomic Battle Cards! This set of 12 cards will feature all previously released "Callous" character and plot device cards PLUS new Callous cards exclusive to this pack!

Now, which reward tier would you like?


Estimated Delivery Date

The books will be shipped out in January 2017 and you'll be informed when they're on their way.  You may have to allow 3-4 weeks for delivery.

Rewards that do not include the physical books will most likely be sent earlier, probably in September or October 2016.

    Haven't Read Callous Before?

    Head on over to the website and check it out!
    http://www.callouscomics.com

    And most of all, THANK YOU SO MUCH!

story:
Welcome to limitless comics! If this is your first time viewing or returning, We at limitless comics would like to thank you for your valuable time.

I wanted to recap on the current story that's taking place within these 2 issues of realms(all gods must be punished.)

Our nameless godchild who's been banished to the a Realm of lost souls

Is still trying to come to terms with her abandonment by her once ally and friend Ulislum the wizard of the realm of harvest. Alone and angry she's meeting creatures and enemies at every turn in this soulless realm. But this has not stopped her quest for finding the four elders of the Realms  and extracting extreme prejudice on the elder gods For having a hand in the murder of her parents. But before this can take place, she needs a bridger. A bein that can bridge Realms together for the asking, But they are very rare to find and without her hammer (the thunder bringer) her chances of finding the elders without it are slim to none. 

Finally Masterdawn. The queens now first general of the now rebuilding Bliska guards is In Search of the night creepers and their king. He's Demanding they join the dwindling ranks in his army. There's thousands of them and this would be a great power gain for the darkend Forrest and the queen witch ( mufstum). The ruler of this wretched Realm.

and $450 is all we need for printing cost and lettering. we crunched the numbers down to this last nickle.  With your help we make this goal limitless!

 

 

 

 

 

Short Summary

this was going to be a 12 issue maxi series, but there was no way I could tell this story in a timely fashion and explain all the origins of each and every person. So with that being said.

welcome to Realms!

 

 

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

Printing and lettering. yes folks this is all we need to bring you excitement directly to your door step.

 

 

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
DOMINION: Fall of the House of Saul

Amid a time of trouble, a family is in crisis. A King who has lost the favor of his Deity and of his people, a son seeking his father’s approval, a daughter longing for a purpose beyond being a pampered princess, and a Queen struggling behind the scenes to keep the Kingdom together.  

DOMINION: Fall of the House of Saul is a Sci-Fantasy space opera inspired by the book of 1 Samuel in the Bible.  The best way to describe it is Star Wars meets Narnia.  All of the characters are anthropomorphic (humanoid bodies with animal heads).  

Chapter 1 is available now on Comixology.   DOMINION is developed by Dr. Barron Bell, Professor of Art and Design at Liberty University and creator of the glyph nominated graphic novel Radio Free Amerika.   Daniel Hancock, creator of the audio drama END OF DARKNESS (a story of the life of Jesus) serves as co-writer.  Inks and colors are produced by the magnificent Chris Hunt and Hunter Riggs.  

OVERALL GOAL

THE GOAL of this Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign is to GO BIG and make DOMINION ROAR!!!  Crowdfunding is an excellent way to grow a brand like ours.  We have the resources to finish the comic books (Issues 1-3 and the Volume 1 Graphic Novel) but we are DREAMING BIG to take DOMINION Fall of the House of SAUL to the next level of family-friendly entertainment.  Can you imagine with us...

DOMINION Audiobook

DOMINION Animated series or Feature Film

Can you also see...

DOMINION Study guide and educational materials

DOMINION Toys - Action Figures and Vehicles

DOMINION Video Game for consoles and PC

The Almighty has called us to do this for His glory.  This is not just a comic book but a calling.  We will strike a blow for the Kingdom and lives will be changed for the better because of what we do here.  What has The Almighty called you to do? Please spread the word to family, friends, comic book geeks, church pastors, youth group leaders, parents who homeschool, etc.  DOMINION is a new way to look at the Old Testament.  We are in a battle for the hearts and minds of the now and the future.  Will you join us in the fight? 

"Every battle brings us one step closer to the Almighty!" -Commander Abner, Leader of the Seraphim Marines.

Reviews for Chapter 1

"My copy of Dominion Chapter One arrived today - wow! A big hand to the creative team and especially Dr. Barron Bell - fantastic art, atmospheric inking, and spot-on colour, it is really superb. I particularly liked the Libnah segment and the Goliath footprint moment!

I see that Chapter Two is out in December and I’d love to get my order in, once it’s available!

Best wishes and God bless,"
Eleanor Stirling

"Received my copy of issue #1 yesterday, my son and I both loved it, he's 13 and reads like there's no tomorrow."

Matt Baker

"This solid graphic novel is based on the book of 1 Samuel in the Bible, which is a great choice for a comic storyline. Familial tension and political undertones rise through Chapter One, with the potential for action, romance, and a "big bad" on the horizon. If you know the story of Saul, the correlations to the Biblical historical context in this chapter are brilliant, as is the ingenuity that went into adapting that story into a sci-fi/fantasy hybrid."

Isaac Edlund- Infinity Bros Podcast

 

DOMINION: Chapter 2

We are almost finished with the production of DOMINION Chapter 2 coming in December.  Prince Johnathan recaps the beginning of the battle of Mishmash a great victory for DOMINION over their hated foe, the Philistines. In the meantime, Princess Michal, tired of living the life of a pampered princess finds her calling as a protector of the innocent from marauders taking advantage of the crumbling frontier of DOMINION.   Issue 2 will be a 30-page comic book written by Dr. Bell, Daniel Hancock with Inks and Colors by Christopher Hunt.   

Digital Release date- December 2020.

Chapter 2 pages

Cover

Variant Cover

 

Page 1

Page 2

Page 3

Page 4

Page 5

 

Risks & Challenges

With the COVID-19 pandemic, this can introduce unpredictable issues or delays. We will ensure transparency and update our backers should any problems arise. We intend to deliver Chapter 2 in digital form in December and print copies starting in January. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you are not able to support DOMINION by contributing money. That's OK! One of the most important ways you can support this project is by sharing this campaign with your friends and other passionate fans of family-friendly content. Show your support by sharing on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, or any other social media platforms that can help us get the word out.

story:
Help Fund Phenomenopolis!

Hey there internet world! My name is Ted Cronie, aka CATNIP and I've been working on my first ever graphic novel, Phenomenopolis~!
Indie GoGo says I should introduce myself, check, tell you about my background...
Well I'm an artist who grew up in Powell River, BC,  and ever since I can remember, I've been drawing! Always doodling, painting, and in my teenagehood, took up doing murals with spraypaint! Its been one helluva creative life, and I'm always on the go with multiple projects at once.
One medium  that has stayed near and dear to my heart are comics! The way they lead the eye, captivate the story and express on many different layered levels just makes me feel at home... Especially when I'm makin em!

So yes... my dream campaign... I originally made a Phenomenopolis oneshot in 2009 which was when I decided to create a world for my doodles. This oneshot was 30 pages long and depicted a kid named Andrew Dreamer discovering bits and pieces of his hometown ontop of a floating island!


Since then the story and world has elaborated itself through my paintings and short comics, and finally in 2014 I self published the first chapter issue of Phenomenopolis with a puny run of 60 issues, which sold out fast! :)

Here's a couple pages from the first chapter, entitled "As Above, So Below"

You can read the whole chapter on my facebook page here,
Chapter One: As above, So below
The second chapter is comin' along swimmingly, but I'd love some support along the way to ensure it  a successful release!
The final book will contain 5 chapters, as one cohesive story with a few of my minicomics thrown in to demonstrate background and character development! It will be filled with alot of fun adventures and even funner (more fun) illustration!

So now that I've explained the project, I'll explain myself!
I currently live on a bus on farmland here in Powell River. Its beautiful and amazing, however, being an artist has its perks and its hardships! I make some money from an artshop I help run called Kaleidoscope here in town, where I display my paintings, comics, prints and whatever else I decide to create :)
As you may have guessed, I'm entirely dedicated to my life of artistry.. Painting on walls, painting with friends, painting around the world  is my dreams come true!
Storytelling is the main function of my art,

And the community of creative minds I belong to is the driving force of my creations!
The funding I recieve from this campaign will go towards the entire printing process of all the chapters as each issue is completed, and the printing and distribution of the final book! 
Along the way, everyone who donates will recieve copies of each issue, with stickers, t-shirts, prints and many more goodies that will take us all on a Phenomenal adventure through the world of Phenomenopolis!
So far, the dream is already manifesting as a reality, and in the not too distant future, all will become real and open doors of imagination for us all!
Thank you for your support, anything helps, and everything helps to get this book published and to your lovely hands :)
Even if this IndieGoGo campaign is somehow proven defunkt, the book will be published and released in timely fashion. This page is just so we can all watch it progress!
Much love from the land of Phenomenopolis, I hope you all well in your realms of dreams!~
story_txt:
Help Fund Phenomenopolis!


 Hey there internet world! My name is Ted Cronie, aka CATNIP and I've been working on my first ever graphic novel, Phenomenopolis~!Indie GoGo says I should introduce myself, check, tell you about my background...Well I'm an artist who grew up in Powell River, BC,  and ever since I can remember, I've been drawing! Always doodling, painting, and in my teenagehood, took up doing murals with spraypaint! Its been one helluva creative life, and I'm always on the go with multiple projects at once.One medium  that has stayed near and dear to my heart are comics! The way they lead the eye, captivate the story and express on many different layered levels just makes me feel at home... Especially when I'm makin em!So yes... my dream campaign... I originally made a Phenomenopolis oneshot in 2009 which was when I decided to create a world for my doodles. This oneshot was 30 pages long and depicted a kid named Andrew Dreamer discovering bits and pieces of his hometown ontop of a floating island!Since then the story and world has elaborated itself through my paintings and short comics, and finally in 2014 I self published the first chapter issue of Phenomenopolis with a puny run of 60 issues, which sold out fast! :)Here's a couple pages from the first chapter, entitled "As Above, So Below"You can read the whole chapter on my facebook page here,Chapter One: As above, So belowThe second chapter is comin' along swimmingly, but I'd love some support along the way to ensure it  a successful release!The final book will contain 5 chapters, as one cohesive story with a few of my minicomics thrown in to demonstrate background and character development! It will be filled with alot of fun adventures and even funner (more fun) illustration!So now that I've explained the project, I'll explain myself!I currently live on a bus on farmland here in Powell River. Its beautiful and amazing, however, being an artist has its perks and its hardships! I make some money from an artshop I help run called Kaleidoscope here in town, where I display my paintings, comics, prints and whatever else I decide to create :)As you may have guessed, I'm entirely dedicated to my life of artistry.. Painting on walls, painting with friends, painting around the world  is my dreams come true!Storytelling is the main function of my art,And the community of creative minds I belong to is the driving force of my creations!The funding I recieve from this campaign will go towards the entire printing process of all the chapters as each issue is completed, and the printing and distribution of the final book! Along the way, everyone who donates will recieve copies of each issue, with stickers, t-shirts, prints and many more goodies that will take us all on a Phenomenal adventure through the world of Phenomenopolis!So far, the dream is already manifesting as a reality, and in the not too distant future, all will become real and open doors of imagination for us all!Thank you for your support, anything helps, and everything helps to get this book published and to your lovely hands :)Even if this IndieGoGo campaign is somehow proven defunkt, the book will be published and released in timely fashion. This page is just so we can all watch it progress!Much love from the land of Phenomenopolis, I hope you all well in your realms of dreams!~

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Kevin Smith. As a reader (and lover) of comics for over 30 years, I have decided to begin writing and publishing one of my own! I have multiple issues scripted and have commissioned the artwork for the first one-shot issue, but I need the $$ to pay for the art and to get it published--which also helps me get a product out there that major comics studios can see/read and decide if this is something that they would like to purchase for themselves! The story starts in Victorian London and winds up as the  adventure of two adults and two teens (along with their iron robot) as they bounce through parallel worlds on a myriad of adventures. In this one-shot story that I am trying to get published, the story takes place about a year after the group has formed. In only 16 pages, they travel to a world where Science & Inventions are mainstream and competed over, a dark, gritty 40's style noir detective world, and a world ruled by sky pirates and their automaton crewmates!

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking for a total of $2500 to cover the costs of art,publishing, trademarks, copyrights, etc. To start , I am hoping for minimum support of $25 per person (but more is always welcome!). Support of $25 will get you an autographed copy of the book and a printed "thank you" in a future issue. I am thinking that support of $100 will get you the autographed book, your name on the thank you list in a future issue and either a full-body drawing of you (or maybe your child?) in full Steampunk period gear OR (if the comic gets picked up) maybe a guest appearance as a character in the book! Good? Evil? Robot? Human? Alien? The possibilities of how you could make your comic book debut are endless!

The Impact

Speaking of endless possibilities, consider this: a concept like this does NOT have to be limited to comic book form. Mediums such as animated series, video games and movies are certainly options! Once a major company picks up original concept, they have the contacts and $$ to expand these ideas in all KINDS of ways!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to help out financially, I would greatly appreciate it if you could pass this on to those who may be interested. Surely you know SOMEONE who reads comics, has kids who reads comics, goes to the movies, etc. Any help you can give would be GREATLY appreciated!

story:
Sziasztok!

A következő egy évet (decembertől decemberig) a Nyugat+Zombik 200 oldalas képregény megrajzolására szeretném fordítani. Ehhez az egy évhez van szükségem a segítségetekre.

A jobb oldalon látható "csomagok" közül tudjátok kiválasztani az igényetek / ízlésetek / pénztárcátok számára legmegfelelőbbet. A támogatásotokért a kész képregényen túl sok apróbb és nagyobb dologra is szert tehettek.

A képregény megvalósításának évét egy szupertitkos blogon fogom dokumentláni, amihez minden támogató hozzáférést kap.


A közösségi finanszírozásról

12 ezer usd hozzávetőlegesen 3 millió huf, ami rengeteg pénz. Ez egy évi ebédem, lakásom, bkv bérletem ára, képregény és az ajándékok előállítási költsége. Ha ezt a a célösszeget sikerül elérnünk, a Nyugat+Zombik képregény egy kerek év múlva már a támogatók kezében árasztja mosolyogva a frissen nyomtatott papír szagát!
Ha mégsem érjük el, a felajánlott pénzek visszavándorolnak a csüggedt támogatók számlájára, én pedig arcot mosok és visszatérek az arculattervezéshez.

Boddah-s barátaink tavasszal már sikerrel vették a Balaton Method c. zenés dokufilm Indiegogo-kampányát, emiatt is bízom abban, hogy nem lehetetlenség ekkora összeget magyar projektre összekalapozni.


A fixed fund beállítást csak azzal a feltétellel lehet beállítani, hogy kizárólag paypal-lal lehet fizetni, ami nagyon megnehezíti a támogatást. Ezzel együtt fenntartom, hogy ha nem gyűjtünk össze elég pénzt, akkor visszaküldöm.



Köszönöm!

Köszönöm, hogy benéztél és hogy támogatod a projektet, vagy hogy megosztod, vagy hogy bíztatod a pajtásodat, hogy támogasson, vagy hogy bíztassa a pajtását. Szóval nagyon köszönöm tényleg!

Ha kérdeznétek, vagy van ötletetek további Nyugat+Zombikos támogatói ajándéktárgyakra, keressetek bátran a képregény Facebook oldalán vagy írjatok erre a címre: nyugat.zombik@gmail.com 


Minden megosztás aranyat ér!



English Summary


‘Nyugat’ is considered the most important literary journal in the first half of the 20th century in Hungary. These elegant middle-aged gentlemen - whom we all studied in literature class - become zombie-killing heroes in this mashup comic book I am preparing now.


My name is Olivér Csepella and my graduation work was the first chapter of seven. I have received surprisingly big and enthusiastic feedbacks, and it made me brave enough to decide that now I am making the whole comic book, hopefully with the help of the nice people of Indiegogo.


For your contributions, we are offering various things, including t-shirts, stickers, posters, original pages, special thanks - and of course the comic book itself. Thanks for checking this page!

story:
OUR STORY

We have William Shatner to thank for bringing us together! He instinctively knew that our combined talents would be the formula needed to create the concept of the LNL Cinematic Graphic Novel.

LNL Partners is a new creative company specializing in digital comic books and graphic novels. Our team consists of Emmy Award-winning Disney and Marvel talent with expertise in animation, music and audio, as well as world-renowned work in comic-book writing and art. We have offices in both Hollywood and New York.

LNL Partners has licensed William Shatner's sci-fi novel MAN O' WAR, and is adapting it to our new format: The Cinematic Graphic Novel. This entertainment product is designed to be viewed on all digital platforms.


OUR GOAL

Our goal is to apply advanced technologies to the art of storytelling. The MAN O' WAR Cinematic Graphic Novel is viewed like a film, yet it is also a reading experience -- creating a unique entertainment piece that blends the best of both worlds!

Fans will be able to view our digital product on their smartphones, tablets and other digital devices. The story is scored with original music and sound effects, and the text can be converted into different languages to be read around the globe.


OUR PARTNER PANELFLY

The Cinematic Graphic Novel experience is enhanced by our Digital Distribution Partner, Panelfly. By using Panelfly's  digital platform, MAN O' WAR will be released as a Cinematic Graphic Novel as well as a Digital Comic and an eBook. The entire bundled package will be digitally interconnected and layered with Bonus Content and features in an App. This will also be a revolutionary industry first!



WHERE THE MONEY GOES
We already have skin in the game! So far, the team of writers, artists and editors have contributed their talent, time and labor to create all artwork, animation, music and audio with internal funding.

For our 2015 launch we are seeking funding for creative process and digital distribution:




THE RISKS

Any new business venture has a high risk potential. We have done our level best to mitigate this with the following: 

1) Licensed a great story from a world-renowned icon: William Shatner! Mr. Shatner is extremely excited and believes in what we are creating.

2) Our team consists of world-class talent. 

3) We are working with a cutting-edge global marketing and digital-distribution company. 

For all these reasons and more, we are confident that we have all the ingredients for success. We just need one more thing...and that's YOU!



JOIN OUR MAN O' WAR TEAM!

We need your support, funding, feedback and participation in order to make this a success. 


Please review our selection of Perks; all material will be delivered between August and October 2015 -- that's our guarantee!


Join us as we launch this incredible adventure!

story:
fLoRiDa needs your help!

As a few of you may know, being artists or friends of artists, a lot goes into doing drawings of any kind. Doubly so for comics, if not more. As an artist, I use an array of materials from what goes into making the panels (paper and printer ink) to the materials for drawing (pencils, ink pens, and erasers) and finally the materials that make it come to life in colour (markers, crayons, pencils, gel pens)

I've been dreaming of getting this comic off the ground again, providing you with regular material, and being able to take fLoRiDa further up and out. I want to be able to take it to conventions and have even more people able to find us, or even better, to recognize us while we draw pictures and sign prints.

I need your help to make sure that I have all that I need to keep going. To bring Foxy and her friends to you each week. To share with you that little slice of life in my mind that brightens the day of so many. 

Two years was a long enough wait, now I want to make sure we can reach REAL anniversaries and launch date birthdays! But I can't do it without you!

What we need & what YOU get!

Everyone who donates gets their name put on a "THANK YOU!" post at the beginning of February. Everyone. Even if its the lowest amount.

For each amount more that you donate, the coolness multiplies.

Donate a little more and you get a signed art card of your favorite character. A bit more and you find yourself actually IN the comic for that day.

Not cool enough? Bigger donors actually get the art card, the featured character, AND our never before seen, never before available pin-back buttons. Four buttons with the main characters from this season on them (Foxy, Grawal, Isi, and Cyrus)

Now, if you're one of the three with a ton of money burning a hot hole in your pocket, you get all this. All of this as well as your own personal character as a secondary/background character all throughout 2014. You could be a receptionist at a doctors office, the grocer at the farmers market, someone passing by on the street, or even all of the above! You are guaranteed at -least- four times being featured in the comic.

What this means to me:

Oh cool, we get put in a cute little comic. But wait, you said 2 year wait. What if that happens again?

That, dear friend, is what I'm trying to prevent. Each donation is both a monetary contribution to keeping the comic on the right track, but it is also a tiny "Go girl! You've got this" from the people that believe in me. It helps me keep the materials I have fresh and organized and helps me boost awareness of my comic, as well as to fund some really cool gift opportunities for the followers of my comic.

Other ways you can spread the word:

Maybe you don't have the extra green to help out. Thats ok. You're still helping!

Become one of the Fans of fLoRiDa on Facebook!
https://www.facebook.com/FansOfLoRiDa

Follow us on Blogspot (where the comic will be posted)
http://florida-comic.blogspot.com

Spread the word about the fundraiser to your friends and family and any comic buddies you have that want to help out a fellow artist!


And above all, if you've gotten to this part, THANK YOU FOR READING!

story:
Existence is a comic about twelve people fight for survival during a zombie apocalypse. With the money donated you will pay for me to get the artist im using to finish the art work. The finished product I hope to sell online in places like comixology. This will then help fund issue 2 and so on.

The first comic centres on the individual characters and what was happening with them on the day everything fell apart an how they survived and came to form part of the group.

This was a basic thumbnail of page one

Here is the finished page of page one the only completed one so far. With the money I will be able to get the rest of the comic done.

 

 AndrewDeniseLiamJamesLucyTomMarciaEmilyNickPaulMeganMaisie

story:
Hello, 

i would like the thank the people that have shown interest in Vicariance and have shown your support with perks. 

 

we didn't reach our goal

But the Vicariance graphic novel series is moving forward nicely. 

I will post some links on here when they are available 

and maybe post another campaign to see if people would like to be involved in getting this graphic novel series to completion. 

 

thank you all again for your support and will post updates soon. 

 

in the mean time if you would like to follow along in the progress of vicariance 

you can catch our facebook page 

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Vicariance-Graphi...

 

stay tuned , more updates coming , 

 

Cheers, 

 

 

 

 

After efforts to replenish the earth became redundant in the early 6000’s, the world united and brought forth a mission to save an endangered human race.

Holding a selected one third of earth’s population, colonist ships were sent to seek out inhabitable planets within the Epsilon Eridani, Gliese and Alpha Centauri star systems.

This mission although successfully launched, brought tribulations to a civilization left behind on a dying planet.

 With resources depleting across the world, tensions rose to breaking point.

The abandoned became bitter and with an unsure future the social order was crumbling.

This weak and disheartened society was easily manipulated and with political promises of obtaining earth’s last small sections of resourceful environments, new dictatorships across the world were formed.

These frivolous promises forged the Terra firma wars, earth’s longest running world war to date.

The Terra firma wars spanned over a millennia, leaving the world virtually uninhabitable.

When the war reached the last resource rich regions of the oceanic it was believed unprolific.

The destruction was devastating, there was nothing left to fight for.

With a ceasefire established, alliances were forged and the last land masses left were divided into 5 sections 

New Portland

Red republic

Nippon Empire

The Oceanic union

And the European alliance

 

Although the terra firma wars were abandoned, conflicts between nations still remain.

Without a sanctioned trade agreement these nations are left to fight for their existence without assistance from outside governments.

This road for the human race has been long. Disease, poverty and famine run rampant with little help from their questionable governments.

But even in the darkest times of humanity there have always been glimpses of hope. However small, this hope can be just enough to unite the people towards a better future.

With technical advances combined with the human race’s unfathomable tenacity, this once assumed endangered spices can foresee a future and push forward with the thoughts of a better life for themselves, their children and their children’s children.  

  

But time has a knack of awarding us with complacency.

How we forget.

The fallen,

The terror,

The look in our loved ones eyes when all hope is lost.

How unprepared we become when death comes knocking once more.

and maybe post another campaign to see if people would like to be involved in getting this graphic novel series to completion. 
 
thank you all again for your support and will post updates soon. 
 
in the mean time if you would like to follow along in the progress of vicariance 
you can catch our facebook page 
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Vicariance-Graphi...
 
stay tuned , more updates coming , 
 
Cheers, 


 

 

 

 
After efforts to replenish the earth became redundant in the early 6000’s, the world united and brought forth a mission to save an endangered human race.
Holding a selected one third of earth’s population, colonist ships were sent to seek out inhabitable planets within the Epsilon Eridani, Gliese and Alpha Centauri star systems.
This mission although successfully launched, brought tribulations to a civilization left behind on a dying planet.
 With resources depleting across the world, tensions rose to breaking point.
The abandoned became bitter and with an unsure future the social order was crumbling.
This weak and disheartened society was easily manipulated and with political promises of obtaining earth’s last small sections of resourceful environments, new dictatorships across the world were formed.
These frivolous promises forged the Terra firma wars, earth’s longest running world war to date.
The Terra firma wars spanned over a millennia, leaving the world virtually uninhabitable.
When the war reached the last resource rich regions of the oceanic it was believed unprolific.
The destruction was devastating, there was nothing left to fight for.
With a ceasefire established, alliances were forged and the last land masses left were divided into 5 sections 
New Portland
Red republic
Nippon Empire
The Oceanic union
And the European alliance
 
Although the terra firma wars were abandoned, conflicts between nations still remain.
Without a sanctioned trade agreement these nations are left to fight for their existence without assistance from outside governments.
This road for the human race has been long. Disease, poverty and famine run rampant with little help from their questionable governments.
But even in the darkest times of humanity there have always been glimpses of hope. However small, this hope can be just enough to unite the people towards a better future.
With technical advances combined with the human race’s unfathomable tenacity, this once assumed endangered spices can foresee a future and push forward with the thoughts of a better life for themselves, their children and their children’s children.  
  
But time has a knack of awarding us with complacency.
How we forget.
The fallen,
The terror,
The look in our loved ones eyes when all hope is lost.
How unprepared we become when death comes knocking once more.

story:
Let's start with what The Jacket isn't. It isn't...okay let's start with what it is. It is a superhero, noir-ish, science fiction, mystery, thriller, epic 9-issue comic/graphic novel that details the exploits of a young man named Colton Emerson. Colton comes across an everyday looking jacket that grants him super-human abilities. He crosses paths with a bunch of colorful characters like the femme fatale, Penny Roux, a domestic terroist named Warren Harker, a shifty government agent, and even a tyrannical President. It is set in a near-future United States where everything we know now has been changed and oppressed. When Colton finds the jacket, it sets off a chain of events unlike anything he has ever experienced before. This campaign is set to explain the second chapter of his, and everyone else's stories.

 

This story was created by Jason Biamonte (writer) and Randy Haldeman (artist). These are two guys fresh out of college trying to make it in the world of independent comics. They've got stories to tell, and are a looking for an audience to tell them to. We're based out of Strasburg, PA, a small town full of Amish and tourists. We are running a campaign to help support our comic that we've been writing and developing for the last three years. All of the story has been completely outlined and we are now looking to finish and print ALL of the issues. Chapter 1 has already been put into print thanks to all of the wonderful support of Indie GoGo a year ago. We've come back to ask for more support to assist printing of Chapter 2.

After we print Chapter 2 we will be headed to Baltimore Comic-Con (again) in September to release the comic. We've created a slew of great and very plentiful perks for our campaign. They are detailed a bit more below. With your support we will be able to print this book, and start on Chapter 3. After we release Chapter 2 (now that we're out of college) all of the other chapters of The Jacket will follow within months of one another leading up to an exciting finale in Chapter 9. Help us get there by supporting our first printing of Chapter 2!

 

We need $500 to cover printing costs for The Jacket: Chapter 2. Otherwise it will be out-of-pocket for a couple of college graduates with lots of debt to pay back. All of the money will go towards printing Chapter 2, acquiring an ISBN for the book, and getting perks out of the door. We have no other sources of income on this project, so whatever we make here will be the only money that we have to spend on the project. So as you can see, your contributions are EXTREMELY helpful.

 

We are on a flexible campaign so ANY money we get will go to printing and help fund this book. You'll still get any perk you contributed for no matter what. We just won't be able to print as many books, or supply the books with an ISBN for sale in stores.

 

SHARE THIS PLEASE! If you can't contribute to our cause, at least pass it along to those you think would be interested in our story.

ABOUT SHIPPING: FOR ANYONE OUTSIDE OF THE U.S., PLEASE ADD THE APPROPRIATE AMOUNT OF SHIPPING TO YOUR CONTRIBUTION. THE AMOUNTS CAN BE FOUND IN THE INDIVIDUAL PERKS THAT YOU ARE CONTRIBUTING FOR!

 

Details on The Preview:

Your name will be added to the Contributor's Page of our website. You'll also receive a download for the PDF version of the ENTIRE Chapter 1 and a preview PDF of at least 12 of the 40 pages in Chapter 2.

Details on Turn the Page:

This is for those of you who already have Chapter 1. This gets your name put on our website's contributor page and INSIDE of the comic as a contributor. It also puts a signed copy of Chapter 2 in your hands before it releases at Baltimore Comic-Con.

Details on All Caught Up:

You get the signed print copies of both Chapter 1 and Chapter 2. You still get your name in Chapter 2 as a contributor and on our website's contributor page.

Details on The Keyhole Comic Deluxe:

This is a great deal for anyone looking to get all of our original comics in one shot. You get the 12-page superhero story written and drawn by Randy Haldeman, "The Midnight Redeemer" in PDF format, you get a prequel to The Jacket's main storyline titled "The Legend of Aillard Le Roux, and you get the signed print copies of The Jacket chapters 1 and 2. You still get your name on the website, and printed INSIDE Chapter 2 on the contributor's pages.

Details on The Limited Deluxe:

You get 1 of 10 limited edition sketch covers that will never be printed again for The Jacket Chapter 2 still signed by both creators. You can have ANYTHING drawn on it by Jacket artist, Randy Haldeman. These are one-of-a-kind so grab them now. You still get regular copies of Chapters 1 and 2, the PDF's of "The Midnight Redeemer" and "The Legend of Aillard Le Roux", plus your name on the website and inside of Chapter 2 on the contributor's pages.

Details on The Print Deluxe:

This is just in case the Limited Deluxe goes out, or if someone just wants to sweet prints. You'll get FOUR, that's right FOUR prints of the covers of all the books we've completed. So that is: The Jacket Chapters 1 and 2 covers, The Midnight Redeemer cover, and the cover of The Legend of Aillard Le Roux. You also get the PDF's of the comics, signed and printed copies of Chapters 1 and 2, and your name on our website and printed inside of the contributor's page of Chapter 2.

Details on The Darcey Young Print Deluxe:

Darcey Young's Website

You get everything in The Print Deluxe, plus an 11"x17" color print of the alternative cover of The Jacket: Can't Get It Out of My Head. We'll update it here when the piece is finished.

Details on Not Sold In Stores:

With this perk you get never-before-printed copies of "The Midnight Redeemer" and The Jacket's prequel comic "The Legend of Aillard Le Roux". Both comics are 12-pages and come with a small sketch inside the front covers featuring a character from each respective comic drawn by the artist Randy Haldeman. You still get everything from The Darcey Young Print Deluxe perk.

Details on The Original:

We will randomly choose a finished, inked page from The Jacket: Can't Get It Out of My Head (Chapter 2) and send it along with everything that we've offered so far, excluding The Sketch Cover edition of Chapter 2.

Details on The Cover-Up:

You get everything listed above (excluding The Sketch Cover edition of Chapter 2), including an original inked page from Chapter 2, but you also get the one-of-a-kind original piece of art by either Randy Haldeman for the cover of Chapter 2, OR the one-of-a-kind alternative cover done by Darcey Young. There are two of these perks available. The first contributor for this perk will get their choice of covers. The second contributor will get the cover that wasn't selected by the first one.

Chapter 2 Inked Cover by Randy Haldeman

 

Details on The Name Game:

We have a few main characters who are unnamed, including some that are appearing in Chapter 2. We will name them after the first three people who buy this perk. They will be named (gender doesn't matter) in the order we receive them. You will still get everything above (THIS EXCLUDES THE CHAPTER 2 SKETCH COVER AND THE COVER-UP ORIGINAL PIECES! THOSE ARE NUMBERED TO MEET THE DEMANDS OF THE PERKS LISTED!) including an original inked page from Chapter 2.

Details on The Key-Holy Grail Perk:

We will create for you a side-story comic based in the world of The Jacket where you are the main character and have an item/power. In that copy we will personally number it as the first copy ever printed. Any after will be second printing and beyond. Your character will also appear in the main story as a side character and your story will be referenced. You will receive a credit/appearance line in the future comics you are featured in. You also get everything else listed above including an original inked page from Chapter 2! (THIS EXCLUDES THE CHAPTER 2 SKETCH COVER AND THE COVER-UP ORIGINAL PIECES! THOSE ARE NUMBERED TO MEET THE DEMANDS OF THE PERKS LISTED!)

story:
MINA SAN! We reached our goal!!! THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!!!  

Yuki vs Panda will be available in print and online very soon! 

 
 

Duskleaf Media is proud to reveal our inaugural graphic novel series that will take you on the twisted journey of Japanese schoolgirl Yuki and her Panda nemesis.  

Volume 1 is an 80 PAGE FULL COLOUR comic book written by Graham Misiurak and Nick Dunec and brought to life by artist A.L. Jones.

Coddles and lampoons East-meets-West tropes from Anime, Comics and Cult Films to Video Games and Monsters.

We hope you enjoy the ride! ^_^

 

 

The tale of Yuki vs. Panda is so epic in scope, that mere words can not do it justice... but we'll give it a shot.

Yuki Lee is your average everyday martial arts prodigy with mystical powers. Despite her awesome skills and fantastic strength, all she really wants to be is... well, girly. This is something her grandfather and instructor Master Lee neither understands nor condones (after all he's trained Yuki to be a fighter all her life, not some perfumed “girly-girl.”)  But as teenagers tend to do, Yuki starts a subtle rebellion against her rigid and structured life and begins to dabble into the world of shiny lip gloss and boy bands.

All is not as it seems however and unbeknownst to Yuki, a mysterious figure from her past is about to make his presence known... like big time. If you haven’t guessed by now it’s a giant panda bear named Panda. He's  returned to exact sweet sweet ice-cold revenge on our beloved Yuki.  His plan is quite simple, KILL HER!

 

As this is our first graphic novel in the series we will be putting the funds raised toward the production of Volume 1 and all future awesomeness we create for Yuki, Panda and their friends, enemies and frenemies. 

Also don't forget about those real panda pals we are helping out with a $1 donation going to the WWF with every perk you pick!



 
**UPDATE: WE NOW HAVE 2 MORE SHIRT DESIGNS YOU MAY CHOOSE FROM
 
 





We know that not everyone can support the campaign with money even if they want to. You can help by spreading the word and sharing this campaign!

USEFUL LINKS:

YUKI VS PANDA OFFICIAL PAGE

YVP INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN

story:
50 years is quite a milestone for any pop culture character!

What started as a comic magazine in 1969, quickly became a phenomenon for the readers of the time who gravitated toward a much darker and sexier character who stood out among the other popular "super" characters of the time. In the vein of peers Uncle Creepy, Cousin Eerie and the Crypt-Keeper, she exploded in popularity and fans demanded fleshed out stories. Legendary writers and artists contributed to Vampi's history making creation. Godfather of horror and sci-fi fandom Forrest J. Ackerman came up with the concept, then underground comix legend and Wonder Woman artist Trina Robbins designed the costume, for a first cover by fantasy painting master Frank Frazetta and an interior story by Ghost Rider artist Tom Sutton. 

The depth of her stories really expanded with writer/editor Archie Goodwin (Batman, Iron Man) and José González. The two introduced major supporting characters like Adam Van Helsing and Pendragon. González wowed readers with his jaw-dropping art utilizing unparalleled detail and ink washes, pushing the boundaries of the black and white magazine format. His frontispiece illustrations and occasional covers further cemented his legacy as he contributed to nearly every issue of the decades long Warren run (also available through this campaign).

EARLY SCULPTING

story:
READ THE FREE PREVIEW OF ALL 3 CHAPTERS BY CLICKING HERE 

 

WHAT IS THE ELEMENTAL BALANCE?

The Elemental Balance is a story about 4 individuals from around the world who gain the powers of the Elements. They are known as the Elementals. They don’t know how or why they got these powers, but they all died from a natural disaster caused by the Element's energy they harness. 

The story follows their journey of finding one another in hopes of unraveling the truth behind their powers and its connection to their resurrection. Instead, they discover that they're being hunted by a mysterious force! Find out what makes them a target in the Indiegogo Exclusive premiere of the first 3 issues of The Elemental Balance. 

Elemental Balance is the first comic series published by inZane comics. The story has been written by Zain Shenwari with artwork done by Luke Horsman. 

The first 3 comics offered in this campaign have been completed, from the artwork to lettering. That equates to 64 pages of completed story content. All that remains now is a successful Indiegogo campaign. And...

We're seeking your support to fund Chapter 4 

Come and join us on this thrilling adventure and escape into the inZane World of Elemental Balance!   

PARENTAL GUIDANCE: T+ TEENS AND UP – Appropriate for teens aged 13 years and above. May contain violence, suggestive themes, and/or crude humor.

So...What's the Story Like? It’s like if Avatar the Air bender merged with Netflix’s hit show Sense8...but without the rated R stuff of course! 

MEET THE ELEMENTALS:

 ELEMENTAL BALANCE CH 1 | GROUNDBREAKING NEWS

Chapter 1, Groundbreaking News is about a new discovery! The Chapter starts off with a monologue, while scenes of a tragic incident from a memory are illustrated in the background. The monologue poses the question: if Earth was created with Elemental Energy, then what happened to those energy forces? According to the laws of Physics, energy can not be destroyed...it can only be transformed from one form to another!  

The story then diverts back to the present time and introduces our main character Chloe and her boyfriend. Chloe is obsessed with understanding the meaning behind elemental energies and goes from museum to museum to find out more about them. One day while on a museum tour, Chloe's boyfriend gets her a necklace. That day, her life changed forever.  

That night Chloe has a vivid dream that she's in Nairobi, Kenya, running away from a mudslide. She gets buried under the mudslide and dies, only to wake up and be relieved that it was all just a dream. 

Or so she thought until she found out the next morning, her dream was real!

Find out what the meaning behind Chloe's dream is in Chapter 1, Ground Breaking News.

ELEMENTAL BALANCE CH 2 | WATER UNDER THE BRIDGE

Chapter 2,  Water under the Bridge title is an idiom that means to move on from the past. As the title suggests, this chapter will reveal Chloe's past. 

Chloe and her friend Jessi are on vacation for spring break. 

But as the day progresses, their perfect getaway turns into a nightmare. 

The cruise ship they were on, is engulfed by a massive tsunami! 

Find out how Chloe survives in Chapter 2, Water Under the Bridge. 

ELEMENTAL BALANCE CH 3 | UP IN AIR

Chapter 3, Up in Air  title is an idiom that means that there's uncertainty. Like the title suggests, this chapter will reveal several mysteries. Chloe and Baraka (the Earth Elemental) thought they were going to unite with the Wind Elemental, but a new threat is revealed to them.  

Chloe and Baraka arrive in Japan and head to a local internet cafe in hopes of finding clues to the whereabouts of the Wind Elemental.   

There they meet Satoshi, a local citizen who claims he knows where the tornado happened and offers to take them there.

Desperate for leads, Chloe and Baraka follow him, but what’s in store for them will surprise you!

Find out the major reveal in Chapter 3, Up in Air. 

CRITIC reviews: 

Here's Mike from "Chico Comics Page" review of "The Elemental Balance". Click Here for the full Article.

"In comics there are indie publishers, and then there are indie publishers. There was confidence in the writing, the art, and overall design of the book. The art in here is fantastic. Everything feels like a comic I should be reading off the stands." 

Read what Trever from "Frags and Beer" thought about the first chapter of "The Elemental Balance". Click Here for the full Article. 

"I enjoyed every panel of this book, and hope to see a lot more from Luke. The pages have a lot of movement and detail. The characters look great against wonderful backgrounds. The pencils are up there with the best that I’ve seen from any company, large or indie. This book is definitely worth checking out." 

Hear what David from "The Newest Rant" had to say about "The Elemental Balance". Click Here for the full Article.

"Having now checked-out the first issue I can say I enjoyed it a great deal thanks to a mixture of fun ideas and a quick-moving plot."

And here is what CJPendragon had to say about The Elemental Balance. Click here to read the full Article. 

"The Elemental Balance is a weirdly awesome mash-up of science, superpowers, and humanity that will leave most readers vying for more. It’s well-written, with just enough suspense to have a thrill for your experience."

ABOUT ME: 

Hi, my name is Zain and I’m the writer for The Elemental Balance. I’ve always had a passion for writing stories. In fact, my first story “Game Plan” was written to impress my wife. Spoiler alert, it paid off! I find it rewarding to bring entertainment to people, that’s my niche! My style of storytelling is grounded in reality but, nonetheless, is fiction. Characters are set in unrealistic situations but have very relatable emotions. Imagine if someone could achieve greatness with a determined will, how would they react if they had powers? This is what my stories are rooted in….emotions!  

It’s fascinating what the human will allows us to achieve. They say the human body can bend steel, but the brain limits it. Isn’t it amazing how our body functions? The world around us is fascinating because its full of mysteries. Our reality seems fictitious because we’re a MIRACLE and the celebration of LIFE fuels the stories I write!

 

ABOUT THE ARTIST:

Luke Horsman is an extremely talented artist from the UK. He is well versed in many forms of art mediums. In fact, Luke did the pencils, ink, and coloring for the first three chapters. His artwork has truly brought the characters from the script to life. 

It's been a blast working with him. We mesh really well. I'm particular with scenes and visual symbolism and he's keen on creating eye-catching, bold illustrations. Together we made an excellent team!  

Check out Luke's website for awesome artwork by clicking here.

INSPIRATION:  

The story for the Elemental Balance spurred from a theory relating to actual history. It’s interesting that in ancient history, most civilizations believed the world comprised of 4 elements. Although these civilizations were geographically apart, they all believed in the SAME 4 elements; Earth, Water, Wind, and Fire. Although in modern science we know of a whole periodic table of elements, interestingly there are only 4 states of matter and these 4 states of matter closely resemble the attributes of the 4 elements. From that, one idea led to another, and the product of those combobulated ideas became the story foundation for the Elemental Balance. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

STATUS OF THE COMICS:  

The entire Elemental Balance series story has been completely written and is going to be a 10-comic series. The pencils/inking/coloring and lettering have been completed for the first 3 chapters and have been entirely self-funded. We have already started working on Chapter 4 and anticipate it to be complete by the end of the year. For our current Indiegogo Campaign, we’ve decided to be proactive and have already reached out to vendors, received quotes, and identified preferred suppliers. In order to ensure quality, we took a step further and ordered samples at premium rates just to “feel” the quality. All that remains now is a successful campaign and sending those comics to you!

WHAT WILL WE DO WITH THE FUNDS?  

All the funds raised will be used towards funding the next issues of Elemental Balance. We want to make sure that those who supported the campaign get to enjoy the conclusion of the series. The cost will go towards the penciler, inker, and colorists and of course, the printer. It will also cover the cost of shipping and materials, taxes, and fees. 

If we significantly surpass our goal, then the funds will be used to start artwork on our other comic book projects; Game Plan, The Lost King, and Humanimal Instincts. 

 What's next for inZane Comics?  

As soon as the campaign is successful, our main priority is fulfilling the pledge rewards. After that, we plan on completing the 10 comic book series for the Elemental Balance. 

Aside from that, we have several comic book projects in draft such as The Lost King and Humanimal Instincts, which we plan on bringing online soon. We also have other storylines that are in the concept phase and don’t have a title yet. All these stories will tie into one ultimate story.  

We’re also working on unconventional comics that don’t necessarily follow the rules of traditional comics, which will be published under the "inZane Chrome" brand. These stories will be more relatable to graphic novel enthusiasts. The first one will be “The Game Plan” (Remember, this is the one I wrote for my wife).

The Impact

Our long-term goal is to provide an avenue for young artists and writers to get their foot through the door in the comic industry. We plan on starting an inZane Summer internship program with students across the US. During this internship, selected students will create a comic book project from the ground up while being mentored by industry professionals.

Risks & Challenges

The story is written, all of the artwork is completed, and the editor has reviewed the content. Suppliers have been evaluated and chosen for all merchandise. If we exceed our projected goal, then we'll start placing orders during the campaign to ensure supply continuity. 

Delays could potentially happen in production due to the manufacturing process and all the moving parts. That's why we're taking the extra step and ordering comics during the campaign to mitigate any production delays. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes budgets are tight, and we understand if you can't contribute.  But you still can help us out tremendously if you can get the word out.

  • The easiest way to do that is by using the Indiegogo share tools. 

 

Contact Us

Need some help? We're always happy to answer any questions. You can contact us through Indiegogo or send us an email at inzanecomics@gmail.com.  Or you can visit us on our website www.inzanecomics.com.

If you want to check out our social media sites, click on them below:

  • Twitter
  • Facebook
  • Instagram

We here at inZane Comics would like to thank you for your support and hope to bring you amazing comics for years to come!
story_txt:
READ THE FREE PREVIEW OF ALL 3 CHAPTERS BY CLICKING HERE 
 
WHAT IS THE ELEMENTAL BALANCE?
The Elemental Balance is a story about 4 individuals from around the world who gain the powers of the Elements. They are known as the Elementals. They don’t know how or why they got these powers, but they all died from a natural disaster caused by the Element's energy they harness. 

The story follows their journey of finding one another in hopes of unraveling the truth behind their powers and its connection to their resurrection. Instead, they discover that they're being hunted by a mysterious force! Find out what makes them a target in the Indiegogo Exclusive premiere of the first 3 issues of The Elemental Balance. 

Elemental Balance is the first comic series published by inZane comics. The story has been written by Zain Shenwari with artwork done by Luke Horsman. 
The first 3 comics offered in this campaign have been completed, from the artwork to lettering. That equates to 64 pages of completed story content. All that remains now is a successful Indiegogo campaign. And...

We're seeking your support to fund Chapter 4 


Come and join us on this thrilling adventure and escape into the inZane World of Elemental Balance!   
PARENTAL GUIDANCE: T+ TEENS AND UP – Appropriate for teens aged 13 years and above. May contain violence, suggestive themes, and/or crude humor.
So...What's the Story Like? It’s like if Avatar the Air bender merged with Netflix’s hit show Sense8...but without the rated R stuff of course! 
MEET THE ELEMENTALS:




 ELEMENTAL BALANCE CH 1 | GROUNDBREAKING NEWS

Chapter 1, Groundbreaking News is about a new discovery! The Chapter starts off with a monologue, while scenes of a tragic incident from a memory are illustrated in the background. The monologue poses the question: if Earth was created with Elemental Energy, then what happened to those energy forces? According to the laws of Physics, energy can not be destroyed...it can only be transformed from one form to another!  

The story then diverts back to the present time and introduces our main character Chloe and her boyfriend. Chloe is obsessed with understanding the meaning behind elemental energies and goes from museum to museum to find out more about them. One day while on a museum tour, Chloe's boyfriend gets her a necklace. That day, her life changed forever.  

That night Chloe has a vivid dream that she's in Nairobi, Kenya, running away from a mudslide. She gets buried under the mudslide and dies, only to wake up and be relieved that it was all just a dream. 

Or so she thought until she found out the next morning, her dream was real!

Find out what the meaning behind Chloe's dream is in Chapter 1, Ground Breaking News.

ELEMENTAL BALANCE CH 2 | WATER UNDER THE BRIDGE

Chapter 2,  Water under the Bridge title is an idiom that means to move on from the past. As the title suggests, this chapter will reveal Chloe's past. 
Chloe and her friend Jessi are on vacation for spring break. 

But as the day progresses, their perfect getaway turns into a nightmare. 

The cruise ship they were on, is engulfed by a massive tsunami! 

Find out how Chloe survives in Chapter 2, Water Under the Bridge. 

ELEMENTAL BALANCE CH 3 | UP IN AIR

Chapter 3, Up in Air  title is an idiom that means that there's uncertainty. Like the title suggests, this chapter will reveal several mysteries. Chloe and Baraka (the Earth Elemental) thought they were going to unite with the Wind Elemental, but a new threat is revealed to them.  
Chloe and Baraka arrive in Japan and head to a local internet cafe in hopes of finding clues to the whereabouts of the Wind Elemental.   

There they meet Satoshi, a local citizen who claims he knows where the tornado happened and offers to take them there.

Desperate for leads, Chloe and Baraka follow him, but what’s in store for them will surprise you!

Find out the major reveal in Chapter 3, Up in Air. 

CRITIC reviews: 
Here's Mike from "Chico Comics Page" review of "The Elemental Balance". Click Here for the full Article.
"In comics there are indie publishers, and then there are indie publishers. There was confidence in the writing, the art, and overall design of the book. The art in here is fantastic. Everything feels like a comic I should be reading off the stands." 
Read what Trever from "Frags and Beer" thought about the first chapter of "The Elemental Balance". Click Here for the full Article. 
"I enjoyed every panel of this book, and hope to see a lot more from Luke. The pages have a lot of movement and detail. The characters look great against wonderful backgrounds. The pencils are up there with the best that I’ve seen from any company, large or indie. This book is definitely worth checking out." 
Hear what David from "The Newest Rant" had to say about "The Elemental Balance". Click Here for the full Article.
"Having now checked-out the first issue I can say I enjoyed it a great deal thanks to a mixture of fun ideas and a quick-moving plot."
And here is what CJPendragon had to say about The Elemental Balance. Click here to read the full Article. 
"The Elemental Balance is a weirdly awesome mash-up of science, superpowers, and humanity that will leave most readers vying for more. It’s well-written, with just enough suspense to have a thrill for your experience."


ABOUT ME: 
Hi, my name is Zain and I’m the writer for The Elemental Balance. I’ve always had a passion for writing stories. In fact, my first story “Game Plan” was written to impress my wife. Spoiler alert, it paid off! I find it rewarding to bring entertainment to people, that’s my niche! My style of storytelling is grounded in reality but, nonetheless, is fiction. Characters are set in unrealistic situations but have very relatable emotions. Imagine if someone could achieve greatness with a determined will, how would they react if they had powers? This is what my stories are rooted in….emotions!  

It’s fascinating what the human will allows us to achieve. They say the human body can bend steel, but the brain limits it. Isn’t it amazing how our body functions? The world around us is fascinating because its full of mysteries. Our reality seems fictitious because we’re a MIRACLE and the celebration of LIFE fuels the stories I write!
 
ABOUT THE ARTIST:
Luke Horsman is an extremely talented artist from the UK. He is well versed in many forms of art mediums. In fact, Luke did the pencils, ink, and coloring for the first three chapters. His artwork has truly brought the characters from the script to life. 

It's been a blast working with him. We mesh really well. I'm particular with scenes and visual symbolism and he's keen on creating eye-catching, bold illustrations. Together we made an excellent team!

story:
If a priest from the future wanted to rid the world of sin, where would he go to meet Satan? 

One of the first appearances of the fallen angel in antiquity! Dante Aligheri's The Devine Comedy!


Dante, in detail, explains encountering the great Lucifer before descending down his back at the end of Inferno...hmmmm" then the ideas started to flow. This is the end result.

Stelle, latin for "stars", is the telling of a man's journey through the depths of hell to encounter the "Evil All." Told in first person and drawn in traditional Japanese manga,  we follow Dante (or is he?) through the 9+1 realms of hell proper on his journey. The book is delivered in a precise number of pages to coincide with the number allegories found in the original poem. The twist at the end is of my own concoction and has been met with great shock, awe, and befuddlement before, ultimately, realization of one's direct actions.


THANK YOU FOR READING AND SUPPORTING YOUR FELLOW INDIEGOGO MEMBER!

-WILL DEONNE

story:
Short Summary

Like many guys in my generation, I grew up reading comic books and dreamed of someday drawing my favorite heroes.  However, as I got older, I began to realize that the real fun isn't rehashing the same ol' same ol'...the REAL fun is creating your own characters and stories.  Not just retreading old Stan Lee and Jack Kirby characters, but BEING YOUR OWN STAN LEE AND JACK KIRBY!

So, I am a SELF-PUBLISHER, which means I have the freedom to tell whatever story I wish and draw it how I see fit.  This also means I am financially responsible for getting my stories published.  As a Junior High Art teacher and father of 2, this can prove to be...difficult. 

This IndieGoGo campaign will help me publish a comic book that is fun, original, and important; without spending my kids' college fund!  People who donate will be supporting the independent spirit that makes this country great gives the little guy a fighting chance in this competitive market!

Help that little kid daydreaming of making his own comics realize his dream!

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $1500, which is no small amount.  So every dollar helps.  This money will go strickly for printing the comic book.  I am not going to use the money to suppoprt my family or my Scotch habit.  I will be starting off with a small print run of a FULL COLOR comic book, and the $1500 will help that happen!

I am offering some pretty cool incentives, things that I would dig as a comic book fan.  Everything from signed copies of the book, prints of the cover signed by myslef and cover artist Jeff Herndon, original art by me, and your chance to be featured in a page of the comic book!!!

The Impact

The Con Job is just like Oceans 11, if it was about 3 geeks getting revenge for the wrongs of the past and it took place at a comic convention instead of Vegas!

This is a story for anyone who believes in creator owned rights and standing up against giant corporations that use the ideas of artists to make billions, chew them up, and spit them out.

My first self published graphic novel Kidnapping Kevin Smith was very well recieved world wide and made a name (albiet small) for me in the comics world.  Hopefully the Con Job will continue this success. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate to this project, please help out by telling a friend.  That's the easiest way to help get this book made.  Use the share options and Tweet and Facebook and promote the heck outta it!

Thanks!

story:
“Support the Plan, Help ECBACC Jam!” is The East Coast Black Age of Comics Convention, Incorporated’s way of inviting you to participate in our efforts to uplift our young people, our families, and our communities through storytelling.

What is the Plan:

With sponsorship funding ECBACC will support 4 basic initiatives. These are:

-  ECBACC will deliver the 14th annual ECBACC convention

-  ECBACC will deliver the annual GCA ceremony

-  ECBACC will offer STARS Workshops

-  ECBACC will publish the 2nd volume of the READ FOR FUN WORKBOOK

Background

The East Coast Black Age of Comics Convention, Incorporated services the literacy needs of the community by using comic books and positive Black images to promote an increase in literacy and social involvement. ECBACC, Inc. has provided free comic book creation workshops to the communities of the City of Philadelphia, PA for 10 consecutive years and stands as an example of creative community engagement.

Statement of the Project Problem

African American / Black students disproportionately have low to poor literacy skills. Nationally more than 50% of Black students ranging from age 9 to 14 years old are reading below the country’s basic level. More specific surveys indicate that boys more than girls in general are choosing to read less and less as a form of recreation. {National Center for Education Statistics 2009 report}

It is a lack of engaging reading material that hinders youth from improving literary skills. Strong reading skills are one of many tools that people use to engage the world around them.  If our youth are allowed to feel comfortably disengaged with the world, the results would create a cascading apathy, which would have long reaching effects; such as failure to meet and seek educational achievement, low community involvement, and devaluing family and self-worth.

Solution

ECBACC, Inc., a 501(c)(3) organization, provides events, activities, and products that strengthen community by letting young people know we care about what they are reading, that we care about their future, and that we care about them having the power to make their dreams come true.

If there is one thing that ECBACC, Inc. has learned since it opened its doors back in 2002, it’s that the best way to support an organization that uplifts heroes is to recognize the ones that have been with you all the time. Continue to be OUR heroes. Help US, to help US.

story:
About Us

Im a Geek Entertainment officially became a company in September 2010, but didn't launch until 1/1/11. Since our launch, we have released 5 comic book titles, started a manga division, and novel division. Im a Geek also has a division that specializes in news, web videos, and other entertainment named, Geeky Universe. Im a Geek's goal is to provide quality entertainment in comics and prose. 

What books are we producing currently?

We have a wide range of books that we are currently producing, here is a list of some of them!

 

iBotics One Shot

Anabolic Chicken vs Mutant Bull One Shot

Don't Mess With Texas (TPB)

Rockstar Savior #2 and 3 (Preview of Issue #1 here)

Parallel Dilemma #2 and 3 (Preview #1 here)

Dark Lightnin'

Gary Phillip's Spy Man Shade

World Scale (TPB/Manga Book)

Temptress Society (TPB)

 

What We Need & What You Get

To make sure you know that we are not trying to pull a scam here, we just wanted to let you know where we project the raised funds will be placed. We are hoping to raise the money to help print some of our titles that would not be printed otherwise. Other expenses goes to attending other conventions, promotion/advertising cost, etc. So 100% of the funds raised will go to comics!

What you will get?

Comics... you will get comics at a reduced price. Quality comics. This is also being used as a pre-order system to get any comics that will be coming out in 2012 from Im a Geek Entertainment. Check out the packages, there is something for everyone! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can or cannot pledge to our campaign, you can help us spread the word by posting this campaign on your facebook, twitter, or any social networking website. Talk to your friends, especially if they like comics, webshows or have money. Please help us reach our goal.
