story:
Our Story


IndieGoGo and all of our amazing contributors from our last fundraiser helped us to survive for a few more years and because of that generosity, we can now move forward with an idea we've had in the works for a few years now!


Come and celebrate our 5th Year Anniversary with Alterna's first trading card set that centers around the amazing creator-owned characters that have graced the pages of Alterna Comics' graphic novels!

This 5 card set will also feature 250 sketch cards that will be comprised entirely of original, hand-drawn, one-of-a-kind sketch cards created by 50 different artists, including Alterna's very own talented creators!


A lot of the artists involved are getting the chance to see their work published for the first time.  It's a dream come true for many of them - a dream that we hope they get a chance to fulfill.  There's also veteran artists on here that are lending their skills towards bringing the characters at Alterna to life in their own unique visions.

Here's the artist roster:

Daniel Gorman, Kelly Williams, Jacob Rozen, Brian Beardsley, j(ay), Jiba Molei Anderson, John J.C. Bulmer, Peter Simeti, Michael Bracco, Bret Herholz, Jeff McComsey, Jeremy Massie, Rafer Roberts, Neil Makohon, Gary Kezele, Thomas Makoto, Stephanie O'Donnell, Rusty Gilligan, Mike Thomas, George Amaru, Joe Palumbo, Chadwick Haverland, Jason Shoemaker, Nicholas P. Meyers, Erin Kohut, Kevin Christensen, Bianca Thompson, Laura Inglis, Joseph Miller, Jay Shimko, Scott Ethan Glenn, Jason Roussel, Hector Garcia, Michael Kasaboski, Tim Shay, Isaiah McAllister, Mickey Clausen, Steven Russell Black, Tom Kelly, Brian McCranie, Mark Nasso, Kristen Bellatti, Jay Pangan, Jason Flowers, Randy Bishop, Nate Getz, Puis Calzada, Jesse Hughes, Douglas Draper Jr., Anthony Hochrein


      


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise at least $200 to afford packaging and print production costs on the cards.  BUT if we can raise the extra $200, then it would help us to afford the shipping costs and promotional costs of marketing the set.  Now, this is more of a pre-order sale than do-or-die fundraiser, but the benefits to contributing definitely end up working in favor for you!  We've got our books for sale at less than cover price as well as pre-orders for the card set at less than the $10 a pack price.

There are 50 extremely talented artists contributing original art to this set - original art that can be yours for fractions of what they would be worth otherwise!  With a 50% chance of getting original art in each pack, it truly is a great deal.  Each 3 card pack of cards comes with 2 base cards and either a signed base card by an Alterna creator OR an original sketch card from one of 50 artists.

Other Ways You Can Help

Getting the word out by posting this on any social media site - sharing it on facebook or twitter or just anything really - would be awesome.  So even if you can't contribute a dollar amount, just spreading the word would be great.
story_txt:
Our Story

IndieGoGo and all of our amazing contributors from our last fundraiser helped us to survive for a few more years and because of that generosity, we can now move forward with an idea we've had in the works for a few years now!

Come and celebrate our 5th Year Anniversary with Alterna's first trading card set that centers around the amazing creator-owned characters that have graced the pages of Alterna Comics' graphic novels!This 5 card set will also feature 250 sketch cards that will be comprised entirely of original, hand-drawn, one-of-a-kind sketch cards created by 50 different artists, including Alterna's very own talented creators!

A lot of the artists involved are getting the chance to see their work published for the first time.  It's a dream come true for many of them - a dream that we hope they get a chance to fulfill.  There's also veteran artists on here that are lending their skills towards bringing the characters at Alterna to life in their own unique visions.
Here's the artist roster:
Daniel Gorman, Kelly Williams, Jacob Rozen, Brian Beardsley, j(ay), Jiba Molei Anderson, John J.C. Bulmer, Peter Simeti, Michael Bracco, Bret Herholz, Jeff McComsey, Jeremy Massie, Rafer Roberts, Neil Makohon, Gary Kezele, Thomas Makoto, Stephanie O'Donnell, Rusty Gilligan, Mike Thomas, George Amaru, Joe Palumbo, Chadwick Haverland, Jason Shoemaker, Nicholas P. Meyers, Erin Kohut, Kevin Christensen, Bianca Thompson, Laura Inglis, Joseph Miller, Jay Shimko, Scott Ethan Glenn, Jason Roussel, Hector Garcia, Michael Kasaboski, Tim Shay, Isaiah McAllister, Mickey Clausen, Steven Russell Black, Tom Kelly, Brian McCranie, Mark Nasso, Kristen Bellatti, Jay Pangan, Jason Flowers, Randy Bishop, Nate Getz, Puis Calzada, Jesse Hughes, Douglas Draper Jr., Anthony Hochrein

       


What We Need & What You GetWe need to raise at least $200 to afford packaging and print production costs on the cards.  BUT if we can raise the extra $200, then it would help us to afford the shipping costs and promotional costs of marketing the set.  Now, this is more of a pre-order sale than do-or-die fundraiser, but the benefits to contributing definitely end up working in favor for you!  We've got our books for sale at less than cover price as well as pre-orders for the card set at less than the $10 a pack price. There are 50 extremely talented artists contributing original art to this set - original art that can be yours for fractions of what they would be worth otherwise!  With a 50% chance of getting original art in each pack, it truly is a great deal.  Each 3 card pack of cards comes with 2 base cards and either a signed base card by an Alterna creator OR an original sketch card from one of 50 artists. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Getting the word out by posting this on any social media site - sharing it on facebook or twitter or just anything really - would be awesome.  So even if you can't contribute a dollar amount, just spreading the word would be great.

story:
Thank you!

We reached our second stretch goal, which means anyone who orders a physical copy of the book will get both the original sticker pack and the chibi sticker pack!

Thanks so much for all your support in this. Our first crowdfunder has been an adventure, and we're already thinking about starting a new one!

In the mean time, you can still buy the comic through indemand with the Digital Bundle, Chronicles fo Calmity Issue 1, and Junior Adventurer Bundles still available!

You can also still buy the exclusive Bjorg T-shirt or a personalized character message (please note these perks do not come with a copy of the comic book.)

Thank you once again for all your support, we can't wait to get this stuff out to you!

 

 

Stretch Goal 2!!

Help us meet $5000 and we'll throw in these adorable chibi stickers with every physical copy! It even includes fan favorite Judge Hungry. EVERYONE IS SO ADORABLE! EVEN SILAS!

 

Bjorg T-shirt Perk!

Want to contribute in style? Get this exclusive t-shirt featuring Bjorg bursting out of your chest!

 

Stretch Goal!! (UNLOCKED)

Help us to reach $4000 and we'll unlock an excellent new cover by Johnny Segura The 3rd! We've even made some brand new perks to help you to help us, because we're good people!

 

Sticker Preview!

Want to see the cool sticker pack you'll be getting with your physical comic? Well do ya!? Here's a preview!

 

What the Heck is Going On Here?

Authors and Dragons is an infamous Dungeons and Dragons podcast, where six comedy fantasy authors try to survive a world of might and magic, often with hilarious results. Not so long ago they teamed up with artist John Luther Davis to provide artwork for their patreon supporters, and the Chronicles of Calamity comic adventure was born.

Blending their irreverent humour with high-octane fantasy action, Chronicles of Calamity is blunt-edge mayhem for fans of fantasy adventure and worlds of might and magic.

Issue one is 24 pages of action and comedy, with our unlikley heroes placed slap bang in the middle of a demonic invasion!

What We Need & What You Get

We'd love to see this comic book break free of the Patreon paywall and get out into the world with physical copies. The easiest way to make sure that the comic gets into the hands of people who want them is through crowd funding. And the best part is, Issue 1 of the comic is complete and ready to go.

All we need are your contributions to cover the cost of print and delivery. That's it!

Risks & Challenges

There's a minimum cost to printing enough physical copies to make this affordable, and if we don't meet that cost, we won't be able to follow through. We need your help to ensure as many backers as possible to get this baby out into the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Chronicles of Calamity isn't just for Authors and Dragons fans, or even Dungeons and Dragons fans. If you know anyone who might appreciate our goofy humor, send them this way! Every donation counts, and with a digital issue up for grabs as minimum, everybody wins!

story:
Angel Lite Comics is a fledgling comic company interested in providing quality comics by Christians, but for everyone to enjoy. These are not Bible tracts, or illustrated Bible stories, they are comic books. You know, super heroes, aliens, robots, high adventure on earth and in outer space. The company's founder and main idea man is David Rothschiller, and he has a dazzling universe of stories to share with you! But first things first, let's get the first book out, shall we?

Angel Lite Comics has teamed up with DY-Comics, a young Christian comic and game company owned by Donny Yule, who will be interpreting David's story into full comic book form. Donny has experience with web comics, his stories 'Guild Tomes' and 'High Society' are gaining fans everyday.

'The Ballad' is a Space Opera Romance set on the planet Crazcar, where the Old West still flourishes. With your help, a beautifully illustrated black and white graphic novel estimated at 72 pages in an east meets west style of manga art by Donny Yule will become available online and through Amazon.com's CreateSpace print on demand service.

Your donations will all go to Donny Yule for the purpose of enabling him to stay on the project (this is his career, and he needs to make ends meet!). David Rothschiller has completed the story, and remains on the project as editor. I (Gerry Lee) am storyboarding the script, and have completed the first third of the graphic novel to this state. 3 24 page issues will be collected to tell 'The Ballad' in it's entirety:)

Please visit http://www.angellitecomics.com/the_ballad_project_work_space to see the work we've accomplished, and will be accomplishing in the future. I do not have the skill to make an exciting video to share with you, but would like to invite you to come 'behind the scenes with us' at our website:)

We'd like to raise at least $500 through this campaign to get this book published.

Perks we are offering are modest and humble, we are actually asking for your donations, rather than asking you to buy things, but what we can give you are welcome to!

$1 donation: Your name mentioned in the final Graphic Novel as a contributor

$5 donation: A scribble drawing by Gerry Lee (me) of one of 'The Ballad' characters, sent to your email as a jpeg.

$15 donation 'The New Sons of Thunder' graphic novel. Not related to 'The Ballad', this book was written by me, Gerry Lee, and illustrated by the masterful comic artist Larry Blake.

$25 donation A black and white art by Donny Yule, of an Angel Lite Comics and/or DY Comics character.

$50 donation A color artwork by Donny Yule, of an Angel Lite Comics and/or DY-Comics character.

$75 donation A printed copy of 'The Ballad' Issue 1 (24 pages), and all the other perks from $1-50 dollars.

Please consider helping us contribute to the world of comic books! We at Angel Lite Comics and DY Comics feel that comics can be a great blessing to their readers, and would like to make such books available as an alternative option for readers to violent soft core porn books.

Well, that is all I can think of to tell you about our project. Whether you can donate or not, would you please support us in this quest to publish our very first book by letting people know about this Indiegogo campaign? Thank you very much!

story:
When I created Adrastus back in 2007, I wanted to make something a little different from most of the giant robot stories I'd seen. I wanted a story with a woman who wasn't a walking cliche as the star, actually getting to pilot the robot and do the fighting! I worked hard to create a main character who wasn't an Emotionless Doll, an Airhead, or a Man With Boobs, which was what I commonly saw from the female characters in this genre. I wanted to make a well rounded protagonist, someone who wasn't there to support the men's story, but had her own story.
And, most importantly, was in charge of piloting the dang robot.

This is the story of Sarah Bryant, a pretty typical young woman who likes to race motorcycles, fix cars, and collect tabloid articles about the supposed giant robot that has been hidden on her parent's ranch since the 1970's. One day, she is out racing her motorcycle when suddenly three men in suits show up and start shooting lasers at her! That's when she discovers that Adrastus, the giant alien robot from the planet Ankali, is real! Now Sarah, with the help of her government-issued bodyguard secret agent Michael Baxter, must learn to pilot Adrastus against the evil forces of the Varugo. Along the way, she learns about her own strength, and about the power of family.

This story is my modern love letter to the 70's and 80's giant robot genre of anime. It uses many tropes popular in the mecha genre (such as Calling Your Attack), but puts a parody twist on them when they're looked at through the eyes of a more modern audience. Though much of the influence comes from the mecha (giant robot) genre, it is also a story about family, friendship, and humanity. Most of my regular readers online are not hard-core fans of the mecha genre, but they find Adrastus' characters lovable and the story engaging. 

What We Need & What You Get

This project will fund the completion and printing of "Adrastus: Book 3", as well as allow me to print more of Books 1 and 2! Each book is a softcover, black and white interior with a beautiful color exterior, and is around 150-200 pages. The books all include comics originally published on adrastuscomic.com, as well as bonus content, sketches, concept art, and more not found anywhere online!


Over half of the money from this goal is going to go to printing books and getting them shipped to me from the printer. Another 10% is the shipping from me to you, the backers! Around 10% is going to buy shipping supplies like boxes and envelopes to protect these delightful books as they journey to you. I've allocated 15% for miscellaneous fees, such as crowdfunding fees and credit card processing fees. 

PDF Files: Strictly digital with your comics these days? We've got you covered. You can get one PDF or a PDF bundle in most reward tiers.

Physical Copies of Books: This is what this campaign is all about, getting these pages to print! The lower physical book reward tier will get you a copy of book three (great for those who already have books one and two!) 

Inked Sketch inside of book (Artist's Edition)- Want the inside of your book personalized? This is available as a $35 tier for just Book Three, or as an add-on if you're getting more than one book. Check the A La Carte section for pricing.

Commissioned Artwork: Want something a little bigger? Higher reward tiers include an 11x17 Pencil drawing commission. This will be done on Bristol board and limited to two characters, please. Absolutely no: pornography, excessive gore. Subjects I will draw: human characters, furries/anthro, chibi characters, robots. If you want a portrait done of a real person it will be done in a stylized manner- either comic or chibi, your choice. 

(Example of 11x14 grayscale marker artwork) 
Original Comic Pages: Did you know that the first few pages of Adrastus were made on paper, with pencil and ink? I have 12 originals, spanning the first cover and the first 10 pages of the story, that I am offering up for the first time ever in this campaign! You can own a piece of Adrastus history that will come to you boarded and bagged, with a certificate of authenticity.

Custom Wordpress Theme from C.A. Morgan!: The incredible C.A. Morgan has offered up a custom wordpress theme design! To see an example of their work, take a look at the Adrastus web-site. C.A. did the coding and layout design (helped by some custom art from me, of course!) There are restrictions to this tier and they are as follows:
  • This reward is for a custom theme for the Wordpress platform.
  • Can be for a comic site or non-comic site.
  • The lucky backer will receive an initial consultation with several concepts to choose from for their design.
  • Backer will not receive any work or consultation until their pledge has cleared and the money is in Liz's hands.
  • Backer should have rudimentary knowledge of how to operate a Wordpress site. If the backer makes code changes on their custom theme later and breaks the theme, this pledge tier does not necessarily constitute an agreement that C.A. Morgan will fix the broken theme.

The Impact

This campaign will not only allow me to print the brand new (and long-awaited) third collection of the story, but it will also allow me to restock my copies of books one and two. I've totally sold out of my copies of Book One, and only have a few copies of Book Two left! 

Normally I do pre-orders on my own for new books and order as many extra as I can with the money received. But when having to stock three books, the cost becomes too great to manage like that. I'd like to get enough copies of each book to last me for awhile, but any money we raise will help me to at least get some books printed that I can take with me to conventions.

Having books at my convention tables is a huge impact on my comic. They help me bring in new readers, especially those who aren't familiar with reading comics on the internet. Books let me reach new fans and help get the word out about this story that I'm creating!

Risks & Challenges

I've published three books through CreateSpace before so I know their process pretty well now. Books 1 and 2 are in their system and ready to go as soon as I have money in my hands.

Most of the interior layout of Book 3 is done already. I simply need to create some of the bonus content (including finishing the extra story). However, there may be issues in proofing that need to be fixed before publishing before backers can get their books. I have not had any issues like this with CreateSpace before, but there's a first time for everything! Backers will be notified of any delays as soon as I know of them, but I am anticipating a smooth order from the printer.

Though I have successfully done shipping multiple orders of items before, this will be the most fulfillment I've had to do all at one time. I'm coming up with a plan already though to get orders packed and shipped as quickly as possible though once the books arrive at my door, and I have friends who have agreed to help.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, then please, please, PLEASE share this campaign on all your social media! Make sure that you say a little something about why you think the project is worth taking a look at, too! A small endorsement from a friend or family member can go a long way on getting someone to chip in.

story:
What is Samandal?

Samandal is a volunteer-based non-profit organization dedicated to the advancement of the art of comics in Lebanon and the rest of the world. Based in Beirut, we have published comics anthologies and hosted comics-related events  since 2007.

from the launch of Samandal issue 5 in Beirut

In 2009 three of the four editors were charged by the Lebanese state with inciting sectarian strife, denigrating religion, publishing false news, and slander on account of “Christian personalities” taking offense to two panels from different comics in our 7th issue, titled “Revenge”.

Samandal 7: Revenge.

The panels were taken out of context and misinterpreted through a narrow sectarian reading, yet after five years of litigation we lost our case and the following appeal, forcing us to pay 30 million Lebanese Liras in damages.

The Samandal NGO has buckled under the weight of these fines and our latest issue, “Geography”, looks to be our last. We are launching a crowdfunding campaign in a last ditch effort to help Samandal fight this unjust ruling and continue publishing comics.

Read our full official statement about the court case here.

You can also read more about this story in this article in The New Yorker.

Where will your donations go?

Our primary aim is to publish more comics, mainly through our annual anthologies. We would like to secure funding for our next 2 books to be released in 2016 and 2017.

Samandal's latest book: the 2015 Geographie, edited by Joseph Kai

Each book will cost approximately $20,000, which are distributed thusly:

   •   Printing: $10,000
   •   Contributors: $5,000
   •   Translation: $2,000
   •   Release event and communication: $3,000

Second, we are building a comprehensive website in which all our back issues are available to download for free, in English, Arabic and French. It will also include a complete database of past and present contributing artists, cross-referenced with all their individual stories, functioning as a hub for contemporary comics in the region. This will cost $8,000, which are distributed thusly:

   •   Design: $2,700
   •   Development: $5000
   •   Domain registration and hosting: $300

Third, we are hiring an administrator, to organize and manage Samandal Comics Association for the coming 2 years. This will be a part time job paying $500 a month, which will amount to $12,000 in total.

If we manage to exceed the 60 K mark, the following is a list of possible future projects:

   •   Publishing Utopia by Omar Khouri in 2016
   •   International distribution plan
   •   Storage and office space
   •   Publishing additional anthologies and graphic novels

15 issues and 4 books published since 2007. Photo by Jonathan Guyer. Used with permission.

During the history of our association since 2007, we have so far published 15 magazine issues, 4 books and a number of special edition fanzines. We have organized a number of workshops, comics jams, lectures and exhibitions, and collaborated with comics collectives such as L'employé du Moi (our Belgian co-publisher for the above mentioned issue 7), L'association in France, Toktok in Egypt, Skefkef in Morrocco, and many others. Samandal also co-founded Beirut Animated, a biennial animation festival in Lebanon, with Metropolis Cinemas. We have been invited to and taken part in a number of comics festivals around the world including Angouleme International Comics Festival, Lucca Comics in Italy, Erlangen Comics Festival in Germany, to name a few and won 2 awards at the Algetian internationale comics festival (FIBDA). Support over the years has come to us from Xanadu, Foundation For arts Initiative (FFAI), Arab Fund for Art and Culture (AFAC), Young Arab Theater Fund (YATF), Ashkal Alwan and many other local and international organizations.

But our greatest support has always come from our readers and fans, who give meaning to all our hard work and trouble. 

 What will you get in return for your generosity?

Joe Sacco's original cover for his celebrated book Palestine. Drawn February 1994.  Ink on paper, 25.5 x 28 cm. From the list of the campaign's perks


We have a juicy selection of books and magazines, handmade and digital limited edition prints, original comics pages and artwork from a bunch of local and international artists. Highlights include original work from:

   •   The renowned comics journalist Joe Sacco, author of Palestine, and Notes from Gaza
   •   L’Association editor and Swiss/Lebanese comics artist Baladi
   •   Artist and filmmaker Akram Zaatari
   •   Eccentric artist and musician Raed Yassin
   •   Prolific comics artist and musician Mazen Kerbaj
   •   Delirious Samandal co-founder and Creator of imaginary items Omar Khouri offering to paint an original portrait of the donor in gouache
   •   Belgian artist Valfret and Samandal co-founder Lena Merhej, authors of the two original pages that caused the censorship problem

As well as:
Hatem Imam, Barrack Rima, Andy Warner, Frank Vega, Vito Manolo, Jana Traboulsi, Laure Ghorayeb, Paula Bulling, Lautaro Fizman, Joanna Hellgrin

We have created a page with images of all our perks for you you to choose from. Please click here

Unfortunately, shipping of these perks is not included in the prices, because it will vary depending on origin country and destination of each.

You can also contribute by spreading the word and buying our comics, and remember to use the indiegogo share tools!

Omar Khouri inspecting the printing
story_txt: What is Samandal?Samandal is a volunteer-based non-profit organization dedicated to the advancement of the art of comics in Lebanon and the rest of the world. Based in Beirut, we have published comics anthologies and hosted comics-related events  since 2007.from the launch of Samandal issue 5 in BeirutIn 2009 three of the four editors were charged by the Lebanese state with inciting sectarian strife, denigrating religion, publishing false news, and slander on account of “Christian personalities” taking offense to two panels from different comics in our 7th issue, titled “Revenge”.Samandal 7: Revenge.The panels were taken out of context and misinterpreted through a narrow sectarian reading, yet after five years of litigation we lost our case and the following appeal, forcing us to pay 30 million Lebanese Liras in damages.The Samandal NGO has buckled under the weight of these fines and our latest issue, “Geography”, looks to be our last. We are launching a crowdfunding campaign in a last ditch effort to help Samandal fight this unjust ruling and continue publishing comics.Read our full official statement about the court case here.You can also read more about this story in this article in The New Yorker.Where will your donations go?Our primary aim is to publish more comics, mainly through our annual anthologies. We would like to secure funding for our next 2 books to be released in 2016 and 2017.Samandal's latest book: the 2015 Geographie, edited by Joseph KaiEach book will cost approximately $20,000, which are distributed thusly:   •   Printing: $10,000    •   Contributors: $5,000   •   Translation: $2,000   •   Release event and communication: $3,000Second, we are building a comprehensive website in which all our back issues are available to download for free, in English, Arabic and French. It will also include a complete database of past and present contributing artists, cross-referenced with all their individual stories, functioning as a hub for contemporary comics in the region. This will cost $8,000, which are distributed thusly:   •   Design: $2,700   •   Development: $5000   •   Domain registration and hosting: $300Third, we are hiring an administrator, to organize and manage Samandal Comics Association for the coming 2 years. We have been invited to and taken part in a number of comics festivals around the world including Angouleme International Comics Festival, Lucca Comics in Italy, Erlangen Comics Festival in Germany, to name a few and won 2 awards at the Algetian internationale comics festival (FIBDA). Support over the years has come to us from Xanadu, Foundation For arts Initiative (FFAI), Arab Fund for Art and Culture (AFAC), Young Arab Theater Fund (YATF), Ashkal Alwan and many other local and international organizations. story:
Thank You!

Thanks for making this campaign a success! You helped us bring down our costs and--more importantly--spread the word about ComicBlanks.

What's next?

The new books are hot off the press, and all perks will be shipped out over the next few days.

Your sketchbook preference: The hardcover sketchbooks come in two styles: "Freehand" (pink) or "Ruled" (turquoise). If you haven't already done so, let us know your preference ASAP; if you want more than one, you can mix and match styles.

More new products

We will soon be offering a "Freehand" version of the Student Edition notebook, and we're planning other new and exciting products as well. Keep an eye on our website. If you'd like to receive occasional updates from us, send us an email with the subject line "Sign Me Up!"

More ways you can help

If you'd like to see ComicBlanks in your local stores and schools, here are a few things you can do:

Support retailers that carry ComicBlanks: Visit any of the retailers currently carrying our books, or order them online at Opus.

Demand ComicBlanks: Ask your local store or distributor to carry ComicBlanks. If your local school is printing single pages of comic book templates for classroom assignments, let them know that our Student Edition is an economical alternative.

Referrals: If you know of any schools, stores, or distributors who might be interested in ComicBlanks, let us know! You might be eligible for a referral fee; contact us for more details.

Outside North America: If you would like to buy ComicBlanks outside of the US or Canada, please ask your local retailer to get in touch with us. We are currently working on ways to get the books into stores in Europe and Australia. If you'd like to become a distributor in your local area, please let us know.

Feedback

We are excited to hear your feedback about the new and improved hardcover sketchbooks (with 70 lb. paper) as well as the Student Edition notebooks.

Please address all email to plutonicpress@plutonicpress.com

Thanks again to everybody for supporting this campaign!

 -Luke

The Indiegogo Campaign

ComicBlanks are sketchbooks with pre-printed comic panels! Designed for anybody planning a graphic novel or other visual art project, ComicBlanks sketchbooks are also perfect for comic jams and cartoon diaries.

And they make a great gift for professional and aspiring cartoonists, animators, and manga artists!


 

 

There are two different hardcover sketchbooks to choose from, "Freehand Panels" or "Ruled Panels." For more details, visit our website at comicblanks.com or plutonicpress.com

Both of our hardcover sketchbooks contain 60 pages of 70 lb. paper stock.

We're also testing a new product this season: A 40-page softcover Student Edition/Manga Notebook. Similar to a classroom exercise book, it measures 7" X 8.5".

It’s perfect for classrooms, car trips, plane rides, and public transit commutes. Manga fans can flip to the other side of the book and start from the back.

 

Your Contributions

Regardless of the outcome of this campaign, we're going to print as many ComicBlanks sketchbooks as possible. Every dollar you contribute to this campaign will help us reach our goals.

In the event that this campaign exceeds its financial goal, 100% of the funds will go back into the company. Here are some of the expenses we need to fund:

  • Printing and storing our products
  • Increasing our marketing efforts
  • Developing new products

 

Made in Canada

Plutonic Press, Inc. is committed to producing high quality products using local facilities. Our sketchbooks are designed, printed, and assembled in Vancouver, BC.
 
We are also deeply committed to supporting the arts. Our products are designed to encourage creativity and inspire artists to create great works.
 

Spread the Word!

If you are unable to support us with your cash, that's okay! But please tell your friends about this campaign. Here are some links you can share:
 
www.comicblanks.com
 
http://www.facebook.com/comicblanks
 
After the campaign ends, visit this link to order ComicBlanks online:
 
http://store.opusartsupplies.com/sagro/storefront/store.php?mode=browsecategory&category=3559
 
Please email any questions to plutonicpress@plutonicpress.com
 
Thanks very much for your support!

story:
​

11 x 17" print ( above )

NOVA Corp t-shirt ( above )

Who we are:

NOVACON is the product of The Nova Fest's creator Fernando Mico and local comic shop owner Kevin Bednarz. Together they are out to create a one of a kind comic con experience for fans all along the east coast.  

The NOVACON team also includes local cosplay personality Megawatt Cosplay, podcast host Michael "MC" McNutt & production supervisor Matt Sharpe.

Every team member is passionate about this project and each person brings a unique skill set to this event.

Together, this is the start of a comic convention for the fans, by the fans. 

We feel it's time to put Northern Virginia on the map for the pop culture community.

What We Need & What You Get:

We are looking to raise at least $20,000 for this campaign.  Putting on a convention like this for "year one" is a monumental task.  These funds will be used to secure quality media guests and also for marketing, advertising, printing and payroll.

We are offering incredible discounts on tickets, tables and rooms in the "perks" section and we will be sending out some exclusive products and surprises throughout these 35 days.

Risks & Challenges:

Putting on a first year comic convention can be extremely tough, you have to create the brand and build your audience, there are challenges with ticketing, location, legal, advertising, etc.

However, with our combined experience in conventions, promotions and event planning, we feel this is a perfect time to come together and deliver NOVACON to you! The funds from this campaign will make it easier to build NOVACON the way we all envision it.

Don't be shy, share!

Share! Share! Share! Don't be shy! Please text, call, email and share this campaign and the word of NOVACON to everyone you know!  It means the world to us.

What to expect: FUN!

This is a convention all about having fun!  We are out to create the most exciting atmosphere for all of you to enjoy at the Ritz Carlton hotel.  No hard concrete floor, no harsh overhead lights, no boring announcements, no lousy food, no extremely long lines.  We will create a place for you to hang out with like - minded people from all walks of life under the NOVACON umbrella.

We have already locked in media guests from TV, movies and video games.  We are filling booths with select vendors from all over the country.  We have a full stage in the main room with our own in - house DJ and convention host.  We are hosting three cosplay contests with over $2000.00 in prize money.  We will have a cosplay photo booth, quality food and beverages, amazing promotions and raffle prizes and of course, plenty of comics, artwork and toys.

We are creating our gaming component and organizing our panels as we speak, we have a lot of work to do.  But we will do it, and with your help, do it right.

We may not be the biggest yet, but we promise to bring you a quality first year con, and build on that so NOVACON becomes a successful annual event in Northern Virginia.

story:
***BOLIDE HA RAGGIUNTO IL GOAL! PER TUTTE LE INFORMAZIONI SUL PERK UPGRADE VI RIMANDIAMO ALLA SEZIONE FAQ. SOTTO POTETE LEGGERE LA LISTA DEGLI STRETCH GOAL DA RAGGIUNGERE!***

 

 

avventura s. f. – 1. b. Impresa rischiosa ma attraente e piena di fascino...

 

BOLIDE è un progetto che unisce alcuni tra i migliori fumettisti del panorama italiano contemporaneo e il classico fumetto avventuroso. Abbiamo chiamato a raccolta alcuni tra i migliori fumettisti contemporanei e assegnato loro 7 generi diversi con cui cimentarsi. Avranno a disposizione 30 pagine in formato striscia 21x10 per piegare le convezioni di genere e far rivivere a modo loro la spy story, la space opera, il cavalleresco, il fumetto di guerra,  il crime, il western e il tarzanide.

Le 7 strisce verranno poi racchiuse in un cofanetto, una confezione di design appositamente realizzata per non sfigurare all'interno delle librerie degli appassionati di fumetto.

A tre anni dalla sua fondazione e dopo più di dodici mesi di progettazione, l'associazione culturale Amianto Comics lancia il suo primo crowdfunding. Dopo aver dato alle stampe più di un migliaio di pagine di fumetto autoprodotto - tra cui il quadrimestrale Amianto, la collana di graphic novel Amianto Comics Presenta, il webcomic Smokey e progetti sperimentali come I Fiori del Male e Il Corvo della linea Reflusso - crediamo sia arrivato il momento di alzare l'asticella, ma per farlo abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto!

BOLIDE verrà stampato solo se riusciremo a raggiungere la cifra necessaria. Aiutandoci, oltre alle 7 strisce, potrete ricevere gadget ed edizioni limitate realizzate con la collaborazione dei nostri partner, tre giovani realtà artigianali del territorio: TRASANDO STUFF, Woodbe e Pennacchi Pipe.

N.B. Se la campagna avrà successo, BOLIDE sarà disponibile a partire da novembre 2019, in occasione di Lucca Comics & Games, ma solo tramite la campagna crowdfunding sarà possibile ottenere perk esclusivi e limitati e sbloccare i nostri stretch goal!

 

__________________________

 

Ecco gli autori che hanno accettato di cimentarsi in questa ardita impresa!

 

NOVA

(This Is Not A Love Song, BAO Publishing, Progetto Stigma) racconterà un'avventurosa spy story, "Combat Geghegè", ispirata da un classico come Modesty Blaise.

 

TUONO PETTINATO

(GRRRzetic, Rizzoli Lizard, Longanesi, Linus, Internazionale) rivolterà come un calzino la space opera a la Flash Gordon per raccontare le storture dell’Italia contemporanea con i suoi “Sindaci”.

 

FRANCESCO GUARNACCIA

(Mammaiuto, Shockdom, Rizzoli, Internazionale, Bao Publishing) narrerà le ardimentose imprese "cavalleresche" di "Pick-up Prince", un odierno Prince Valiant.

 

SPUGNA

(Grrrz Comic Art Book, Hollow Press, Progetto Stigma) in "Franco e i Tagliagole" se la vedrà con pirati, battaglie navali e mari d'Oriente seguendo l'esempio di Terry e i pirati.

 

TADDEI e ANGELINI

(Bel Ami Edizioni, Grrrz Comic Art Book, Panini Comics, Coconino) rovistano nei meandri del crime con "L'ISPETTORE", un emulo perverso di Dick Tracy.

 

VINCENZO FILOSA

(Canicola, Coconino) Da sempre un insospettabile e vorace lettore di Tex, Vincenzo vi trasporterà nel suo intimo e personalissimo selvaggio West con "le avventure di Cane Malato".

 

ALMAFE' & FEDERICO FABBRI

(Amianto Comics, Edizioni BD) vi teletrasportano in una giungla fatta di liane tossiche e realismo capitalista in compagnia di "Giungla Giorgio". Un Tarzan post-apocalittico.

 

_______________________________

 

BOLIDE: sette fumetti inediti in formato striscia 21x10, spillati, composti da 30 pagine bianco e nero e una copertina a colori.

Fedeli alla filosofia che da sempre anima le scelte editoriali di Amianto Comics, abbiamo concepito BOLIDE con l'idea di far collidere due categorie che nel fumetto troppo spesso tendono a ignorarsi: il "genere" e "l'autore". I fumettisti coinvolti hanno accettato con entusiasmo questa sfida, con concept incredibili e geniali pagine di anteprima! Noi non vediamo l'ora di mandare in stampa questi gioiellini, ma voi dovrete aiutarci!

 

 

_______________________________

 

BOLIDE Digitale - La versione digitale delle strisce racchiuse in BOLIDE, un modo economico per leggere e sostenere il progetto.

 

BOLIDE Base -  La versione cartacea di BOLIDE! Riponi nella tua libreria i fumetti a strisce più fighi del 2019! [Questo perk è disponibile anche in versione RITIRO A LUCCA COMICS & GAMES]

 

BOLIDE Deluxe - Il perk giusto per chi vuole sostenere al meglio la campagna e ottenere un prodotto esclusivo, tutti i gadget e gli stretch goal! [Questo perk è disponibile anche in versione RITIRO A LUCCA COMICS & GAMES]

 

BOLIDE Amiantico - 20 PEZZI - Il perk ideale per quelli che non hanno mai letto altri fumetti Amianto Comics! BOLIDE + i primi dieci numeri della rivista AMIANTO a un prezzo stracciato! [il numero 09 e 10 di AMIANTO usciranno rispettivamente a giugno e a novembre 2019]

BOLIDE Trasando - 25 PEZZI - Non se ne può più delle solite magliette nerd! Con questo perk potrete assicurarvi BOLIDE con scatola numerata Indiegogo, la T-shirt TRSD by Federico Fabbri e un buono di 10 euro da usare nello shop Trasando Stuff ! 

BOLIDE Wood - 50 PEZZI - Il tuo amico falegname lo farebbe meglio? Ne dubitiamo! Woodbe realizzerà nel suo laboratorio dei cofanetti personalizzati dove potrai racchiudere al meglio le strisce BOLIDE!

 

BOLIDE Wood Commission - 6 PEZZI - Vuoi un cofanetto di legno personalizzato, ma sei anche un fan sfegatato dei nostri autori? Ecco l'occasione giusta per ottenere una commission mai vista! Il coperchio del tuo cofanetto verrà personalizzato da uno degli autori BOLIDE a tua scelta: 6 pezzi unici!

 

BOLIDE Riccanza - 3 PEZZI - Per chi non si accontenta! Il perk di lusso che farà rodere di invidia i tuoi amici! Un cofanetto in legno pregiato (Betulla) realizzato da Woodbe, tutti i gadget possibili e immaginabili e una pipa targata BOLIDE intagliata a mano da Pennacchi Pipe! Un perfetto oggetto da arredo, per fumatori e non!

T-SHIRT BOLIDE TRASANDO - T-shirt realizzata da Trasando Stuff, uno dei migliori brand di streetwear italiani, per BOLIDE!  Artwork di Federico Fabbri. Aggiungi questa maglia in edizione limitata al tuo perk!

N.B. questo perk non ha spese di spedizione perché pensato per essere abbinato ad altri perk. Chi volesse acquistare solo la maglia, dovrà aggiungere 6 euro di donazione alla campagna per coprire i costi di spedizione.

Se insieme riusciremo a superare l'obiettivo dei 4.500€, in serbo per i nostri funder ci saranno delle GRANDI SOPRESE!

Per scoprirle non dovete far altro che sbloccare gli STRETCH GOAL che abbiamo progettato!

 

Ecco i primi 3 stretch goal e l'ultimo (una striscia aggiuntiva)!

 

N.B. Gli stretch goal, una volta sbloccati, verranno automaticamente aggiunti ai perk Deluxe, Wood, Trasando, Wood Commission, Amiantico e Riccanza, ma NON ai perk Digitale, T-shirt e Base.

La maggior parte dei fondi servirà a pagare gli autori, a coprire le spese di stampa e la produzione dei gadget che allegheremo ai vari perk. Il resto verrà speso in tasse Indiegogo e Paypal, packaging per la spedizione e spese promozionali sui social network. ***BOLIDE HA RAGGIUNTO IL GOAL! PER TUTTE LE INFORMAZIONI SUL PERK UPGRADE VI RIMANDIAMO ALLA SEZIONE FAQ. SOTTO POTETE LEGGERE LA LISTA DEGLI STRETCH GOAL DA RAGGIUNGERE!***
 

 
avventura s. f. – 1. b. Impresa rischiosa ma attraente e piena di fascino...
 
BOLIDE è un progetto che unisce alcuni tra i migliori fumettisti del panorama italiano contemporaneo e il classico fumetto avventuroso. Abbiamo chiamato a raccolta alcuni tra i migliori fumettisti contemporanei e assegnato loro 7 generi diversi con cui cimentarsi. Avranno a disposizione 30 pagine in formato striscia 21x10 per piegare le convezioni di genere e far rivivere a modo loro la spy story, la space opera, il cavalleresco, il fumetto di guerra,  il crime, il western e il tarzanide.
Le 7 strisce verranno poi racchiuse in un cofanetto, una confezione di design appositamente realizzata per non sfigurare all'interno delle librerie degli appassionati di fumetto.
A tre anni dalla sua fondazione e dopo più di dodici mesi di progettazione, l'associazione culturale Amianto Comics lancia il suo primo crowdfunding. Dopo aver dato alle stampe più di un migliaio di pagine di fumetto autoprodotto - tra cui il quadrimestrale Amianto, la collana di graphic novel Amianto Comics Presenta, il webcomic Smokey e progetti sperimentali come I Fiori del Male e Il Corvo della linea Reflusso - crediamo sia arrivato il momento di alzare l'asticella, ma per farlo abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto!
BOLIDE verrà stampato solo se riusciremo a raggiungere la cifra necessaria. Aiutandoci, oltre alle 7 strisce, potrete ricevere gadget ed edizioni limitate realizzate con la collaborazione dei nostri partner, tre giovani realtà artigianali del territorio: TRASANDO STUFF, Woodbe e Pennacchi Pipe.
N.B. Se la campagna avrà successo, BOLIDE sarà disponibile a partire da novembre 2019, in occasione di Lucca Comics & Games, ma solo tramite la campagna crowdfunding sarà possibile ottenere perk esclusivi e limitati e sbloccare i nostri stretch goal!
 
__________________________

 
Ecco gli autori che hanno accettato di cimentarsi in questa ardita impresa!
 
NOVA
(This Is Not A Love Song, BAO Publishing, Progetto Stigma) racconterà un'avventurosa spy story, "Combat Geghegè", ispirata da un classico come Modesty Blaise.

 
TUONO PETTINATO
(GRRRzetic, Rizzoli Lizard, Longanesi, Linus, Internazionale) rivolterà come un calzino la space opera a la Flash Gordon per raccontare le storture dell’Italia contemporanea con i suoi “Sindaci”.

 
FRANCESCO GUARNACCIA
(Mammaiuto, Shockdom, Rizzoli, Internazionale, Bao Publishing) narrerà le ardimentose imprese "cavalleresche" di "Pick-up Prince", un odierno Prince Valiant.

 
SPUGNA
(Grrrz Comic Art Book, Hollow Press, Progetto Stigma) in "Franco e i Tagliagole" se la vedrà con pirati, battaglie navali e mari d'Oriente seguendo l'esempio di Terry e i pirati.

 

TADDEI e ANGELINI

(Bel Ami Edizioni, Grrrz Comic Art Book, Panini Comics, Coconino) rovistano nei meandri del crime con "L'ISPETTORE", un emulo perverso di Dick Tracy.

 
VINCENZO FILOSA
(Canicola, Coconino) Da sempre un insospettabile e vorace lettore di Tex, Vincenzo vi trasporterà nel suo intimo e personalissimo selvaggio West con "le avventure di Cane Malato".

 

ALMAFE' & FEDERICO FABBRI

(Amianto Comics, Edizioni BD) vi teletrasportano in una giungla fatta di liane tossiche e realismo capitalista in compagnia di "Giungla Giorgio". Un Tarzan post-apocalittico.

 
_______________________________

 
BOLIDE: sette fumetti inediti in formato striscia 21x10, spillati, composti da 30 pagine bianco e nero e una copertina a colori.
Fedeli alla filosofia che da sempre anima le scelte editoriali di Amianto Comics, abbiamo concepito BOLIDE con l'idea di far collidere due categorie che nel fumetto troppo spesso tendono a ignorarsi: il "genere" e "l'autore". I fumettisti coinvolti hanno accettato con entusiasmo questa sfida, con concept incredibili e geniali pagine di anteprima! Noi non vediamo l'ora di mandare in stampa questi gioiellini, ma voi dovrete aiutarci!
 




 
_______________________________

 
BOLIDE Digitale - La versione digitale delle strisce racchiuse in BOLIDE, un modo economico per leggere e sostenere il progetto.

 
BOLIDE Base -  La versione cartacea di BOLIDE! Riponi nella tua libreria i fumetti a strisce più fighi del 2019! [Questo perk è disponibile anche in versione RITIRO A LUCCA COMICS & GAMES]

 
BOLIDE Deluxe - Il perk giusto per chi vuole sostenere al meglio la campagna e ottenere un prodotto esclusivo, tutti i gadget e gli stretch goal! [Questo perk è disponibile anche in versione RITIRO A LUCCA COMICS & GAMES]

 
BOLIDE Amiantico - 20 PEZZI - Il perk ideale per quelli che non hanno mai letto altri fumetti Amianto Comics! BOLIDE + i primi dieci numeri della rivista AMIANTO a un prezzo stracciato! [il numero 09 e 10 di AMIANTO usciranno rispettivamente a giugno e a novembre 2019]

BOLIDE Trasando - 25 PEZZI - Non se ne può più delle solite magliette nerd! Con questo perk potrete assicurarvi BOLIDE con scatola numerata Indiegogo, la T-shirt TRSD by Federico Fabbri e un buono di 10 euro da usare nello shop Trasando Stuff ! 

BOLIDE Wood - 50 PEZZI - Il tuo amico falegname lo farebbe meglio? Ne dubitiamo! Woodbe realizzerà nel suo laboratorio dei cofanetti personalizzati dove potrai racchiudere al meglio le strisce BOLIDE!
 
BOLIDE Wood Commission - 6 PEZZI - Vuoi un cofanetto di legno personalizzato, ma sei anche un fan sfegatato dei nostri autori? Ecco l'occasione giusta per ottenere una commission mai vista! Il coperchio del tuo cofanetto verrà personalizzato da uno degli autori BOLIDE a tua scelta: 6 pezzi unici!

 
BOLIDE Riccanza - 3 PEZZI - Per chi non si accontenta! Il perk di lusso che farà rodere di invidia i tuoi amici! Un cofanetto in legno pregiato (Betulla) realizzato da Woodbe, tutti i gadget possibili e immaginabili e una pipa targata BOLIDE intagliata a mano da Pennacchi Pipe! Un perfetto oggetto da arredo, per fumatori e non!

T-SHIRT BOLIDE TRASANDO - T-shirt realizzata da Trasando Stuff, uno dei migliori brand di streetwear italiani, per BOLIDE!  Artwork di Federico Fabbri. Aggiungi questa maglia in edizione limitata al tuo perk!
N.B. questo perk non ha spese di spedizione perché pensato per essere abbinato ad altri perk. Chi volesse acquistare solo la maglia, dovrà aggiungere 6 euro di donazione alla campagna per coprire i costi di spedizione.  

___________________________

 
Se insieme riusciremo a superare l'obiettivo dei 4.500€, in serbo per i nostri funder ci saranno delle GRANDI SOPRESE!
Per scoprirle non dovete far altro che sbloccare gli STRETCH GOAL che abbiamo progettato!

 
Ecco i primi 3 stretch goal e l'ultimo (una striscia aggiuntiva)!

 


N.B. Gli stretch goal, una volta sbloccati, verranno automaticamente aggiunti ai perk Deluxe, Wood, Trasando, Wood Commission, Amiantico e Riccanza, ma NON ai perk Digitale, T-shirt e Base.
____________________________


 
La maggior parte dei fondi servirà a pagare gli autori, a coprire le spese di stampa e la produzione dei gadget che allegheremo ai vari perk. Il resto verrà speso in tasse Indiegogo e Paypal, packaging per la spedizione e spese promozionali sui social network. story:
Nosebleed Studio är Sveriges främsta mangastudio. Vi startade 2006 och publicerar årligen antologier med våra medlemmars serier.

Våra fyra medlemmar är: 

  • Catarina Batista
  • Joakim Waller, skapare av Steam Dragon Express
  • Alice Engström, skapare av den kommande August in June
  • Natalia Batista, skapare av Mjau, A Song for Elise and Sword Princess Amaltea

Manga kommer från början från Japan, men har idag inspirerat skapare över hela världen. Våra medlemmar är några av vårt lands mest skickliga mangatecknare och i våra serier sammanför vi den japanska seriestilen med svenska historier och teman.  

Nosebleed Studio har gett ut tre tidigare mangaantologier:
5 Years Jubilee Anthology, Seaside Stories och Swedish Manga Anthology.

Nu börjar lagren sina och vi vill göra nytryck, men istället för att trycka varje bok för sig vill vi göra en snygg samlingsbok med hållbar hårdpärm och alla serierna på svenska. Boken kommer att vara i A5-format med över 450 sidor och innehåller både våra tidigare böckers serier samt ca 15 sidor nytt material. 
Omslaget kommer vara illustrerat av Joakim Waller.

Vi söker ca 10 000 kr för att täcka upp den sista delen av tryckkostnaderna, så att vi kan trycka 1000 exemplar, vilket kommer att vara vår hittills största förstaupplaga. 

Boken kommer innehålla följande serier:
Ropa varg av Catarina Batista 
Kattliv av Alice Engström
Ocean Stars av Joakim Waller 
Penguin Revolution av Joakim Waller  
Kärlek vid första bettet av Catarina Batista 
Kapten Kanin av Natalia Batista 
Stygg vovve! av Natalia Batista 
En hjälpande tass av Catarina Batista 
A-M. Gundown av Catarina Batista 
Circus Romantique av Natalia Batista 
Dog Project av Alice Engström 
En vän på kroken av Natalia Batista 
Seaseide av Alice Engström 
Leo av Joakim Waller 
Mia min Mia av Catarina Batista 
Guide till svenska ord av Natalia Batista och Joakim Waller
Midsommarhjärtan av Natalia Batista 


I donationssummorna ingår även frakten för de presenter som vi sänder dig som tack för gåvan.

Självklart är det möjligt att bara donera pengar för att stödja trycket, men vi misstänker att de flesta av er även är intresserade av de presenter vi utlovar vid varje presentnivå. 
Här nedan kan ni se en tydlig presentpyramid över hur mycket man behöver donera för vardera presentnivå:


Bokmärke & pin: Du får ett av våra bokmärken och ett pin med slumpvis valda motiv.
Svartvit originalbild av en av våra karaktärer: Du får en svartvit tuschad originalbild i A6-format av valfri seriefigur från våra serier (från Nosebleed Studio tidigare böcker eller andra verk våra medlemmar har gjort).
Boken, hårdpärm 456 sidor: Du får ett exemplar av Nosebleed Studios Stora mangasamling, inbunden, svartvit inlaga och färgomslag. 
Färgporträtt av max 2 pers (+10€ per extra pers): Du får ett färgporträtt i A5-format av upp till två personer/karaktärer/djur, avbildade efter foto-/bildreferenser du skickat oss:

B4/A3 original-seriesida: Du får välja en av våra fyra utvalda originalseriesidor, först till kvarn gäller dock:

story:
CREATIVE TEAM:

  • Art, creation, character design, and lettering by Timothy Lim 
  • Written, edited & co-created by Mark Pellegrini 
  • Front cover by Timothy Lim & Genzoman 
  • Back cover by CuteSexyRobutts 
  • Additional art by Sashi Perdigao, Karat 'N Shtick 
  • "Velvet Thunder" (theme of Kamen America) composed by Doug Garrett 

 

MADE and PRINTED in the USA

Kamen America tells the story of Charlotte "Carly" Vanders, a seamstress from Indiana who aspires to become a fashionista someday. She pursues all possible venues to make her dream come true, including joining the USO as a costume designer, dancer, and entertainer.

It's easier said than done, however, and Carly grows more and more frustrated as her goals become seemingly unattainable and her role remains unnoticed.

A twist of fate occurs during a tour for the troops abroad when a freak accident from the skies turns Carly into a living battery: super-charged and able to manipulate her bio-electricity into weapons and granting her the ability to fly.

...and she becomes a blonde. That's sort of important later.

Unfortunately for her, a slew of monsters begin appearing at around the same time! Juggling between being a full-time monster fighter, fashionista, and famous idol is a difficult task, and Carly's principles are put to the test as she weighs her options - and frustrations - as the masked maiden known as Kamen America.

She'll also have to contend with a familiar foe from a foreign land, as she discovers that maybe lightning does strike twice!

We are thrilled to offer you an outstanding, 56 page square bound book that is 100% finished! Our straightforward campaign is simply to get the books to you and serves as a pre-order: we had a successful run on Kickstarter and want to make sure to offer the same physical perks to our IndieGoGo readers. The book has covers with artwork from two leading comics professionals: a back cover with colors by UDON legend Genzoman and a front cover by CuteSexyRobutts. A supplemental pinup by Patriotika cover artist Sasha Perdigao is featured in the book as well.

Our perks include an acrylic standee, dakimakura body pillow covers, and a head sketch perk. Also, all backers will get a complimentary sticker with their purchase!

Kamen America is the 9th collaborative book by artist / creator Timothy Lim and writer / co-creator Mark Pellegrini. The duo has worked over the decade on a number of licensed works for merchandising, comic book covers, and fully illustrated comics, including their original book Black Hops: U.S.A.-*-G.I. by Antarctic Press. Kamen America marks our 5th crowdfunded campaign collaboration and we are happy to bring this book to our IndieGoGo customers: we guarantee a quality book delivered on time!

story:
What is the most important thing in life to you... would you travel across the universe to find out?

That's the question facing three 14-year-old girls from vastly different worlds, and joined by chance. On their journey to find the answer, they will encounter fantastic creatures, face down hordes of enemies, confront generation-spanning vendettas, and discover sources of unimaginable power. 

They just have to survive meeting each other - because if they can't, then the galaxy is doomed.

This is #1 of a five-issue mini-series about magic spells, sentient robots, superheroes, martial arts, spaceships, and a lot more. 

 

STRETCH GOALS!

 

Unlocked at $1,700: Matte lamination and spot UV treatment for all locally printed book covers!

Unlocked at $2,000: Pre-orders for issue #0 of Tales of the Twelve Stars!

 

Next stretch goal unlocks at $2,500!

 

Milestone bonuses! Extra FREE stuff unlocked for ALL backers:

  • Unlocked at 40% funding: C is for Cthulhu: The Lovecraft Alphabet Book

  • Unlocked at 60% funding: Gone #1

  • Unlocked at 80% funding: Rancidville: A Sour Beginning

  • Unlocked at 100% funding: Sunmaker #1

  • Unlocked at 30 backers: Mp3 of "Break" by Tempered Mental

  • Unlocked at 40 backers: Mp3 of "Undone" by Tempered Mental

 

Next milestone bonus unlocks at 50 backers!

 

 

The story behind the story

I’ve loved comics for longer than I can remember. Honestly, I’m surprised it took me this long to finally make a real comic. It wasn’t until I became a father that I had anything to say I thought was worth sharing with others. Specifically, with my kids.

I wanted to make something for them which featured influences and aspects of as many Asian cultures as possible. There is an incredible wealth of material to explore, and the vast majority of it is so rarely highlighted. The thing is, even though I grew up in South East Asia, I didn’t grow up with Asian comics. Instead, I had Marvel, DC, Asterix, Tintin and Calvin & Hobbes.

This project had to be something that I could personally really get into, and also share with my young children. I love how The Avengers, Samurai Jack, Batman: the Animated Series, Star Wars, Raiders of the Lost Ark and Pirates of the Caribbean: Curse of the Black Pearl manage to balance being serious and light-hearted, while being jam-packed with action from the word “go”.

I also wanted to have several female protagonists. Though the idea of comics aimed at both young girls and boys has seen a lot of improvement in recent years, in relative terms, there’s still not all that much out there for them.

I want my daughter to have more female role models that she can not only look up to, but relate to, as a girl growing up in multi-racial Malaysia. I also want to teach my son to respect women, and this seemed like a good way to do it,

Ultimately, you could say that this project is my hope for my kids: to live a life of adventure, to have a positive group of close and supportive friends, to always help those in need, and to grow up to be a strong, confident and caring people. And to know that if they turn out to be smartasses, it's cool with their dad (but not their mom).

After a year of collaboration with Zie, here we are: two guys from Kuala Lumpur, with an American-style comic, about an Asian-inspired fantasy universe, that I created specifically for my kids. Everything that led to this point was like a perfect storm and I don’t think there’s another story that I could have told right now.

 

Is this book for you? YES, IF one or more of the following is true for you...

  • ...Anything can be improved by adding "...IN SPACE!" after it. "Raiders of the Lost Ark... IN SPACE!" "Harry Potter... IN SPACE!" Nifty, eh?
  • ...There aren't enough stories about young girls getting to be strong, smart, determined butt-kickers.
  • ...You are looking for comics that you can not only enjoy yourself, but also share with kids and young readers.

 

What do you get with Tales of the Twelve Stars?

  • A story that's about family, friendship, growing up and becoming your own person, as much as it is about punching robots in the face.
  • A 36-page full-colour comic (featuring 32 pages of story) - and an option to double that with digital deluxe editions!
  • Lots of digital rewards, which are unaffected by shipping costs (great for international backers), and Print On Demand fulfilment for American backers.
  • Locally-printed books are 16.83 cm x 26 cm, on 105 gsm gloss paper, with a 128 gsm cover.
  • How about a free 32-page comic? Try before you buy, with a Digital PDF copy of Tales of the Twelve Stars #0 - the prologue to the series!

 

Important: To get a print copy of Tales of the Twelve Stars #1, please make a donation of $6 per copy, and check the shipping section to see if additional charges apply. If you have any questions about shipping, please contact me and I'll do my best to help!

 

The cast

 

YUN: A prodigy in the magical art of the Craft.

 

RADHA: A super-powered wanderer.

 

ZARA: A gifted inventor and engineer.

 

SHOU: Yun's younger brother, and a highly skilled annoyer.

 

TETSUJIN: Arguably evil, probably insane, definitely dangerous.

 

 

Why Indiegogo?

We’re on Indiegogo to fund an offset print run of Tales of the Twelve Stars #1, which can then be sold conventions and similar events, as well as online. We also want to get this story in front of as many people as possible, and while Malaysia does not have access to every crowdfunding platform, Indiegogo is by far the best channel available.

 

How much do we need, and what will the funds be used for?

We're asking for a base goal of USD$1,500. That's enough to print 500 copies of Tales of the Twelve Stars, issue #1. We would love to increase the size of the print run, upgrade the cover of the book with a spot UV treatment, and even print copies of issue #0, and we will definitely do all those if we raise enough funds. In the meantime, this is the minimum amount that we need to get this project off the ground.

The majority of funds raised through this campaign will go towards printing the books, with a smaller portion to be used to cover any shipping costs. There is also an amount budgeted to pay for Indiegogo’s platform fees, as well as payment processing, and a fee for international wire transfers. I've also made sure to budget an added amount for unexpected expenses or increases in shipping costs.

Should we manage to hit our goal and go past it, excess funds will be used to upgrade the book itself, as well as to increase the size of the print run. And if we still have money, we will roll all of it back into the project, by putting it towards future art and lettering costs.

 

Need to see more?

We got you. Check out the first few pages of #1! 

These pages are in the process of being lettered, and when that’s done I’ll put them up here.

 

The team behind Tales of the Twelve Stars

Writer: Albert Lim

Albert Lim is a comics writer based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. An award-winning copywriter with a Bronze Lion at Cannes to his name, he is also a Comics Experience alumnus, having taken a number of comics writing courses and masterclasses taught by some of the best teachers in the industry. With almost two decades of experience in six martial arts, he has spent more than eight years coaching the gentle-not-gentle art of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, and was one of the first team of athletes to represent Malaysia in Jujitsu.

 

Artist: Zie Aun Tan

Zie Aun Tan, also based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, graduated with a degree in Software Engineering, and has been doing anything but. He recently sold his education business to pursue art full-time. He likes cute things and Magic: the Gathering. In his free time, he fights existential dread.

 

Letterer: Sean Rinehart

Sean Rinehart letters and illustrates comics and children’s books by night and chases his kids around by day. He has worked on titles such as The V-Card, Angle of Attack, Billy the Dark Elf, and Campaigners among many others. You can find him on twitter @seanrinehart or via seanrinehart.com.

 

Perks for campaign backers

IMPORTANT UPDATE: You will need to make a separate donation to the campaign in order to get a print copy. Please check the shipping section to see if any additional fees apply.

Shipping for physical perks

Reminder: for a print copy of Tales of the Twelve Stars #1, please make a donation of $6 plus shipping. You are able to make several pledges if you want to, so this can be in addition to another pledge.

If you do not want a print copy, there are no shipping charges.

Most of the perks for this campaign are digital, and this is because most international shipping costs from Malaysia are pretty painful. This is also the reason I've decided to use Ka-Blam, a Print On Demand service, for fulfilment in America and for most international orders.

 

Self-collection of books

If you are able to collect your copy from me in person, then there is no additional shipping charge.

  • Kuala Lumpur: I will be at Comic Fiesta, December 16-17, 2017, KLCC. Table information will be released as soon as it's available.
  • Kuching, Sarawak: I will be in Kuching in early January 2018 (2018! Not 2017. Thanks Reuben!).

 

SHIPPING CHARGES FROM MALAYSIA (all prices in US Dollars)

  • Within Malaysia, self-collection: NO SHIPPING FEE.
  • Within Malaysia: Add $3 to your donation per book ($9 total per book: $6 + $3).
  • Singapore: Add $14 to your donation ($20 total for one book: $6 + $14) for up to two books. 

SHIPPING CHARGES, PRINT ON DEMAND (KA-BLAM)

  • America: Add $3 per book ($9 total per book: $6 + $3)
  • Canada: Add $10 per book ($16 total per book: $6 + $10)
  • Rest of the world: Add $15 per book ($21 total per book: $6 + $15)

 

Risks and challenges

So. This is my first comic, and it’s my first crowdfunding campaign, so these are pretty uncharted waters for me.

To offset this, I’ve put in a lot of work to surround myself with as many experts as possible in the ComixLaunch course, where I have benefitted tremendously from the knowledge and experiences of a group of seasoned creators. I have a long way to go, but I couldn’t have asked for a better start.

Additionally, I will be using a Print On Demand service for fulfilment in America (please see the shipping section for more information). Backers who choose this option will save on shipping costs, but just won't be able to receive other physical rewards like prints.

Ultimately, as much as I do to prevent problems before they occur, there is always the possibility of something going wrong - and if it does, I will do everything I can to make it right.

This project is very close to my heart, and my goal is to make sure every single backer leaves this experience satisfied and looking forward to the next instalment of Tales of the Twelve Stars.

If you have any questions or concerns that I may not already have covered, please feel free to message me. I want to make your involvement in this project as rewarding as possible.

 

Thank you for your time and support!
story_txt:
What is the most important thing in life to you... would you travel across the universe to find out?That's the question facing three 14-year-old girls from vastly different worlds, and joined by chance. On their journey to find the answer, they will encounter fantastic creatures, face down hordes of enemies, confront generation-spanning vendettas, and discover sources of unimaginable power. They just have to survive meeting each other - because if they can't, then the galaxy is doomed.This is #1 of a five-issue mini-series about magic spells, sentient robots, superheroes, martial arts, spaceships, and a lot more.  STRETCH GOALS! Unlocked at $1,700: Matte lamination and spot UV treatment for all locally printed book covers!Unlocked at $2,000: Pre-orders for issue #0 of Tales of the Twelve Stars! Next stretch goal unlocks at $2,500! Milestone bonuses! Extra FREE stuff unlocked for ALL backers:
Unlocked at 40% funding: C is for Cthulhu: The Lovecraft Alphabet Book
Unlocked at 60% funding: Gone #1
Unlocked at 80% funding: Rancidville: A Sour Beginning
Unlocked at 100% funding: Sunmaker #1
Unlocked at 30 backers: Mp3 of "Break" by Tempered Mental
Unlocked at 40 backers: Mp3 of "Undone" by Tempered Mental
 Next milestone bonus unlocks at 50 backers!  The story behind the storyI’ve loved comics for longer than I can remember. Honestly, I’m surprised it took me this long to finally make a real comic. It wasn’t until I became a father that I had anything to say I thought was worth sharing with others. Specifically, with my kids.I wanted to make something for them which featured influences and aspects of as many Asian cultures as possible. There is an incredible wealth of material to explore, and the vast majority of it is so rarely highlighted. The thing is, even though I grew up in South East Asia, I didn’t grow up with Asian comics. Instead, I had Marvel, DC, Asterix, Tintin and Calvin & Hobbes.This project had to be something that I could personally really get into, and also share with my young children. I love how The Avengers, Samurai Jack, Batman: the Animated Series, Star Wars, Raiders of the Lost Ark and Pirates of the Caribbean: Curse of the Black Pearl manage to balance being serious and light-hearted, while being jam-packed with action from the word “go”.I also wanted to have several female protagonists. Though the idea of comics aimed at both young girls and boys has seen a lot of improvement in recent years, in relative terms, there’s still not all that much out there for them.I want my daughter to have more female role models that she can not only look up to, but relate to, as a girl growing up in multi-racial Malaysia. I also want to teach my son to respect women, and this seemed like a good way to do it,Ultimately, you could say that this project is my hope for my kids: to live a life of adventure, to have a positive group of close and supportive friends, to always help those in need, and to grow up to be a strong, confident and caring people. And to know that if they turn out to be smartasses, it's cool with their dad (but not their mom).After a year of collaboration with Zie, here we are: two guys from Kuala Lumpur, with an American-style comic, about an Asian-inspired fantasy universe, that I created specifically for my kids. Everything that led to this point was like a perfect storm and I don’t think there’s another story that I could have told right now. Is this book for you? YES, IF one or more of the following is true for you...
...Anything can be improved by adding "...IN SPACE!" after it. "Raiders of the Lost Ark... IN SPACE!" "Harry Potter... IN SPACE!" Nifty, eh?
...There aren't enough stories about young girls getting to be strong, smart, determined butt-kickers.
...You are looking for comics that you can not only enjoy yourself, but also share with kids and young readers.
 What do you get with Tales of the Twelve Stars?
A story that's about family, friendship, growing up and becoming your own person, as much as it is about punching robots in the face.
A 36-page full-colour comic (featuring 32 pages of story) - and an option to double that with digital deluxe editions!
Lots of digital rewards, which are unaffected by shipping costs (great for international backers), and Print On Demand fulfilment for American backers.
Locally-printed books are 16.83 cm x 26 cm, on 105 gsm gloss paper, with a 128 gsm cover.
How about a free 32-page comic? Try before you buy, with a Digital PDF copy of Tales of the Twelve Stars #0 - the prologue to the series!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • From Scotland who has been living in Toronto for over 5 years now, I am a full time character designer by day and comic artist at night.
  • The campaign is to help support the print costs for both book and enamel pins -  I have ad this story in my head for some time and I want to share this with you all, reveal these characters and the world they live in.
  • You will help me express something so deep and personal -  After losing someone very dear to me last year in the summer I took some time off to recover, but more then ever I am more and ready to work hard and get the story out to the world!

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • $1500 would be ideal to cover the costs of book prints (done locally), enamel stock and shipping as those are coming from the States!
  • The book will be very high quality -  10 page preview of finished pages,  development of the story and art, character designs, and Illustrations associated with the series. Lots of art to study and see the process of making a comic!
  • If I do go over ( that would be awesome) I would pout the rest of the money to more print costs for future shows that I will be attending over the summer. Also for those who contribute a lot will have a signed copy of the book and posted to them :)

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • It's a story I have had developing in my head for some time and I am more then ever motivated to get this drawn and scripted for the world to read. It will feature a lot of personal challenges and unique perspectives that will touch a lot of hearts. Not trying to sound corny but this story is a representation of my life and struggles but also overcoming these obstacles. I have characters that I am discovering myself and the story it evolving to something quite special.
  • This book is to show you what I have in mind and what I want to create, I adore storytelling and this one is gonna be a good one! it's going to have it all  -  true crime, loss, childhood into adulthood and action! Kinda dark but very real issues are going to be addressed and represented in a beautiful artistic way that I hope the audience will enjoy.
  • I want to have this book and pins available for TCAF 11th- 12th of May.  I will be selling them at my table. 

Risks & Challenges

  • If the worse comes I will have to shorten the  total amount of pages in the book -  but I am already in schedule for the comic to be made so the 10 pages will at least be available. 
  • Like I mentioned I am on schedule - I will have content to show and the pins will be on time. But if the worst is to come then I would just ship signed books to contributes.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share this link and let other comic-artsy- loving folks know this is happening and they won't be disappointed. It is high original quality goodness that needs the support!

story:
Welcome to Silver Fox Comics'crowdfunding campaign for "Bazza, The Bradman Bat & the Drop Bears" in "Coronapocalypse".



 

Bazza the Bogan Barbarian, The Drop Bears Thriller and Killer, a Sentient Cricket Bat and a Talking Torana battle Zombies, Carnivorous Cane Toads and Giant Spiders against the backdrop of Covid-19 in a wild night of maximum mayhem in "Coronapocalypse".

This campaign is to help us raise funds for the first print run. The great news is that this release is complete and ready to go! That's right, all the artwork, story and production has been finished!  We just need your assistance to get this printed. Pre-order now and we'll deliver in July!


New to the Bazza the Bogan Barbarian Series?
This is Australia's wildest comic! Meet the Australian legend Bazza the Bogan Barbarian. Bazza's a boss, he's got two drop bears Thriller and Killer, and he runs "Bazza's Monster Killing Business" from his mancave in Deadfern, South Sydney.

Bazza barracks for South Sydney, he loves his vegemite, he dunks his meat pies in beer and he's armed with the weapon every Aussie should have - a cricket bat signed by Donald Bradman. It's more than a cricket bat, it's a sentient cricket bat who might just be Bazza's conscience.  Bazza's married to his ball breaking wife Shazza, who's quite the monster killer herself. Together they got two little teenage squids Aero and Michelle.

This book is unashamedly Australian. Our mission was to create an all Aussie Iconic Action Hero Legend! The US have got Captain America, the UK have got James Bond and Mr Bean, and now Australia has Bazza, Shazza, The Drop Bears Thriller and Killer,and The Bradman Bat! This is a family that's Savage not average!

To date, Silver Fox Comics have released three "Bazza, The Bogan Barbarian" graphic novels: "Sydney Zombie Apocalypse", "Australian Alien Invasion" and "Carnivorous Cane Toads on a Cruise". This new release "Bazza, The Bradman Bat & The Drop Bears" is a new series.


 


 


Bonus Story - "The Bondi Lifesaver Zombie"

  • This production is a 56 page full colour graphic novel consisting of 2 stories: "Coronapocalypse" and "The Bondi Life Saver Zombie" (originally presented in our "Zombie Cities" graphic novel which is now sold out.
  • This is a large format release measuring 20 x 31 cm. This is closer in size to European comics and much larger than the standard 26 x 17 cm US comic size. It's an incredible canvas size to view the artwork. 
  • It 's printed on premium stock - 259 gsm gloss for the cover and 113 gm for interior pages.
  • This book is produced, written and directed by Sydney's Silver Fox Comics - Sorab Del Rio and Don Ticchio, Art by Eder Messias, Paul Abstruse, Don Ticchio. Colours by Edwin Estrada, Chuck Obach.

Here's the complete Bazza Collection



This is Silver Fox Comics 10th year anniversary in Indie Comic Book Publishing

  • The Silver Foxes are Don Ticchio (The Silver) and Sorab Del Rio (The Fox) who produce, direct and write all releases. Watch an interview with Sorab from Toy Reel from OzCC talking about Bazza.

     
  • They are based in Sydney Australia and have been a convention favourite in pop culture conventions across Australia from Supanova, OzComicCon, ComicGong and more,
  • Releases include the "Bazza, The Bogan Barbarian" graphic novels, Zombie Cities, The Adventures of Rudy Cool, Geeks Vs Jocks and 2 issues for Zorro.
  • Join us at www.facebook.com/silverfoxcomics
     
     

     

     

What is this campaign for and when will the perks be sent?

  • This campaign is to raise funds for the first print run of 200 books and prints to cover perks from this campaign plus our first convention + postage/ platform fees.
  • As mentioned, he artwork, story and production has been finished! We just need your help to get this printed.
  • The campaign will end in early June. Following payment - 15 days from campaign end, we will print books in late June with delivery slated for July 2020.

    Thanks in advance to all of you who pre-order! You'll love it - it's a killer book!
