Our mission was to create an all Aussie Iconic Action Hero Legend! The US have got Captain America, the UK have got James Bond and Mr Bean, and now Australia has Bazza, Shazza, The Drop Bears Thriller and Killer,and The Bradman Bat! This is a family that's Savage not average!To date, Silver Fox Comics have released three "Bazza, The Bogan Barbarian" graphic novels: "Sydney Zombie Apocalypse", "Australian Alien Invasion" and "Carnivorous Cane Toads on a Cruise". This new release "Bazza, The Bradman Bat & The Drop Bears" is a new series.



 
 
Bonus Story - "The Bondi Lifesaver Zombie"


This production is a 56 page full colour graphic novel consisting of 2 stories: "Coronapocalypse" and "The Bondi Life Saver Zombie" (originally presented in our "Zombie Cities" graphic novel which is now sold out.
This is a large format release measuring 20 x 31 cm. This is closer in size to European comics and much larger than the standard 26 x 17 cm US comic size. It's an incredible canvas size to view the artwork. 
It 's printed on premium stock - 259 gsm gloss for the cover and 113 gm for interior pages.
This book is produced, written and directed by Sydney's Silver Fox Comics - Sorab Del Rio and Don Ticchio, Art by Eder Messias, Paul Abstruse, Don Ticchio. Colours by Edwin Estrada, Chuck Obach.

Here's the complete Bazza CollectionThis is Silver Fox Comics 10th year anniversary in Indie Comic Book Publishing

The Silver Foxes are Don Ticchio (The Silver) and Sorab Del Rio (The Fox) who produce, direct and write all releases. Watch an interview with Sorab from Toy Reel from OzCC talking about Bazza.
 
They are based in Sydney Australia and have been a convention favourite in pop culture conventions across Australia from Supanova, OzComicCon, ComicGong and more,
Releases include the "Bazza, The Bogan Barbarian" graphic novels, Zombie Cities, The Adventures of Rudy Cool, Geeks Vs Jocks and 2 issues for Zorro.
Join us at www.facebook.com/silverfoxcomics 

 
 

 


What is this campaign for and when will the perks be sent?

This campaign is to raise funds for the first print run of 200 books and prints to cover perks from this campaign plus our first convention + postage/ platform fees.
As mentioned, he artwork, story and production has been finished! We just need your help to get this printed.
The campaign will end in early June. Following payment - 15 days from campaign end, we will print books in late June with delivery slated for July 2020.Thanks in advance to all of you who pre-order! You'll love it - it's a killer book!

story:
• I'm Rob Mulligan(from the video) and I'm creating/producing a comic book called "Mulligan" about an unconventional hero and a multibillion dollar company turning people into fuel, using portals to other dimensions, conspiracy theories and absolute gory violence! Mulligan has 2 twisted stories planned for this fundraising campaign, issues #1-5 and issues #6-10. You follow Mulligan along his journey for revenge and second chances, learning of his disturbing upbringing and medical conditions. You watch as he destroys everything in his path searching for answers while doing his "job". You watch as people are drained of their life energy to make fuel, causing them to be "sheeple"... a mere shell of what they once were... Mulligan is a violent story of conspiracy and revenge! Will you help me bring it to life? I'm working 7 days a week at this, and putting in my own money and time but I need some help! I'm not looking for a hand out to live or to buy me stuff. I'm just looking for fans to be part of this comic by helping me with printing the series for distribution. I hope you continue reading and consider helping out!
  • I'm a musician, business owner and inventor for over a decade. I've been on numerous national tours and events and created many great products and websites. You can learn more about me by exploring my sites and links listed here: www.mulligan3.com (but please do that AFTER you read more about my fundraising campaign!) This comic book series is VERY important to me and I need your help so please take the time to read everything =)

I'm paying and budgeting for the artwork, editing and promotions and putting in the time daily creating, writing and working. I just need a little help with duplication for distribution. I have a few connections to distribution but I need to initially provide stock issues for sale in nationwide stores!

Here's what we need and what you get:

  • We need to raise at least $1000 for duplication for national distribution.
  • HAVE YOU EVER WANTED TO BE IN A COMIC BOOK? We have the most unique perks! BE IN OUR COMIC BOOK SERIES and get signed limited editions, sketches, posters and more! Read all the perks listed and don't miss your chance to be part of the story! Most perks ship Dec. 2015 but some in Apr. 2016 for the issues #6-10 slated releases. Check out these banners below, BUT READ THE DETAILS IN THE PERKS LIST to see everything you'll get!

  • If we don't reach ALL our funding goals, don't worry! We have money we can cut from promotions planned to help make the difference and make sure everyone's perks are delivered! If we raise more than the minimum needed for duplication, we plan to add more to the perks for everyone and invest more into promotions/marketing to ensure the most exposure for our comic book and all characters involved!
  • FREE #WorkWorkWork Shirt IN WHATEVER SIZE YOU NEED ALONG WITH ISSUES 1-10 AND MORE, ADDED TO THE $40 OR MORE PERKS!


  • FREE STUFF FOR EVERYONE!!! THANKS TO MY SPONSORS, EVERYONE WILL GET EXTRA FREE STUFF WITH THEIR ORDER/DONATION!!!


Your contribution makes a HUGE impact on not only this comic book series, but all my future releases! Every penny you give helps manifest dreams and validate hard work!

  • Once we start our distribution deal for Mulligan, expects some story arcs and some more completely twisted ideas! You're funding this comic book series but you're really pouring gasoline onto the creative firestorm that is waiting to explode!
  • I welcome you to look me up on facebook, twitter, instagram and youtube and see my work ethics are genuine. I have even helped a movement of #WorkWorkWork on social networking sites to motivate people to do more and not be so easily satisfied in life. I'm trying my hardest to have success with my endeavors and your help is a HUGE factor! A little help goes a long way and I truly appreciate your support and donations!


The only risk is that we don't get the main distribution deal we're shooting for. If that doesn't happen, we already have a list of numerous other possible companies and last but not least, we can self-publish via Ka-Blam! NO MATTER WHAT, WE'RE RELEASING THIS COMIC BOOK SERIES! We don't stop till all perks are met! -Guaranteed! -Also, don't worry if all the perks are sold to be in this comic series. We have other releases coming very soon you can be part of! Bookmark & Stay tuned to our friends' site www.BeAComicBookCharacter.com and don't miss anything!

    Sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

    • Indiegogo has share tools to make it easy
    • Please share on facebook
    • Please share on twitter
    • Please email to friends and family
    • Please embed this campaign on your blog
    • Don't forget a little help goes a long way

    And that's all there is to it. I really give a BIG thanks to you for the support and kindness and time you've already given by reading my page! I hope to see you inside the pages of MULLIGAN!

story:
Hello! If you are a fan of when comics were escapist fun then this is for you! Part of ANTARCTIC PRESS' new SUPERVERSE line we are proud to have top notch writer CHUCK DIXON (writer of BATMAN and THE PUNISHER as well as many other popular comics) and KELSEY SHANNON (artist of X-MEN and JUSTICE LEAGUE) bring you all the classic trappings of a pulp filled adventure story filled with all the great characters from the golden age of JUNGLE COMICS!

Be part of the adventure and be a supporter, NOW!

 

KELSEY SHANNON's Amazing cover for the first issue!

Here's another page from Jungle #1

Kelsey is on fire!!!

 

 

JUST ADDED! The AMAZING DAVE DORMAN Poster!!!

 

Chuck Dixon says:

"This project has been in my mind for awhile, an all-in jungle adventure like the kind I loved as a kid. What we're doing here is taking all the best parts of a cliffhanger 

adventure and putting them in an action-packed story that turns the genre on the head. EVERYTHING you'd want in a feral jungle fantasy in a way you never expected 

to see it! Kelsey is providing amazing art for this series and Antarctic is bringing their expertise to make this one of the most attractive comics projects you'll see this year!"

story:
Something new! Guess what?! Yes! New comic pages!!! Our creative team and especially our comic artist Lika Dpiryan has been working really hard these days, and now we have the pleasure to present you the results of our incessant work! Like our comics? Want to become a part of our team? By donating a humble amount you’ll make a valuable contribution to our project! We have only few days left, what means, that every dollar counts! We need to get at least some small part of the amount in order to continue creating our dream! Become a Nolalandian magican, show the warmth of your Nolalandian heart!


 Welcome to NOLALAND!

This is our campaign to support the creation of NOLALAND - an amazing world full of magic and music. With the raised funds we will launch the main platform of our transmedia project- the NOLALAND website.

The website has several sections: 

  • web-comics;
  • a blog written by the main character - NOLA;
  • an educational section with video tutorials;
  •  reviews of YA books, movies, comics & games;
  • a forum and a creative corner for nolalandians, as well as lots of fun, games and  creativity competitions.

Behind all this content there is a very friendly, talented and reliable team, who share the passion for magic. Now, let us tell you a story.

Our protagonist - the fictional character Nola lives in the small town of Vanadzor. One day our producer-scriptwriter Hasmik and  Nola met. Maybe in a dream, maybe in a daydream, or reality… Nobody knows for sure. They befriended and Hasmik decided to write down Nola’s stories… Then one by one other characters came and introduced themselves and their stories created a new magical universe, which got the name of NolaLand – a place where the craziest dreams are born and brought to life.

Meet our Characters

Through our characters, who will somehow appear and disappear in the different parts of transmedia, we will stay connected to youth and address different  massages to them. Our heroes are young and rebellious, principled and selfless, courageous and inquisitive.They are all big fans of rock music. The curiosity takes them into sci-fi computer world where they have to fight against the corporation to save the area from major environmental catastrophe. And despite the dissensions that would appear among them during the story, the friends stay united and… the time will show.

At present we would like to introduce 5 of our main characters to you:

NOLALAND  transmedia project also includes:

  • A SONG FOR NOLA feature film (director Emil Mkrttchian).
  • a PC/mobile game (this is our top secret, please do not tell anyone)
  • rock music and much more...

What We Need & What You Get

We have been working really hard. We can't wait to share some of these results with you. Here are the main things that we have done so far: 

  • The first chapter of our web comics - it has full color pages, original story and beautiful artwork.
  • The script of the feature film “A Song for Nola”, which is intended to be released on 2016, 
  • The 5-minute pilot of the film (director Emil Mkrttchian). 
  • Nola has kindly provided us with some of her blog posts and cool illustrations

And so far our most important achievement is the community eager to see NolaLand online. We love and appreciate their involvement. They cheer with us for every achievement and are waiting for us to launch the project!

The funds will be allocated to:

The Impact

We are really thankful for your help and support and we want you to be happy with different perks, benefits, friendly undertakings.


Other Ways To Support and Contribute

It’s not just about funding: you will really help us by spreading the word.

Please like our project on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/NolaLand

Thanks for following us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/NolaLand_tweets

In NolaLand there is a tradition, when you want to thank someone, you say - 

"YOU ROCK!

                YOU HAVE A TRUE NOLALANDIAN HEART!

                                                            YOU DO MAGIC AND SHINE!!"

story:
At it's roots, Chimneyspeak is an adult, action-packed "crimepunk" comic set in Victorian era London. Deeper, the comic is a Great Expectations parody, a Dickensian take on London's criminal underbelly, and satire on the "rags to riches" style of Victorian storytelling. 


Chimneyspeak is an adults only webcomic that can be read here! It updates every Monday and Thursday without delay, starring a host of colourful and diverse characters, a dark and gritty storyline and a slew of extra "penny dreadfuls" that provide backstory, origin tales or just a few more laughs!

 

Hi! My name is Jack Cayless, and I'm the creator of Chimneyspeak. I've had a passion for history ever since my mum bought me a set of Dorling Kindersley (DK) books on ancient Egypt and dinosaurs when I was a toddler, and I've been drawing cartoons since my hand could hold a crayon. About a year ago, Chimneyspeak became popular enough for me to leave my job and work full-time on comics. It's a dream come true!

 

This fundraiser is dedicated to printing the second chapter of the comic. It's a ninety page long paperback comic book, with full colour from front to back. The money raised will go towards the bulk order of 500 books, as well as safe storage and quality shipping products, so your book will be produced of the highest quality and delivered with the highest quality!
 
 
 
As an incentive to contribute now, some of the perks included on the right include fundraiser-only red and blue t-shirts starring fan favourites Chelsea Grinn and Suka Perovskaya, as well as the option do have your book drawn in and signed. The higher tiers involve limited edition original art, where I'll draw your favourite character in copic marker on high-quality Bristol board, just for you!
 
 
The second highest tier involves becoming a part of Chimneyspeak history itself! You - alongside all other Founders that pledge $1000, will appear on the back page in a Victorian-style cartoon "photograph". Dressed in 19th century high-society garb, you could be ending the evening with a warming brandy and cigar, hiding a decorative knife behind your back or simply making sure your top hat is at a sufficiently jaunty angle!
 

The highest tiers involve you recieving your own personal 12 page Chimneyspeak penny dreadful! You and I will work together to create a comic tailor-made specifically for you, featuring your favourite characters and any aspect of the mythos and lore of Chimneyspeak that you'd like to explore. You'll recieve your book and t-shirts first, and then I'll get in touch and we'll get to work! For an extra $900, you'll also appear in the Founder's Club cartoon photograph on the back page of the Chapter two paperback!

(Please Note: Due to the extra work involved in creating a whole new comic for you, as well as the collaboration process we'll have, the penny dreadfuls will take more time to deliver, so you'll get the book and t-shirts first.)


Any extra money made by this fundraiser will be recycled back into the comic itself. Future projects, such as writers and artists for anthologies, third party penny dreadfuls and web designers to make the Chimneyspeak website to be an even more enjoyable place to be. With enough support, Chimneyspeak could deliver a wealth of new content and merchandise for you to enjoy.
 

My comic and it's readers mean the world to me, and it's an absolute joy to bring it to you, a joy I'd like to have for the rest of my life. If you'd like to help spread the word, using social networking sites like Twitter, Facebook and Tumblr would help me a great deal, as would letting your favourite forum know that this fundraiser is happening. Indiegogo has a range of tools that make sharing this fundraiser easy and painless, and any way you can help will go a long way and be very appreciated.

Thank you.

story:
Whattup!

Welcome to...

The crazy-ape, grindhouse-style project swinging through the Indie Comic jungles!

This campaign is for a second printing of the SPECIAL DOUBLE ISSUE (46 pages of story, 52 total!) The art is 100% complete, we're just raising some funds to bring EK#4 to print!

Summary

El Krudo is a hard-living Orangutan raised by the United States Marine Corps who gets dropped into the Vietnam War…

...but gets stuck behind enemy lines.

Issue 4 is the long awaited origin story!

The issues are 100% complete.  We are raising funds to do a second printing of EK4!

What are people saying?

Will you like El Krudo? Take the quiz and find out!

Contributors

Manny Shape: writer/director/producer

Zeroz: artist

German Nobile: artist

Andres Ponce: artist

Bodie Shaw: artist

Rick Joseph: Letterer

Alejandro Gomez: Artist

What We Need & What You Get

We will print as many books as we can with funds generated from this crowdfund campaign.
These are the main content for reward tiers:
1. Digital copies of El Krudo issues #1-4 (for those outside the US that would still like to support our crazy ape indie comic)
2. Physical copies of El Krudo issues #1-4, which will come with some rad accessories!  Including a limited edition print by the amazing Elliot Rodriguez!

 

Risks & Challenges

Printing can always be a challenge.  We have some good partners that we work with directly, but this past year has been especially difficult.  The books will definitely be made since the art is complete and we do not expect any major delays on printing.  Of course, we will update our backers of any unexpected road bumps along the way. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share on social media with anyone you know who may be interested in a crazy-ape war comic featuring a gnarly orangutan :)
story_txt:
Whattup!
Welcome to...

The crazy-ape, grindhouse-style project swinging through the Indie Comic jungles!
This campaign is for a second printing of the SPECIAL DOUBLE ISSUE (46 pages of story, 52 total!) The art is 100% complete, we're just raising some funds to bring EK#4 to print!
Summary
El Krudo is a hard-living Orangutan raised by the United States Marine Corps who gets dropped into the Vietnam War…


...but gets stuck behind enemy lines.

Issue 4 is the long awaited origin story!



The issues are 100% complete.  We are raising funds to do a second printing of EK4!

What are people saying?

Will you like El Krudo? Take the quiz and find out!

Contributors
Manny Shape: writer/director/producer
Zeroz: artist
German Nobile: artist
Andres Ponce: artist
Bodie Shaw: artist
Rick Joseph: Letterer
Alejandro Gomez: Artist
What We Need & What You Get
We will print as many books as we can with funds generated from this crowdfund campaign.These are the main content for reward tiers:1. Digital copies of El Krudo issues #1-4 (for those outside the US that would still like to support our crazy ape indie comic)2. Physical copies of El Krudo issues #1-4, which will come with some rad accessories!  Including a limited edition print by the amazing Elliot Rodriguez!
 
Risks & Challenges
Printing can always be a challenge.  We have some good partners that we work with directly, but this past year has been especially difficult.  The books will definitely be made since the art is complete and we do not expect any major delays on printing.  Of course, we will update our backers of any unexpected road bumps along the way. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Please share on social media with anyone you know who may be interested in a crazy-ape war comic featuring a gnarly orangutan :)

story:
The Story

Wrath tells the story of a young man named Doug who learns he has the ability to manifest the dark emotions of the abusive childhood he thought he left behind. Chapter 2 continues the story as Doug, along with his best friend Nicole, start to piece together the events from Chapter 1. Eventually the pair reveal the dormant power within Doug and must come to grips with this strange new ability, hoping he is  strong enough to control it.

Want to catch up on the story? You can get the digital catch up tier or add the digital version of Chapter 1 to any other tier you select. Both digital and print are available right now from Wikid Publishing. http://www.wikidpublishing.net/wrath

Funding and Tiers

As with our previous campaign we have a variant cover that will only be available during the live campaign. For chapter 2 we brought in the talented Roslynn Sommers to create our variant cover. In addition we also have exclusive artwork from Emilio Utrera that will be available in various teirs as a print, sticker and a t-shirt. This will be your one guaranteed chance to get these items as they will not be added to our merchandise store once the campaign closes.

All tiers will come with a digital copy of the comic. From there you will have choices that include the following.

  • Standard cover featuring the art of Drew Smith
  • Variant cover featuring the art of Roslynn Somers
  • Campaign exclusive 8.5" x 11" print featuring the art of Emilio Utrera
  • Campaign exclusive 3" x 4" sticker featuring the art of Emilio Utrera
  • Campaign exclusive t-shirt featuring the art of Emilio Utrera
  • Cameo on one of the pages of Chapter 2 of you, a loved one or original character

The current state of the project.

As of launch we have funded 10 pages of chapter 2 and plan to add 24 additional pages to complete this chapter. The goal is a bit higher this time, but our artists put a lot of work in to this project and we want to make sure they are getting paid well for their contributions. As with our previous campaign anything left over after fulfillment well go into the production of Chapter 3.

Risks & Challenges

This will be our second run at crowdfunding a comic so we expect to have the same success we had with the previous campaign as far as budgeting and production of the comic. Where we fell short last time was the printing process. We have worked on this with Wikid Publishing and we will be going with a faster more reliable printing service. There will be other campaigns going before us so we do not expect any additional issues.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know things are tight for a lot of people so I understand that funding might not be an option for you. If you really like the project and want to help it succeed then you can help us get the word out. You can share links to this site on your social media or even just tell a friend or two that you think might be interested. You'd be surprised how much these little things can help.

Crowdfunding not your thing? Or maybe you've been burned to many times? You can still support us by picking up Chapter 1 or ordering some of our merchandise from our website www.ragepuppy.com. Our fulfillment partners will process your order and ship it directly to you.

story:
Grand Rising my friends, my name is Mr. Chi and I am a Zen Artist who has been practicing and teaching Art Therapy for the past 10 years. I wanted to share my knowledge and wisdom about the natural healing benefits of the creative process.  So, I built my dream company called Jeanyes Eco Arts N Supplies ( J.E.A.N S) where I transform unwanted jeans into patented primed wrist band canvases. Artists of all ages and skill levels can decorate them, wear them, sell them, trade them, give them away or exchange for donations to help raise money. 

As a company, my primary goal is to inspire the next generation of Artists to practice using their creative outlets everyday. The creative process has magical healing powers that allow the Mind to quiet itself, the Body to relax and the Spirit to awaken. Art Therapy has been proven to help kids suffering from life threatening illnesses such as Cancer, kids on the Spectrum, and those who have Downs Syndrome, ADD/ADHD. Leaning disabilities and anger issues. I have created 3 programs that all use my wrist band canvases to help them practice Art Therapy everyday while earning money, raising money and helping themselves and others in need, 

1) Artrepreneur  - This program teaches students how to use our simple 4 step business plan to start and grow their own Jeanyes small business. 1) Buy our canvases, 2) Decorate them in their unique style, 3) Sell them to supporters 4) Repeat the process

2) Anti Bullying - Art connects us All so this program connects students by transforming them into Jeanyes Creators who must follow a code known RAP.  Respect each others artwork, Accept one another for who they choose to be and Protect one another from bullies. The more Jeanyes Creators in each school, the more connected the students become, the less chances of bullying or being bullied. 

3) Fun-Raising - This program teaches kids how to decorate the bands in the colors and theme that represents the organization that supports them, then exchange their artwork for donations instead of candy popcorn and candles to help raise money. Our program can help schools, sports teams, kid's organizations, hospitals, foster homes, churches and charities. The money raised can be used to purchase school supplies, sports equipment, musical instruments, field trips, missions and hospital bills.  

Due to COVID, I was able to visit schools, hospitals and kid's organizations to promote my brand, sell my products, teach my classes or market my company. So, I decided to write a Story/Coloring/Comic book called The Super Healers. I will transform kids in Super Healers, which are Superheros whose super powers are hidden within their their creative outlets. Every issue will be a positive story about different Super Healers and how the used their healing powers to create positive changes in the world. The 1st issue is the story of Mr. Chi who travels to hospitals and schools teaching kids about the Super Healing powers of the creative process and the natural healing benefits of practicing Art Therapy every day. He was sent to planet Earth to build an Army of young Super Healers who use their powers to help themselves and others win the battle over any illness. On the back of the book is a contest where kids can enter their own story of how their Super Healer character 

I am asking for $10,000 which will allow me to afford the following 1) first printing run of 500 comic books, secure a storefront to rent space where we can collect the jeans, hand craft the wrist bands and hire Artists to decorate the bands and teach classes at this space. For every $20 donation, you will receive 1 copy of the book and 1 will be paid forward to a child in the hospital.  Thank you for your contributions that will help me help kids in need of healing, selling my comic books and launching my dream business, JeanYes.

story:
Hello, I'm Sam Bordon and I'm creating a comic book named "The Paradox War" with my cousin Damon Maes.
Creating a comic book has been our dream for some time now, ever since I was young I collected comic books, I started out reading Spider-Man, and introduced my cousin to comics some time later.
We sat down to describe a plot, and have currently written enough script for five issues, but we don't have the money the create them.
Creating a comic is expensive, 1100 Dollar goes to the artist, Gabriel Roswell. Other money goes to advertisement. 
If we far exceed our goal of 1300 Dollar on the other hand, we could give you so much more quality. We could hire a professional letterer,colourist or artist. 
If we don't raise money for coloured art, we will at least try to make it black/white art.

The comic itself will be avaible to buy digitally and will be written in the English language.
But you are now wondering about the story, right?
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
-


"The White Flash was a turning point in history.
Nobody quite knows what changed, except for our great brotherhood.
We remember a timeline of a different world because time has been altered.
Time has collapsed on itself.
In this strange world five great nations has risen: Italy, Egypt, America, Great Britain and Japan.
These nations are in one constant and horrendous everlasting war. Not realizing just how frail this universe is.
We are Kronos. We protect what remains of time. We protect the very existence of this reality."

The text above is the text of the first page of our first issue.
The story is about a time were all times are meshed together.
It's really a steampunk, cyberpunk tale. You can expect situation like ancient Egypt but with future technology, steampunk London and many more.
A lot of historical characters will also be included in the story.
People such as Tesla, Leonardo Da Vinci, Ramses and more.
All these characters will be moved towards a mysterious object that literally could make or break the universe.

The Perks
The Perks we can give you aren't the best, as we aren't a big company, but they are fun. You could be a character in one of our issues. We'll get your photo and make a comic version of you! Just check it out!

Sources used in video:

http://www.clipartbest.com/stick-figure-human
http://demonic-stickfigures.deviantart.com/art/Brandy-Commission-8-458303932
http://www.mindpollution.org/2008/09/29/interview-sam-brown-on-explodingdog/
http://blog.aicpa.org/2012/11/cpas-broadcast-yourself-with-youtube-.html#sthash.ghGKFRYN.dpbs
http://www.roblox.com/stick-figure-head-with-face-item?id=18920536
http://www.clipartbest.com/picture-dollar-sign
http://doodleslide.com/free-clip-art-images/
http://www.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2014/01/15/did-you-hear-that-scary-explosion-last-night-in-the-outer-sunset
http://img-seo-all2.blogspot.be/2014/02/question-mark-post-2.html
http://commongooduw.org/tag/externships/
http://www.dreamstime.com/stock-image-present-box-cartoon-sketch-vector-illustration-red-bow-image33305641

story:
My name is Fernando and I'm the creator of Aztec of the City.

I have been a comic book fan since I was a young boy. Growing up I realized there weren't any comic book heroes that looked like me, so I decided to create one and that's how Aztec of the City was born.

 

I have independently created 3 different volumes of Aztec of the city and now I need your help to create the 4th. Help me share with new generations that there also can have a hero that looks like them. 

Aztec of the city is a Mexican-American comic book superhero in an industry where minority Latino heroes are few and far between...Aztec of the City and all its superhero characters are a reflection of the Mexican-American minorities that are a fabric of America, who have made and continue making positive contributions to the United States.

DeLilia Images needs funding to print 3,000 copies of issue #4 as we work towards gaining a world-wide audience. 

Thank you and I hope to count with your support.

These are some of the testimonials from fans:

"You'd be hard-pressed to find someone as passionate about storytelling as Fernando Rodriguez. His love of history, mythology, and comic book lore blend together in a way that not only entertains but educates the reader. I've had the good fortune of having enjoyed the Golden, Silver and Bronze Ages of comic books. Now, with Fernando's Aztec of the City, I have the privilege to experience the beginnings of what I like to call, the 'Latino Age of Comics'."
 ~ Lee Villatoro

 "I'm extremely honored and humbled to have been part of the eclectic and arduous journey in getting this new Aztec of the City comic book issue back into the comic book industry. The book, its heroes, and characters have all undergone extreme changes in what is now a college-level reading series dedicated to Mexican-American, Chicano, Latino superheroes in a world where they haven't existed before."

Fernando Rodriguez, writer, artist, publisher

Our perks feature a unique hero, and cultural stories of what we like to call, ''The Mexican Superman.''

Please help us reach our goal by contributing or getting the word out of the unique Mexican-American comic book superheroes, the Aztec of the City, Super Chicano, Super Latina, Aguila de Mexico, El Mestizo and Adelita.

story:
Transhuman - Rivka's Story is written by Stephen Kok (5 Seconds, Terralympus and Word Smith) cover and interior artwork by Allen Sands and coloured by Chris Pitcairn (Fox and Hound and The Hell Courtesan).

The variant cover is done by Von Randal (Dragons, Terralympus and XCT) and coloured by Kevin Anthony De Castro. I loved how this cover turned out! This is Rivka when she was still serving in the army.

Transhuman - Rivka's Story is a perfect bound 60 page (Final page count to be confirmed), fully coloured graphic novel printed on 150gsm glossy interior paper and a 250gsm cardstock cover at standard comic size 260mm x 170mm (10.2" x 6.7"). (For those unfamiliar with gsm, I'm a bit of a paper snob and this is high end paper!) 

 

Transhuman - Rivka's Story details the world on the precipice of a major technologically shift. Suddenly no one isn't limited to the capabilities of the human body and with the right augmentation is able to transcend them. Follow Rivka (she's a transhuman) as she gets caught between two opposing views while having to resolve a dark secret from her past.

 

Rivka is an ex-soldier currently working as a bodyguard for hire. After an accident in the field, she had her right eye, ear and hand replaced with cybernetics. Her augmentations are connected directly via a neural link allowing her to perform superhuman actions.

Rivka still has flashbacks to that fateful event. She lives alone and her home life is a mess. She still carries a deep guilt from her previous life as well as coping with divorce proceedings which she suppresses with a nightly bottle of red. Even with the augmentations to be more than human, she can't escape the realities of her every day problems.

Want more artwork?

 Of course! Here's more completed artwork. 

Still want more?

Sure. Here's a couple more inked pages! It's still going through the colouring process and should be all completed by the end of this campaign. 

Want EVEN more?

OK! There's a 3 page prologue to the graphic novel with artwork by Sebastian Navas and coloured by Kevin Anthony De Castro in production. Here's a sneak peek at the layouts.

 

If you are new to IndieGoGo, welcome. I have listed all the explanation of all the different rewards below. After you know what you want, check out the reward tiers and select the one the appeals to you! In Australia, shipping is FREE (except for the high end tiers)!

PDF Pack

The PDF Pack consists of a digital version of Transhuman - Rivka's Story and the entire three volumes of the 5 Seconds saga in PDF. The 5 Seconds story follows Jake who develops the ability to see 5 seconds into the future. The PDF pack also includes a copy of Killeroo Scars, Belial #1 and XOB #1. That's a lot of comics to read in one single reward.

Printed Copies (2 Covers)

Transhuman - Rivka's Story will consist of 2 covers. The main cover is illustrated by Allen Sands and coloured by Chris Pitcairn with the variant cover illustrated by Von Randal and coloured by Kevin Anthony De Castro. The approximate print run ration of the main cover to the variant will be 1 to 10.  

All copies of the MAIN COVER will come with a limited edition trading card. The artwork done by incredible Elena Ominetti and features Rivka asking if you need a hand. The original artwork for the trading card is also available as a reward!

 

Prints

The A5 Prints Pack consists of 2x A5 (8.3 x 5.8 inches) prints. This is larger than the size of a standard postcard on high quality cardstock. One of the prints is the fully coloured banner by Allen Sands and Chris Pitcairn, the other is an awesome sketch by Malaysian Wallace Cheong.

Original Artwork

I'm a huge fan of original artwork and there's some amazing pieces on offer in this campaign. All the artwork is shown below and are A4 (8.3 x 11.75 inches) in size. The superheroes are inked and coloured by Sebastian Navas who provides some of the interior pages of the artwork. Also on offer is the greyscale card artwork by Elena Ominetti.

It is very important to note that although all care is taken with the artwork, original artwork is never in perfect condition. There might be some slight imperfections depending on how the artist has stored or shipped them etc. It does not detract from the piece and would still be amazing framed.

Artwork on offer :

  • Batgirl (Sebastian Navas)
  • Elektra (Sebastian Navas)
  • Psylocke (Sebastian Navas)
  • Powergirl (Sebastian Navas)
  • Supergirl (Sebastian Navas)
  • Rivka - Trading Card artwork (Elena Ominetti)

How to help?

Firstly thank you for making it this far! I hoped you enjoyed seeing the Transhuman story and the incredible rewards. I have fulfiled multiple campaigns and have kept backers informed through the process. If you can support this project, that would be appreciated. Sharing the link around will be amazing and that would help get as many people as possible checking out this campaign!
story_txt:
Transhuman - Rivka's Story is written by Stephen Kok (5 Seconds, Terralympus and Word Smith) cover and interior artwork by Allen Sands and coloured by Chris Pitcairn (Fox and Hound and The Hell Courtesan).

The variant cover is done by Von Randal (Dragons, Terralympus and XCT) and coloured by Kevin Anthony De Castro. I loved how this cover turned out! This is Rivka when she was still serving in the army.

Transhuman - Rivka's Story is a perfect bound 60 page (Final page count to be confirmed), fully coloured graphic novel printed on 150gsm glossy interior paper and a 250gsm cardstock cover at standard comic size 260mm x 170mm (10.2" x 6.7"). (For those unfamiliar with gsm, I'm a bit of a paper snob and this is high end paper!) 
 

Transhuman - Rivka's Story details the world on the precipice of a major technologically shift. Suddenly no one isn't limited to the capabilities of the human body and with the right augmentation is able to transcend them. Follow Rivka (she's a transhuman) as she gets caught between two opposing views while having to resolve a dark secret from her past.





 

Rivka is an ex-soldier currently working as a bodyguard for hire. After an accident in the field, she had her right eye, ear and hand replaced with cybernetics. Her augmentations are connected directly via a neural link allowing her to perform superhuman actions.


Rivka still has flashbacks to that fateful event. She lives alone and her home life is a mess. She still carries a deep guilt from her previous life as well as coping with divorce proceedings which she suppresses with a nightly bottle of red. Even with the augmentations to be more than human, she can't escape the realities of her every day problems.




Want more artwork?
 Of course! Here's more completed artwork. 



Still want more?
Sure. Here's a couple more inked pages! It's still going through the colouring process and should be all completed by the end of this campaign. 

Want EVEN more?
OK! There's a 3 page prologue to the graphic novel with artwork by Sebastian Navas and coloured by Kevin Anthony De Castro in production. Here's a sneak peek at the layouts.

 

If you are new to IndieGoGo, welcome. I have listed all the explanation of all the different rewards below. After you know what you want, check out the reward tiers and select the one the appeals to you! In Australia, shipping is FREE (except for the high end tiers)!
PDF Pack
The PDF Pack consists of a digital version of Transhuman - Rivka's Story and the entire three volumes of the 5 Seconds saga in PDF. The 5 Seconds story follows Jake who develops the ability to see 5 seconds into the future. The PDF pack also includes a copy of Killeroo Scars, Belial #1 and XOB #1. That's a lot of comics to read in one single reward.


Printed Copies (2 Covers)
Transhuman - Rivka's Story will consist of 2 covers. The main cover is illustrated by Allen Sands and coloured by Chris Pitcairn with the variant cover illustrated by Von Randal and coloured by Kevin Anthony De Castro. The approximate print run ration of the main cover to the variant will be 1 to 10.  

All copies of the MAIN COVER will come with a limited edition trading card. The artwork done by incredible Elena Ominetti and features Rivka asking if you need a hand. The original artwork for the trading card is also available as a reward!

 
Prints
The A5 Prints Pack consists of 2x A5 (8.3 x 5.8 inches) prints. This is larger than the size of a standard postcard on high quality cardstock. One of the prints is the fully coloured banner by Allen Sands and Chris Pitcairn, the other is an awesome sketch by Malaysian Wallace Cheong.

Original Artwork
I'm a huge fan of original artwork and there's some amazing pieces on offer in this campaign. All the artwork is shown below and are A4 (8.3 x 11.75 inches) in size. The superheroes are inked and coloured by Sebastian Navas who provides some of the interior pages of the artwork. Also on offer is the greyscale card artwork by Elena Ominetti.
It is very important to note that although all care is taken with the artwork, original artwork is never in perfect condition. There might be some slight imperfections depending on how the artist has stored or shipped them etc. It does not detract from the piece and would still be amazing framed.
Artwork on offer :

Batgirl (Sebastian Navas)
Elektra (Sebastian Navas)
Psylocke (Sebastian Navas)
Powergirl (Sebastian Navas)
Supergirl (Sebastian Navas)
Rivka - Trading Card artwork (Elena Ominetti)







How to help?
Firstly thank you for making it this far! I hoped you enjoyed seeing the Transhuman story and the incredible rewards. I have fulfiled multiple campaigns and have kept backers informed through the process. If you can support this project, that would be appreciated. Sharing the link around will be amazing and that would help get as many people as possible checking out this campaign!

story:
Pre-order your copy of Stories #1 and see your name in print!

Stories is intended to be a regularly released Australian comic book released bi-monthly.

Stories will be a showcase for great Aussie comic book talent as well as be a stepping stone for Aussie up and comers to get a look in by doing a back up story or a small serial featured in the title.

The format of Stories will be 2 tales per issue, one main story, and one back up story. The artists and writers will rotate ensuring that there is always something new to see, and also that we will always be able to produce a regukar Australian comic book!

Stories will be 32 Black & White  pages plus covers.

Heading up Issue #1 is Curses and Vendettas this supernatural noir  lavishishly drawn by writer/artist Isaac George  is a fast paced and violent tale of  a family with a cursed blood line.

The back up to issue #1 features A Brigand's Tale, which follows the life of an anthropomorphic celebrity gladiator whose life is about to be turned upside down. Co-Writer: Dave Webster, Art and co-writing Dan Tribe.  

We are using the funds from this campaign to cover the costs of printing our First Issue. If we exceed our goal hopefully that is because we need to increase the size of our print run, to which the excess funds will be applied.

Any excess funds will go towards the costs of printing Issue #2, due December 2012.

Stories is intended to be a regularly released Australian comic book released bi-monthly.

Stories will be a showcase for great Aussie comic book talent as well as be a stepping stone for Aussie up and comers to get a look in by doing a back up story or a small serial featured in the title.

Attention Aspiring comic creators, if our campaign is successful you may well see your work in a future issue of Stories!

Please see our list of perks for ways you can assist financially. Even a dollar will get you in print as a a supporter!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign with your social network on Facebook, Twitter LinkedIn etc.

Add comments in our comments section, this way we may get featured on Indie GoGo's front page = big exposure!

Take a sneak peek at some of the artwork on the gallery tab.

story:
Previous Campaign Details:

Just posted some character bios on the Chicken Outfit site. You can read more about Headcast, Zigmund Danzig, Stan Munson, and Rusty McDoodle. More to come. Check 'em out here: http://chickenoutfit.com/category/characters

We were recently interview by Inkd, the creators of a new webcomic reader app. We partnered with Inkd to help them launch their app. They call Chicken Outfit, "...certainly one of the more unique and hilarious storyline's we've come across in Webcomics overall." Check out the interview here: http://inkd.me/blog/2013/1/23/author-feature-joe-deagnon-creator-of-chicken-outfit.html

25 days left for ChickenOutfit Issue #1! Help us get us to $1000 by Jan 28 & all our IndieGoGo’ers who contribute at the $10 and up perk levels get a FREE unpublished digital PDF 18 pager from the Paranoid Tales archive!

Due to a massive hard-drive failure a day ago, I managed to lose two finished inked panels & the “Suspiria” postcard file. Luckily we had already sent the postcards to the printer and we now have them in hand! It’s now a limited edition card! Yay! I mean… ugh.

The postcards are being printed - we ended up going with a larger size than a normal postcard. They will be 216mm x 139mm (which is about 5.5 inches x  8.5 inches) which means they are more like mini-posters than postcards!

 

Here is another full colour page from the comic. Enjoy!

 

Just finished the last design for the six postcards included in the Chicken Strips perk level. Four of the postcards are parodies of some of my favourite films and some of the influences behind Chicken Outfit. Videodrome, Maniac, Suspiria and Dawn of the Dead. The last two postcards are the cover of the first issue and the alt. cover. You can see all the postcards below.

 

A big thank you to everyone who has contributed so far.  I am really looking forward to having you all read the comic.  Please make sure you use the sharing tools to let your friends know about Chicken Outfit and help us reach our funding goal!

I have just finished inking page 19 of the comic and have finished colouring the first 10 pages. We are on target for a March completion.

 

Chicken Outfit - The Hellish First Issue

Rusty McDoodle isn't having the best week. His web clients aren’t paying, his girlfriend left him and his social skills have deteriorated from freelancing in a vacuum. His best friend Stan works in online porn, toiling away in a virtual sweat-shop lorded over by a maniacal boss and his dog-like cronies. When Stan witnesses his life's work go up in flames late one night, he asks Rusty to join the company and help him uncover the truth behind his Kafkaesque employer.

These two web-lackeys soon discover a series of events have been set in motion so bizarre, that their world becomes engulfed by epic chaos. With the help of an alcoholic psychic and his fishing buddy, they're roped into a nightmarish struggle with bloodthirsty demons and money-mongering yes-men. Can they keep their jobs and their sanity intact when they can't trust anyone and there is an axe lurking behind every back?

Chicken Outfit is a sci-fi / horror comic for future-shocked times. It chronicles corporate greed, maniacal butchers, undead biker-chicks, drunken psychic shaman, pretentious aliens and a couple of under-paid slobs who find themselves in the most hellish situation of their lives.

WARNING! ADULTS ONLY (18+)

Although there is no explicit sex in this comic, there are scenes of violence so ridiculous, we need to state that this comic is unequivocally for ADULTS ONLY (18+)

People who have been tested with an advanced reading of Chicken Outfit have been known to faint, projectile vomit and bleed from various orifices we'd rather not mention here.

If you experience any of these symptoms while reading Chicken Outfit, please repeat to yourself, IT'S ONLY A COMIC... IT'S ONLY A COMIC... IT'S ONLY A COMIC...

 

 

Why we are raising funds:

We are raising money to print the comic in brain-melting full colour and get it into the hands of anyone who loves comics, sci-fi and horror, and wants to read something fresh, original and inventive.

Some of the money will go to pay for the postcards, t-shirts and other rewards made available exclusively to indiegogo contributors.

This is the first issue in what will be an ongoing series and you can get in on the ground floor and help ensure the success of what is certain to be a cult smash.

Once printed, the comic (and all the swag) will be sent to our Indiegogo supporters first, before anyone else can get their meat hooks all over it.

 

Contributions Perks

Chicken Balls: $10 (Shipping Included!)

You get the first issue of Chicken Outfit (32 pages printed in brain-melting full colour). Shipping to anywhere in Canada and the US is included. ($15 Outside CAN & US)

 

Chicken Strips: $17 (Shipping Included!)

You get the first issue of Chicken Outfit (32 pages printed in brain-melting full colour) PLUS a set of six Chicken Outfit postcards, AND six stickers. Shipping to anywhere in Canada and the US is included. ($22 Outside CAN & US)

 

Bucket O' Chicken: $55 (Shipping Included!)

You get everything in the Hellish First Issue Pack PLUS you get a Limited Edition T-Shirt (in M,L or XL) that is only available to Indiegogo supporters. Shipping to anywhere in Canada and the US is included! ($65 Outside CAN & US)

 


 

Picnic Pack O' Chicken: $110 (Shipping Included!)

You get everything in the Hellish First Issue Pack PLUS the t-shirt PLUS you get an original, one-of-a-kind character sketch on real paper and signed by the artist. Shipping to anywhere in Canada and the US is included. ($120 Outside CAN & US)

 

 

Party Barrel O' Chicken: $175 (Shipping Included!)

You get everything in the Hellish First Issue Pack PLUS the t-shirt, an original, one-of-a-kind character sketch AND TO TOP IT ALL OFF, you'll also receive a signed copy of the author's working script including storyboards, scribblings and author/creator notes!! Shipping to anywhere in Canada and the US is included. ($185 Outside CAN & US)

 

About the creators:

Artist and Co-Writer: Joe Deagnon

Joe Deagnon (Artist & Co-Writer) has previously published five issues of Paranoid Tales of Neurosis. Called “Lowbrow and Entertaining”, “”Hyper-Fun and Sickly Twisted” and “Bizarre and Wonderful”, his work has been described as a combination of Harvey Pekar meets Ralph Steadman and dubbed “A Mad Magazine for the 90s” by drive-in movie critic Joe Bob Briggs. Herschell Gordon Lewis commented on his humor as “Sick and vicious, just like mine.” He also was a regular contributor to the music weekly Exclaim and Film Threatmagazine. Working in the media industry for almost 20 years now, he’s getting sick and tired of dealing with the insanity of this earth-bound reality and has made great leaps in science and logic by phase-shifting between this world and an imaginary dimension of his own design.

Co-Writer: Kirby Stasyna

A self-proclaimed success story in the tradition of Tom Vu, Kirby Stasyna (Co-Writer) is not living the luxurious life he is seen enjoying on TV. Relying only on street smarts and empty beer bottles, much of Kirby’s time that should be spent working on Chicken Outfit projects is wasted looking for jobs, feeding birds, volunteering at museums, and playing around with vintage gizmos and obsolete electronics. A proven creative and conceptual specialist, Kirby has yet to create or conceive personal success, financial freedom, or anything of any worth or value that isn’t owned by some other company. Kirby’s artistic sense has been so toned down by ex-employers, that he can only see in 2-bit color without the use of special glasses. He also has the distinction of being co-creator of the Naked News.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute you can still help us out by spreading the word and telling people about this campaign.

Just use the sharing Indiegogo sharing tools !

story:
I'm Nathyn Brendan Masters and this is my campagin for my 56 page action horror mystery comic Hexcraft Mechanics, a spinoff from the Epitaph Bread and Salt movie and comics. This is part one of my three part urban fantasy series set in Chicago, revolving around secret societies, magic cults, demonic infestations and the demon hunters and heroes trying to keep this all in check. 

Nathyn Brendan Masters Presents:

The Talbane family is thrown into turmoil after their daughter's private jet explodes on take off. Occultist and telepath Ashen Yu uses this time of grief as a perfect opportunity to seek membership in The Rise of Magic. Demon hunter Victor Locke takes down a Neo Nephilim gang and is warned about an Adze vampire seeking revenge for the death of her lover. 

As Damious is taken deeper into the Sisterhood of Lilith's incredible library of tomes, an ex Sisterhood breeder named Rahaab seeks to escape their clutches. While all this is happening Dracula and Lady Bathory declare war on Chicago's supernatural community for their role in the decimation of the city's last, major Vampire Alliance.

 

Neo Nephilm are just as dangerous as Vampires and other deadly demonic creatures and may travel in packs or with other supernatural beings. 

 

Supernatural creatures attacking Chicago citizens... 

 

Cassie (Zombie Girl) standing at her grave site... 

 

Ashen using her ample "talents" to gain membership into the Rise of Magic.

 

Nowhere is safe and you know that now. 

 

Zombie Girl Reveal Print...

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Comicsgate Comics art back!

story: This is one of many projects I'm working hasrd to launch this year or next, at the latest. I created the story and a very talented manga artist is in the middle of producing this quirky graphic novel about Boy meets Girl, and I'm excited to see it go through production, but I do need help with the first run! I'll have enough promotional material to showcase the in-progress work at Ryu-kon this year, but hope to launch the actual graphic novel in time for Christmas! If there are any postponents in production or lack of funds, I will plan on debuting at a comic conventions asap next year! It is a great story, part teen movie and part shoujo manga. Let's get it made so everyone can enjoy it!

story:
Our Story & Impact

In 1837, Hans Christian Andersen wrote "The Little Mermaid," and almost two hundred years later, it is still ingrained in our social consciousness.

"The Undine Prince" is the first of seven stories in my Prince project, a personal art experiment I've been cooking up these past two years.  Prince is a series of fairy tales we know and love - with a twist.  Every character has been switched to the opposite gender.  But gender is more than changing plumbing below the belt.  Gender is also one's roles in society. 

Society, especially Disney, has already defined expectations for gender in these stories.  I know I am not perfect and certainly not historically accurate, but by swapping the sexes of the characters, I hope to whittle these stories down to universal cores.  Whether you read the original or the gender-swapped, the same theme should hold.

At its heart, "The Undine Prince" is a story about wanting to find a place to belong, something anyone can relate to.

DeviantART: http://fongmingyun.deviantart.com
Tumblr: http://gfong.tumblr.com
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/gphong

What We Need & What You Get

"The Undine Prince" will be a short story with seven, highly detailed, grayscale illustrations (three of which have never been posted online!).  Like all stories, I want to bring my typed words to paper.  It will be printed as a 8.25"x10.75" comic with a cardstock cover.

Your support helps cover the printing and shipping costs for this issue. I am limiting the run to 70 regular issues, and 7 special issues.  Special issues have "sketch covers" made of bristol board.  Each one will be totally unique - hand-drawn by me, with color markers.  There will be no re-prints after this run!

Just for kicks, if you order a printed issue, you will get two free 8"x10" prints!  You may pick from this gallery: http://fongmingyun.deviantart.com/gallery/24838150

All leftover funds will go towards printing the second issue, Ethan Redd (Little Red Riding Hood), which is also currently in progress.  If I magically gets super popular, the cash will go toward a hardcover, full-color, re-print of all seven Prince stories.

For those of you that helped me on my other project, the Boiled Fish Art Book, IndieGoGo has some differences in payment system than Kickstarter:

First, you can use Paypal as well as Credit/Debit card.  Neat, huh? (The whole reason I went for IGG instead).

Second, these are not pledges.  They are pre-orders.  You will be charged immediately - and you will get your perk no matter what - whether the project funding is "completed" or not!  (If I don't get enough on here, I will crank out some commissions for the extra cash.)

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, please, please advertise!  Each time you do one of the following, you will receive a raffle ticket for one of three free sketch commissions from me (you can request anything!):

E-mail me (fongmingyunATgmailDOTcom) a blog post, LiveJournal entry, or DeviantART journal where you've posted this project.

Tweeted about this project with the tag #princeproj01.

Re-blog about this project on your Tumblr with the tag #princeproj01.

Did something else? E-mail me (fongmingyunATgmailDOTcom)!

(...etc!)
story_txt:
Our Story & Impact
In 1837, Hans Christian Andersen wrote "The Little Mermaid," and almost two hundred years later, it is still ingrained in our social consciousness."The Undine Prince" is the first of seven stories in my Prince project, a personal art experiment I've been cooking up these past two years.  Prince is a series of fairy tales we know and love - with a twist.  Every character has been switched to the opposite gender.  But gender is more than changing plumbing below the belt.  Gender is also one's roles in society.  Society, especially Disney, has already defined expectations for gender in these stories.  I know I am not perfect and certainly not historically accurate, but by swapping the sexes of the characters, I hope to whittle these stories down to universal cores.  Whether you read the original or the gender-swapped, the same theme should hold.At its heart, "The Undine Prince" is a story about wanting to find a place to belong, something anyone can relate to.DeviantART: http://fongmingyun.deviantart.comTumblr: http://gfong.tumblr.comTwitter: http://www.twitter.com/gphongWhat We Need & What You Get"The Undine Prince" will be a short story with seven, highly detailed, 
grayscale illustrations (three of which have never been posted 
online!).  Like all stories, I want to bring my typed words to paper.  It will be printed as a 8.25"x10.75" comic with a cardstock cover.Your support helps cover the printing and shipping costs for this issue. I am limiting the run to 70 regular issues, and 7 special issues.  Special issues have "sketch covers" made of bristol board.  Each one will be totally unique - hand-drawn by me, with color markers.  There will be no re-prints after this run!Just for kicks, if you order a printed issue, you will get two free 8"x10" prints!  You may pick from this gallery: http://fongmingyun.deviantart.com/gallery/24838150All leftover funds will go towards printing the second issue, Ethan Redd (Little Red Riding Hood), which is also currently in progress.  If I magically gets super popular, the cash will go toward a hardcover, full-color, re-print of all seven Prince stories.For those of you that helped me on my other project, the Boiled Fish Art Book, IndieGoGo has some differences in payment system than Kickstarter:First, you can use Paypal as well as Credit/Debit card.  Neat, huh? (The whole reason I went for IGG instead).Second, these are not pledges.  They are pre-orders.  You will be charged immediately - and you will get your perk no matter what - whether the project funding is "completed" or not!  (If I don't get enough on here, I will crank out some commissions for the extra cash.)
Other Ways You Can HelpPlease, please, please advertise!  Each time you do one of the following, you will receive a raffle ticket for one of three free sketch commissions from me (you can request anything!):
E-mail me (fongmingyunATgmailDOTcom) a blog post, LiveJournal entry, or DeviantART journal where you've posted this project.Tweeted about this project with the tag #princeproj01.Re-blog about this project on your Tumblr with the tag #princeproj01.Did something else? E-mail me (fongmingyunATgmailDOTcom)!(...etc!)

story:
For the first time in hundreds of years, Finn's legend is retold. Forged anew from the breath of the storyteller, but this time it's different... This time the fireside is the modern world. This time, it's in the form of a Graphic Novel. Now you have the chance to become part of that heroic quest, the journey of immortality, by remembering - The Nobility of our Irish Heroes.

This campaign is a celebration of Saint Patrick's Day and of the final funding needed to produce the first book in the Finn McCool graphic novel series. In 2013 we raised a fantastic $12,501 from Irish Celtic fans the world over, with donations from eight different countries and from $5 to a staggering $5000. This is the passion that people have seen in our vision to bring the greatest warrior, ancient Ireland ever knew onto the world platform of heroes. Now YOU have the chance to make a stand as they have, by helping us create the magic of the ancient, Irish celtic world. But firstly, for those of you who may not know who, Finn McCool was, here's an introduction.


Finn was the legendary protector of ancient Ireland and Chief of The Fianna, the elite bodyguard to the High Kings of old Ireland. Finn, and The Fianna's, heroic adventures and deeds are well known within the Irish community, if you reference, Finn McCool, you will see, not only the vast amount of links to his mythology, but also the many pubs, restaurants, organizations and clubs that celebrate his noble name by using it as a brand. However, what you will not see, is the Graphic Novel of the hero or the movie, that, my friends, is about to change. 

The time has come to honour the ancient Irish heroes and in the highest way possible, by putting their fine names in the hearts of true clansmen, and women, the world over. Part of our vision for the novels is for young men and women to read the stories, as well as adults, to learn more about their heritage, rites of passage and initiations into adulthood, something we feel is sadly lacking in today's world. 

The stories of Finn McCool do just that, they teach. This is part of the drive behind the graphic novel series, also to showcase the real heroes of our past, rather than the constant "Superman v Batman" overkill. This is an original project, a one off, you can be part of this fantastic journey.

We are producing of the Hardcover Original Graphic Novel, featuring the retelling of Finn’s origin. In order to hire the best writers, pencillers, inkers, colourists and letterers in the business to bring this vision to life, we need your support. Our plan is to raise the money to be able to hire top-notch creative talent from the comic and graphic novel field and to partner with an American Comic Book publisher, Archaia, in order to distribute the graphic novel to comic and bookstores across the world. 

Below we see Finn's first encounter with the magical druid, Finegas.

Below is the magical druid Finegas, another wise mentor of Finn's. He teaches Finn the value of the earth and the magic that she holds. In the Finn stories it's Finegas who catches the fames, "Salomon of knowledge."


You've seen the Movies 'Braveheart', 'Rob Roy', 'Highlander' and recently, the Pixar animation, 'Brave'.  All great and have one thing in common; they're Scottish. The magic, power and beauty that is Irish Story and Myth has seemingly been overlooked by Hollywood and the world, but not any longer - Irish legends and its Heroes deserve a place in our hearts with the graphic novel and up on the Big Screen.

Below we see the Boy Finn's first day of warrior initiation with his wild mentor, Fiacuil.

This ground breaking project will lead the way in the reemergence of the Irish Celtic Warrior Heroes. It will become part of your story, your history, not only for you, but for your ancestors. By honouring them, you honour the past, by honouring the past, you become the hero ...

Below is Saba, High Priestess of the underworld and Finn's true love. Saba first comes to Finn in the form of a white deer, cursed so by the dark lord of the underworld. Finn lifts the curse and we see here, Saba transformed back into the beautiful woman she is, but make no mistake, Saba is as powerful as any of the male characters you'll find in the myths.

This ground breaking project will lead the way in the reemergence of the Irish Celtic Warrior Heroes. It will become part of your story, your history, not only for you, but for your ancestors. By honouring them, you honour the past, by honouring the past, you become the hero.

Below we see the moment Finn is forced to face death, in more ways than one ...

Below, meet Fiacuil, Finn's mentor. It's Fiacuil who trains Finn in the art of warrior-ship and becomes a trusted ally to Finn when times get really rough, a true friend indeed.

Meet the dreaded Goll, son of Clan Morna the man who murders Finn's father, Ool, a conflict indeed! Their bitter rivalry is ongoing, even in battle against their foes.

      "When you are dust, how will you be remembered?"

By supporting this project you will literally create for yourself, and kin, a lasting legacy that you can feel deeply proud of. Part of what the Finn McCool stories stand for, is the mentoring and initiation of our youth. Providing young people with safe, integral and beautiful settings for them to explore their own personal power, while being mentored onto the pathway of adulthood by trustworthy mentor figures. The producer of the Finn McCool Project, supports the Irish Youth Foundation charity. The mission of IYF is to provide opportunities for children and young people facing adverse and extreme conditions to experience success in their lives. A percentage of profits made from the graphic novel of Finn McCool, will be donated to this inspiring charity based in Dublin, Ireland.

Below are several images from Courtney Davis' art pack for this campaign. They are copies of original art from the Finn McCool story. We are offering signed copies of these as an added perk for your pledges. Please view listings on the right hand side of the campaign for more details.

      


Totally one off and unique ... Should you choose to donate to a perk that comes with a certificate of authenticity. However, we cannot guarantee the postal system, so we are offering you a downloadable certificate, with your, or the name of the person you are gifting, printed and embossed into the certificate. This will come from our dedicated website, you can then mount or frame the certificate for yourself or a receiver, after all, a part of Irish history is an incredible gift for anyone ...

The first wave of funding gets us out into the world with this incredible story, on the Graphic Novel platform. A completed Screenplay for the first film is here, part two is well underway. "A classic in the action adventure genre, and deserves serious studio consideration." But here's the thing, we don't want to just give it away to the big studios, we want to produce as much of the project as possible with the help of public funding. By doing so, we retain as much of the story's authenticity as we can. From the Graphic Novel, to the big screen. You are invited on that wild journey of creation, we want you to be a part of one of the finest stories to have ever come out of Ireland.

     

The images that you are seeing are from the talents of John Walters, known for his Stunning VFX on the latest Spartacus series for the US STARZ channel and Courtney Davis, the world's leading Celtic illustrator. Their artwork will become the imagery for the Graphic Novel. John's with the graphic page layout and Courtney's with his incredible Irish knot-work which brings in the magic of the Celtic world. Each page will carry with it Finn McCool's legend. From his true love Saba, cursed into the form of a white deer and freed by Finn from her entrapment, to Saint Patrick, in dialogue with Oisin, Finn's son, or the wild druid, Finegas and the many more characters that I'm sure you will love, and if its "World of Role Play" you're into, we have some fantastic new characters for you to dream alive.

What lifts Finn McCool's stories above the crowd? In truth, reality. Scattered across Ireland are dozens of sacred sites that pre-date the coming of christianity and unlike the make believe world of Tolkien's, "The Hobbit" and "The Lord of The Rings" who dwell on "Middle Earth" (a place that does not exist), the sites across Ireland do.  Many of them include the stories of Finn McCool and the elite bodyguard, the Fianna, protectors of the High Kings of ancient Ireland.

      

All of the funds will go towards the graphic novel's production, the artwork, writing, lettering, colouring, printing, marketing and distribution. Anything you can offer will help. In return we will offer our deepest gratitude in all kinds of unique perks. Please see the perk bar for details. *Please note: Travel and accommodation expenses are not included and postage outside of the USA must be added if you are claiming a perk that requires postage.

What's in a name? There's a very interesting fact about the hero, did you know that there's at least seven different spellings of his name? This has come about over thousands of years, the stories became legends, the legends became myths. Here's the names we know of: Finn McCool ... Fionn Mac Cum Hail ... Finn McCuail ... Fionn McCumhail ... Fyn Mc Cuail ... Fionn McCual ... Finn McCuail. Some say that his name is spelt "Fionn" but that would make it the modern spelling, others say "Finn" the old way. So, what we decided to do was to offer the hero's name so that EVERYBODY can read and pronounce it, an inclusive spelling, hence ... "Finn McCool". Now, for all of the die-hard Gaelic fan's of the hero, we will also be producing a limited edition version, with all of the names, and there are many, spelt in the ancient Irish Gaelic. If that's the copy you'd like, then please just email and let us know. You can do so via this page when you preorder your copy of the graphic novel. 

What happens if we don't reach our total goal? We will continue the project come what may by STARTING, we can still hire the artists and even begin by creating a soft copy of the stories. We want to invite you to become involved, you are our community, our tribe, we believe that you should have the chance to be a part of this exciting reemergence of the Wild Celt. We'll achieve this through the stories of Finn McCool, and the Fianna.  Finn would have wanted it that way. Real People. Real Project. Real Heart.

                                  An old Irish saying goes:

So, com'on, let's you and I dream the Heroes alive, let's breathe anew the old, give fire to the wind, and call the gods to task. Our time is Now, we honour our past by becoming the hero, by becoming the Hero, we live the myths...

For more info on this project please visit these related websites:

http://www.Finn-McCool.com

https://www.facebook.com/FinnMcCoolTheMovie

www.artofjohnwalters.com

http://www.courtneydavisart.com

http://www.iyf.ie

Chris Brosnan is the Writer/Producer of the Finn McCool project. Born in the UK where he lived for 40 years, he now lives in Vancouver, Canada with his wife, Karen  and their 4 year old son Fionn.

Chris' background is in Film and T.V. production in the UK, as well as writing and performing for the music and stage industry, not only in the UK, but around the world. This has been his passion for over 25 years. Below is a shot of Chris with his son, Fionn, named after the legendary Irish hero Finn McCool ...

Chris' writing credits include: "Fugitive Fathers", "Wimps To Warriors", "The Shadow Catcher", "Healers", "Gospel According to Elvis", "The Redemption of Man" and "Finn McCool - The Forging of the Fianna." Graphic novel and the feature film screenplay of the same.

"I was first introduced to the legends of Finn McCool from my Grandmother and later from traditional storytellers. His legend has fascinated, not only me, but the people of Ireland and scholars alike the world over for centuries." 

Chris started his film career working alongside the likes of Clint Eastwood, Ron Howard, Kevin Costner and Morgan Freeman, in big budget feature films, learning from the best in movies such as: "Willow", "Robin Hood - Prince of Thieves", "White Hunter- Black Heart", "Batman", and many, many more.

Although Chris started his career as an actor, he found that he preferred the other side of the camera. He became a writer/producer for stage in the early nineties and has also worked on productions for the BBC as well as many Independents.

The natural progression into producing is something Chris is very focussed on, and his passion and energy is on breathing life into this exiting new project.

Chris brings a wealth of experience in the industry, and an extensive book of contacts to the Finn McCool project.

If you are unable to donate, then you can still help us by spreading the word of our campaign to those around you, via Facebook, Twitter, Youtube, emails to friends, contacts and importantly by using the Indiegogo share button at the very top of this page ... YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE and remember that there's a blessings of magic and luck with every Irish story, so claim yours by supporting the heroes of old.

We will be updating the page as the campaign moves forward with new artwork and news, so keep in touch, send us your blessings, as we do to you ...

May you be blessed in all ways, always and may the luck of the Irish be with you.

story:
Recently, I've lost over 100 lbs (before and after pictures are on my website at http://pssistermovement.com) and as a result opportunities are opening up for me to perform, audition, and network in Southern California. Unfortunately, funds are tight and I need sponsors who believe in my message to help with traveling expenses which will include gas, healthy snacks, and cheap hotel/motel stays. As a new artist, paid gigs are few and far between. If and when we are actually paid, it's usually in food and drinks and then a little bit of cash. The other money-making barrier is my gender. As a female comedian, I am continually paid less than my male counterparts for the same type of work. My first road trip to Southern California is scheduled in March and my second road trip is planned for April. During both of these trips I will be performing, auditioning, and networking. Unfortunately, none of these opportunities are paid, but they are door openers that can advance my career and lead to regular paid bookings. At this point, exposure is key! It's all about being at the right place at the right time being seen by the right people. Pursuing a career in entertainment is most certainly a faith walk! I'm working really hard and I'm fighting for it; I just need a little bit of help along the way. Thank you for your continued support. Any donation amount will be an appreciated blessing!

Two Trips Are Scheduled: March 14th -19th April 25th-April 30th Here are just some of the opportunities on the itinerary:

  • WEDNESDAY, MARCH 14TH @ 7:30 PM FLAPPERS COMEDY CLUB CALIFORNIA’S FUNNIEST FEMALE CONTEST 102 EAST MAGNOLIA BURBANK, CALIFORNIA $10 THURSDAY,
  • MARCH 15TH @ 6 PM FLAPPERS COMEDY CLUB AUDITION FOR BOOKING AGENCY 102 EAST MAGNOLIA BURBANK, CALIFORNIA $10 FRIDAY,
  • MARCH 16TH RADIO INTERVIEW WITH DESEAN BIZZLE ON LA TALK LIVE
  • MARCH 16TH @ 9 PM THE SOUL STATION COMEDY FRIDAYS 19524 NORDHOFF STREET NORTHRIDGE, CALIFORNIA $10 THURSDAY THRU SUNDAY
  • WE ARE COMING HOME SATURDAY MORNING!

 

APRIL LA TRIP ITINERARY:

 

  • APRIL 1ST @ 9PM FLAPPERS COMEDY CLUB, FLAPPERS FUNNIES COMEDY SHOW 102 EAST MAGNOLIA, BURBANK, CALIFORNIA $10
  • TUESDAY, APRIL 3RD @ 3 PM LA TALK LIVE INTERVIEW ON THE MICHAEL COLYAR RADIO SHOW Queenie TTwill be a featured guest comedian and my time slot is scheduled for 4:30 PM. http://latalklive.com/new/michael-colyar
  • APRIL 25TH-29TH THE ANNUAL ‘FEMALES IN COMEDY CONVENTION’ HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS & SUITES-LAX HAWTHORNE 11436 HAWTHORNE BLVD HAWTHORNE, CALIFORNIA http:// femalesincomedyconvention.hopeflood2.com/index.html * THIS INCLUDES SHOWCASING AT MAJOR CLUBS IN LA AND IN FRONT OF INDUSTRY EXECUTIVES
  • WEDNESDAY, APRIL 25TH@ 7:30 PM FLAPPERS COMEDY CLUB CALIFORNIA’S FUNNIEST FEMALE CONTEST 102 EAST MAGNOLIA BURBANK, CALIFORNIA $10 --THE QUARTER FINALS!
  • SATURDAY, APRIL 28TH @ 10 PM THE J SPOT ALL-FEMALE COMEDY SHOW 5581 W. MANCHESTER LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA $10

 

* More updates on specific showcase locations soon to follow.

 

IF 500 OF MY FRIENDS, FAMILY, AND FANS DONATE $3 DOLLARS EACH, I'LL REACH MY GOAL BEFORE DEADLINE!

 

Thank you!

 

With Love & Appreciation,

 

Queenie TT
story_txt:
Recently, I've lost over 100 lbs (before and after pictures are on my website at http://pssistermovement.com) and as a result opportunities are opening up for me to perform, audition, and network in Southern California. Unfortunately, funds are tight and I need sponsors who believe in my message to help with traveling expenses which will include gas, healthy snacks, and cheap hotel/motel stays. As a new artist, paid gigs are few and far between. If and when we are actually paid, it's usually in food and drinks and then a little bit of cash. The other money-making barrier is my gender. As a female comedian, I am continually paid less than my male counterparts for the same type of work. My first road trip to Southern California is scheduled in March and my second road trip is planned for April. During both of these trips I will be performing, auditioning, and networking. Unfortunately, none of these opportunities are paid, but they are door openers that can advance my career and lead to regular paid bookings. At this point, exposure is key! It's all about being at the right place at the right time being seen by the right people. Pursuing a career in entertainment is most certainly a faith walk! I'm working really hard and I'm fighting for it; I just need a little bit of help along the way. Thank you for your continued support. Any donation amount will be an appreciated blessing!
