story:
WHO IS VERY GARY

Very Gary is an esteemed longtime independent comic book retailer, always on the hunt for collections to buy and then pick for key issues to sell at conventions and via his strong followings online. He's parlayed those experiences and expertise into one of the most informative and followed presences on YouTube for comic book collecting and speculation.

INVINCIBLE RED SONJA #2

After interviewing writers Amanda Conner and Jimmy Palmiotti about their hotly anticipated new series Invincible Red Sonja, everyone was so excited to work together and took it to the next level! Artist Chris Campana joins along in drawing a breathtaking portrayal of the She-Devil With a Sword. The exclusive variant will be printed on the scintillating second issue of the blockbuster series.  Enter...the Very Gary Invincible Red Sonja #2 Variant Cover!

 

EVERY ORDER GETS A FREE COPY OF INVINCIBLE RED SONJA #1!

If you know Gary - you  know he is all about reading great stories! To make sure all of his incredible supporters get the full story to date, we're including a free copy of Invincible Red Sonja #1 featuring the stunning Amanda Conner cover with every order of the Very Gary Invincible Red Sonja #2 Variant!  

 

CGC COPIES

Slabbed and graded at 9.8 or higher!

CGC SIGNED COPIES

Signed by Chris Campana and slabbed and graded at 9.6 or higher!

VIRGIN COVER w/ A REMARQUED SKETCH

Cover artist, Chris Campana is doing unique Red Sonja sketches on select virgin covers of the book. (Note: each sketch is different and your art may vary from the example)

INVINCIBLE RED SONJA #1 RARE VIRGIN COVERS

Start your collection at the beginning with these virgin covers from the FIRST issue on the series! There "virgin" editions are printed in very low numbers and we're only able to guarantee that 10 will be available of each.

RED SONJA LIMITED EDITION TRADING CARDS

Each foil pack of trading cards includes 2 unique sketch cards, 1 signed card, 2 base cards, 1 puzzle card, and 1 line art card! Every foil pack is packed inside an exclusive mini box.

 

CUSTOM PAINTED U.S. HALF-DOLLAR COIN

A real, uncirculated U.S. half-dollar coin collectible with Red Sonja artwork on one side from either Lucio Parrillo or J. Scott Campbell. All coins include a protective acrylic case and a certificate of authenticity.

RED SONJA AMANDA CONNER "BRONZE" STATUE

ONLY AVAILABLE IN THE "TREASURE CHEST" PERK!

This limited edition, resin statue is based on the cover artwork of Amanda Conner and comes hand-painted in a "bronze" color finish.

story:
Who are we?

Hi, I’m Mike Kwolek, owner and manager of Four Color Fantasies, Winchester, Virginia’s local comic shop. I started the store in January, 1987, straight out of college, and, despite having no business background or courses, I have managed to make a go of it for over 25 years. Twenty three years ago, my wife and I started buying the property on which the store – and our house – currently stands, and we are happily chugging along towards paying off the mortgage.

Despite being a small location, under 1,000 square feet, we have done our best to build an old school, classic comic book store, with hundreds of new releases every month as well as one of the largest and most organized selections of back issues in the Shenandoah Valley. We have over 47,000 unique back issues ranging from the 1940s to present, and are always looking to expand our selection for our customers.

Our customer base includes over 200 subscribers, ninety five percent of whom we know on a first name basis, and we strive for a very friendly, community-oriented atmosphere. Many of our customers comment on how personalized our service is, and many come in just to hang out and talk comics. We do not sell on the Internet or do mail order on a regular basis – we are strictly there for our local community. The only mail order we do is for customers who have moved out of the area and who wish to continue doing business with us.

For our customers who aren’t as into comics, but instead are more interested in (or as interested in) the gaming that is so often coupled with comics, we also have a small section of RPG products, as well as over 30,000 Magic: The Gathering singles ranging from Unlimited through to Gatecrash.

What do we need?

Our store is the only occupant in a single story, wooden frame building that was built in the 1930’s. Its electric blue exterior paint has become a local landmark, but is wearing badly – cracking and peeling, at this point. A few years ago, this would have been no problem. I could have gathered up customers for a painting party and redone the exterior, but that is no longer the case. Due to changes in state and local laws, any commercial building built before the 1970’s must have special precautions taken when scraping the exterior, due to the possibility of lead based paints having been used.

What it boils down to is that the entire building would need to be tented over, and qualified workers in full Haz-mat suits must do all of the scraping and preparation work before new paint can be applied. This means that a simple paint job will now cost over $20,000 on the low end. I have looked into alternatives, such as changing the type of siding on the building, but these alternatives tend to be in the same price range or higher. Also, any siding change means that we would have to lose our distinctive appearance, which the city only allows because we have had it for so long and been grandfathered in as local zoning regulations have changed. 

I’ve been aware of this situation for the past year or so, since I started looking into getting the store repainted. That’s when I started attempting to save, but I’ve been unsuccessful so far. One of the obstacles I’ve run into is a large tax liability because, for a small business, every dollar that we spend on inventory counts as a dollar of profit. Thus, when I invest $10,000 towards expanding our merchandise for our customers, I not only no longer have the $10,000, but I also have a $4,000 tax bill on the “profit” that I don’t actually have. Another obstacle I’ve had is that I have a daughter in college, which is putting a further strain on our financial resources. We could take out a loan, but with already owing over $150,000 to the bank on the property and college tuition coming due, we don’t want to get in over our heads in debt, having to default and shut our doors.

This campaign, then, is a start towards raising the necessary $20,000. We need to get a jump on it, because sooner or later – probably sooner; we estimate by the end of 2014 – the city of Winchester is going to tell us that we need to repaint the building. Once they do, we have 30 days to have it done, or they can fine and/or close us down.

How can you help?

Obviously, any amount of money that you can donate or pledge to us would be a huge help towards saving this money. All money raised by this campaign (minus the indiegogo fees) will go 100% towards getting the needed work done. We have several nifty perks available at various donation levels; feel free to donate at whatever level you would like or can safely manage. If you would like one perk multiple times, or more than one perk, e-mail us with what you would like when you make your donation. As long as your donation at least equals the total “value” of the combined perks that you want, you will get it!

If you are donating, or cannot donate and still want to help, feel free to link to this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LiveJournal, Instagram, Pintrest, DeviantArt, your blog, or any other form of social networking you have to get the word out! Tell all of your friends, and ask them to spread the word. The more people we have that know about this campaign, the more likely we will succeed.

Looking towards the future...

In the unlikely (but dreamed of!) event that we manage to raise more than the full $20,000 we need to repaint the store, any extra funds will go towards our eventual expansion of the building. We would love to have the space for more comics, more room for people to hang out and chat, for in-store gaming, for in-store signings (like the one with Jim Caliafore for Leaving Megalopolis on November 16th), etc. That would probably cost an additional $50,000 or more. If this campaign is successful, we will probably do another campaign to raise money for that sometime within the next several years.

story:
Un-American Chronicles

“Dreams don’t die, we kill them”… or sometimes, we simply let them fade away into oblivion. Either way, it’s our duty to change that. We can stand idly by and forget about our dreams or we can do everything we can to make them come true.

For as long as I can remember, I was one of those ‘dream killers’, if such a term exists. I was reading comic books when I was 4 years old. And I became a serious collector when I was around 11. For over a decade all I did was buy more and more comics. And I would get them by the bundles. But I was never satisfied. Until one day I realized I had to do something else. I needed to create my own stories. That has always been my passion, my dream.

 

 

And in 2010 I published my first 2 page story in the first volume of The Gathering, GrayHaven’s indy anthology. And in 2011, 2012 and 2013 I wrote and illustrated many other stories for The Gathering. I’ve been fortunate enough to do pretty much everything: scripts, pencils, inks, even the lettering. And that has taught me two things: 1) how to recognize good art when I see it and 2) a collaborative effort is always something special… watching your artist give life to your script is always a magical moment.

With the collaboration of artist extraordinaire Juan Alarcón, I’ve written some of my best stories to date and I have decided this is the right time to put them on the spotlight. This is a very impressive 24 full-color page comic and you are going to love it.

Half of the money raised in Indiegogo will go to the creative team (writer & artist), and the other half will help offset printing costs.

I want everyone to be a part of this, so no matter how small or big your budget is, you will find a reward especially made for you. And remember, even if you don’t have a couple of bucks to spare, help me pass the link around. Thank you everybody. Bye.

UN-AMERICAN CHRONICLES includes:

• The Outsider (originally published in B&W in The Gathering # 14)
• The Outsider Conclusion (originally published in Tales From the Abyss # 1)
• Who Said It Was Easy? (originally published in B&W in The Gathering # 16)
• Park (originally published in B&W in GrayHaven’s Erotica One Shot)
• It’s Always the Statue of Liberty (to be published in The Gathering # 23)

By the way, keep in mind that UN-AMERICAN CHRONICLES is “Suggested for Mature Readers”, there is nothing here that you wouldn’t see on an issue of Garth Ennis “The Boys”, but still this is definitely NOT an All Ages book.
story_txt:
Un-American Chronicles
“Dreams don’t die, we kill them”… or sometimes, we simply let them fade away into oblivion. Either way, it’s our duty to change that. We can stand idly by and forget about our dreams or we can do everything we can to make them come true.
For as long as I can remember, I was one of those ‘dream killers’, if such a term exists. I was reading comic books when I was 4 years old. And I became a serious collector when I was around 11. For over a decade all I did was buy more and more comics. And I would get them by the bundles. But I was never satisfied. Until one day I realized I had to do something else. I needed to create my own stories. That has always been my passion, my dream.

 
 
And in 2010 I published my first 2 page story in the first volume of The Gathering, GrayHaven’s indy anthology. And in 2011, 2012 and 2013 I wrote and illustrated many other stories for The Gathering. I’ve been fortunate enough to do pretty much everything: scripts, pencils, inks, even the lettering. And that has taught me two things: 1) how to recognize good art when I see it and 2) a collaborative effort is always something special… watching your artist give life to your script is always a magical moment.

With the collaboration of artist extraordinaire Juan Alarcón, I’ve written some of my best stories to date and I have decided this is the right time to put them on the spotlight. This is a very impressive 24 full-color page comic and you are going to love it.

Half of the money raised in Indiegogo will go to the creative team (writer & artist), and the other half will help offset printing costs.
I want everyone to be a part of this, so no matter how small or big your budget is, you will find a reward especially made for you. And remember, even if you don’t have a couple of bucks to spare, help me pass the link around. Thank you everybody. Bye.
UN-AMERICAN CHRONICLES includes:
• The Outsider (originally published in B&W in The Gathering # 14)• The Outsider Conclusion (originally published in Tales From the Abyss # 1)• Who Said It Was Easy? (originally published in B&W in The Gathering # 16)• Park (originally published in B&W in GrayHaven’s Erotica One Shot)• It’s Always the Statue of Liberty (to be published in The Gathering # 23)
By the way, keep in mind that UN-AMERICAN CHRONICLES is “Suggested for Mature Readers”, there is nothing here that you wouldn’t see on an issue of Garth Ennis “The Boys”, but still this is definitely NOT an All Ages book.

story:
Nobody ever got rich doing a podcast, and we're not about to try. However, putting out this show each week does incur some expenses; chiefly, the yearly domain registration fees, but also the new microphones which drastically improved the quality of the audio, and the cost of hosting the episodes online.

So our goal with this campaign is simply to break even, recouping the money we've already spent while keeping the quality of the show, including sound and web presence, consistent. At the same time, we'd like to reward our listeners and financial backers with some cool swag, including original art and special episodes.

That's it. Whether we make a dime, a dollar, or nothing at all from this campaign, the show will go on, releasing a new episode every week until we've reviewed all of Saved by the Bell, as promised. But if you like what we do and want some cool stuff, this campaign simply provides a vehicle to show your appreciation via cold hard cash, something of which I'm sure Zack Morris would approve.

story:
When the Transportation Safety Administration (TSA) tries to get its gloves under the public's skin, the Voluntaryists opt to deliver justice against the invasive blue menace.  Stopping a tyrannical takeover of the body with government-mandated microchipping will take more than courage – it will take the will of the people to stand up and say “never again!” to forced molestation and radiation. Join us in this comic fight for flight freedom as the Voluntaryists take on the TSA in their most daring adventure yet! Voluntaryists VS. the TSA!

  • HISTORY: Voluntaryist was created by liberty fanatic and costumer Jaime Sherman, whose passion for liberty is only matched by his passion for cosplay photography. He began the long process of creating the series while trudging through his graduate studies.

  • GOAL: To get Voluntaryists Versus the TSA in digital copy and print to share with you, and, eventually, the world via a free download.

  • PAGE COUNT: 22-24 new pages estimated for a 100% funded campaign.

We will produce as much of the comic as we can get funded for! The storyline may be adjusted to tailor to the funding level.



What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise about $7,000 to get this comic’s potential fully going.

The expenses are largely for the cost of hiring artists to produce the comic and the expenses associated with putting the comic into print format. 

You can support us by making a contribution on the right-hand side by Credit Card/Debit Card or Paypal.

In addition, you can redeem perks for your support such as:

--->$2 – A personal “thank-you” will be made by having your name read among others in a Youtube video. (Aliases are permitted but must be specifically stated and PG rated.)

--->$6– A Voluntaryist sticker mailed to you. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address to receive this.

--->$10 – The DIGITAL COMIC in .pdf format early release. - Make sure you provide your correct e-mail to receive this.

--->$15 Sticker + Comic in .pdf format - A Voluntaryist sticker mailed to you + the Comic in .pdf format. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

--->$20 Desktop Wallpaper + Comic in .pdf – Receive a Voluntaryists desktop wallpaper for your computer background. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

--->$25– Cell Phone Background

A Voluntaryist comic cell phone background image formatted for your phone background size + comic in .pdf format. Make sure you provide your correct e-mail to receive this.

--->$35– Signed PRINT COPY of the comic. - Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

--->$60 – Voluntaryists Vs. TSA + Zombie Issue – Receive a signed Voluntaryists Versus the TSA Special and a signed print copy of the Voluntaryists Versus Statist Zombies comic. 

--->$90 All 3 Issues Signed - Receive a signed #1 Special Edition, a signed copy of the Voluntaryists Versues Statist Zombies, and and a signed Voluntaryists versus the TSA. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

--->$100 Voluntaryist Tee – Get a Voluntaryist T-Shirt! Choose a color (Red, Black, White) and a character (Voluntaryist or Voluntaria). Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

--->$150 Cover Blow Up Poster - Receive an incredible 13” x 19” blow-up of Voluntaryists vs. the TSA cover.

--->$200 –BECOME A STATIST Have you ever wanted to experience comic form? Get illustrated and appear in the issue as a TSA agent or police officer! Also receive a print copy of the comic. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this. (NOTE: Final design and implementation final design is subject to our approval. We will do our best to make it great!)

--->$300 – ½ page Ad Sponsor -Get an advertisement (PG rated) for half a comic page. (Limited to 2 Sponsors for each page and 1 page).

--->$300 –Voluntaria or AnCat ACTION FIGURE by The Official Sinister Customs. Get your unique Voluntaria or AnCat action figure made by the talented Nathan Essex of Sinister Customs. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

--->$315 ACTION FIGURE IN PACKAGING Get your unique action figure made by the talented Short Fuse Media Group with custom packaging + comic in .pdf format. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this. International buyers must pay for shipping costs.

--->$400 INTERIOR APPEARANCE Have you ever wanted to experience super form? Get illustrated and appear in the issue prominently in a crowd scene! Also receive a print copy of the comic. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this. (NOTE: Final design and implementation final design is subject to our approval. We will do our best to make it great!)

--->$500 –Voluntaryist Sculpture Choose a character and get your unique hand-painted sculpture with amazing detail! Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this. International supporters add $25.

--->$600 COVER APPEARANCE. Have you ever wanted to experience comic form? Get illustrated and appear in the issue with guns blazing on the cover! Also receive a print copy of the comic. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this. (NOTE: Final design and implementation final design is subject to our approval. We will do our best to make it great!)

While the comic is a fun relief from reality, our hope is that the comic is something beyond its entertainment value. We would like the comic to get into the hands of people who are unfamiliar with Voluntaryism and the current state of affairs. We want to wake people up to Voluntaryism and truly-free living using the comic medium because it breaks traditional genre barriers.

PUBLIC RELEASE:

We will be releasing the comic to download for free eventually, but those who paid to get the comic e-mailed or printed will receive it FIRST and will receive the comic about a month AHEAD of everyone else.

SO, with that in mind, don’t be shy about supporting at the $2 $6 levels because EVERY dollar counts to making the comic come into existence. That we need you to be our hero for!

<-----Sample Comic Page from Voluntaryists Versus Statist Zombies----->

<-----Sample Comic Page from Voluntaryists Versus Statist Zombies----->

STRETCH GOALS!

If we raise more than $1,500 ABOVE the goal, we will do an animated reading of the comic to post on YouTube.

If we raise more than $3,000 above the goal, we will open a 3D printed action figure perk and fund a batch of figures to be distributed to contributors who give at the $50+ level. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have pocket change to spare, you can still help us get the message out by sharing our campaign and sharing our videos on YouTube.

Use the indiegogo.com share tools to let others know and visit our pages here:

FACEBOOK:http://www.facebook.com/sire.voluntary

YOUTUBE:http://youtube.com/thevoluntaryists

WEBSITE:http://volcomic.com

ALSO! Please make sure you give us your proper address for whatever perk you redeem. If you have any questions, please direct them to Jaime at mr.voluntary@gmail.com. 

READ THE FIRST & SECOND ISSUES FOR FREE: http://voluntaryists.wordpress.com/free-comic-download/

And that’s all there is to it. ( :

story:
What happens when Michael the absolute general of the heavenly army stands before Lucifer, the prince of the darkness?

This first book will tell us a lot about the angelical world, from the gates of Heaven to the gates of hell we'll cover most aspects and questions about angels during a crude battle that will take the two most powerful angels to open their hearts and sharpen their swords in a distructive psycological duel.

Silent Wars is a comic book series based on the supernatural exploring topics like old stories, mythology, angels and demons, witches, secret cults... The main storiline takes place in a 3000 years old city (Mantova, north of Italy) full of legends and historical places to be used, in addition to it's ancient architecture it has the foggy and misterical atmosphere that gives the right feeling to our stories.

 

In the series main timeline we introduce side stories, legends and often bring up flashbacks from the past of the characters enriching the final experience, giving the readers full comprehension of Silent Wars' world. Our goal is to produce a really good storyline, not throwing information to readers but let them discover everything gradually, no mather how long the series will have to be.

The great thing about Indiegogo is this amazing relationship authors can have with readers, and we want this, we want that you can be part of this project, your opinion is very relevant to us, we want that you really enjoy what you're reading!

 

I and my friend Philip Oak have spent time and passion on this comic for a long time, by now we have the first issue, at about 39 pages, but we want to go on with the series, and for that we need your help. This first issue has the first 5 pages on color and the others in black and white with screentones like a manga. 

 

Characters

In the past he was the high priest of the cult of Mantus, the ancient etruscan god of the dead, now he "simply" teaches religion in a former school. What happened to him, what took Gerard to leave behind his world of power and wealth?

 

The most powerful and intelligent of all the angels, Lucifer fell on a simple mistake, ingratitude. Enter the mind of the prince of darkness and understand what took the high cherub of the Lord to become the prince of darkness.

 

The first prince of the Angels, he is the general of the heavenly army. His great swordsman skill is only challenged by his determination to accomplish the will of the Creator.

 

 

By the moment our possibility as authors is to send copies of the first issue on pdf to everyone who contribute to our project. Our intention is to produce a really great printed book when we arrive at a considerable number of chapters,but to arrive at that point we need your support and contribution.If you liked the story consider helping us by choosing one of the perks you can see on the right part of this site.

The digital books will be sent to your email when the campaign arrive to its end, whether or not it reaches it's goal :)

Ps: Sorry for my English, hope you could understand everything, the comic book is being translated to English right now by competent people and will be revised for a further quality.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love this type of story and want to help us, please spread the word and tell your friends about this project.

story:
Barton Flats vol. 1

A smörgåsbord of whimsical irreverence, passable illustration, and general absurdity

 


About me:

My name is Jonathan Woods and I have been creating the Barton Flats webcomic (http://bartonflats.wordpress.com/) for just over two years now.  What originally started off as a whim has since become a bit of an obsession and favored pastime.  With over 200 individual comics now constituting the Barton Flats repertoire, I felt it was time to take the current “best of” the collection to print. 


The Genesis of Barton Flats:

I guess my family doesn’t come from the most distinguished lineage, because when my grandparents couldn’t come up with a middle name for my dad, they chose Barton out of the phone book (presumably they couldn’t care to proceed very deep into the phone book, either).  Turns out, according to Wikipedia, that barton is an archaic English word meaning lands of the manor, which, given my dad’s fetish for period England and his fantasy of being a butler in the likes of a Jane Austen novel, seems to fit just fine.

The word flats, well, it just seemed to work – jokes fall flat, girls wear flats as a less spectacular alternative to heels, flats tend to be rather banal, featureless landscapes – plus, (at least in my mind) the combination of words encourages a perceptual spoonerism (fart-on blats, or something like that).

 

 

 

The Project:

I’m looking to raise $1,500 to print a run of Barton Flats vol. 1 as a 64-page, perfect-bound, 5x7”, soft-cover, in color and black-and-white.  I would love to premiere the book at the 2012 Montreal Expozine, November 17th and 18th!

 

 

Thank you so much for your generosity!

sincerely,

Jonathan

story:
I had a dream....a great one that is.

Growing up in Africa you don't have any African superheroes that you can look up to or be inspired by that's why I have decided to make Captain Africa. I want him to be a symbol of possibilities for all. Captain Africa whose secret identity is Anathi Mkhanyisi is a 28 year old who works at an insurance firm ,he grew up in a small village in Eastern Cape province,South Africa called e'Mangati outside a fictional city called Century city (the city Captain Africa is based in).I want to tell this story of an African superhero because it's important for people to have that person fictional or not that they can look up to,and I want to introduce the world to what Africa has been cooking up. I believe in him and his capabilities,I hope you do to.

story:
Who are we?

     We are a team of artists working to turn educational information into a series of fun comic-strips as an entertaining alternative to learning and absorbing information. I (Rossie Stone) am the director and founder of the project, and I have worked for 4 years as an animator and have loved comics since I was very young. These comics are based on a technique I used to significantly pass my own exams at school, and change the game of education for me. 

     If it can help me, then I'm certain there's so many other people it can help. We tested these comics on several different schools ~ across a variety of ages and learning-types, including those with forms of dyslexia and autism. It came back highly enthusiastic and positive by all! This addresses an issue that has long been in the education system. The most common comment we receive from adults regarding Dekko Comics is: "I wish this was available when I was at school." There is a place for new ways of thinking and learning, and it's a place that Dekko Comics can help fill ~ and in my personal belief has been long-overdue. 

We've now made 24 new comics at a higher quality thanks to our earlier crowd funding success to put them into production. If you help us fund the printing of these, you will be helping us put a new/under-subscribed way of thinking into the society ~ and an exciting effective method of studying that engages and entertains its readers, rather than just being an easier form. It could help so many people who struggle with conventional learning methods, while also being an entertaining new option for many who possibly don't struggle so much. Think of what this could do for our education-system in the long-run...? 

 

What do we need?

We're looking for just £1000 as the deal with the printer we have gives us 1250 full 32-page comics of the two issues we'll be releasing in August. It's important to us that we get a decent amount like this to get us going, as we started this project through self-production and being funded by people who wanted to see the project become a reality and cared for its purpose. We want to end it the same way, and being able to manage distribution ourselves at this early stage will give us full control over how we release and present our product. It will also act as a great way to test the waters, and put us in a better position to strike up a relationship with potential publishers, (we've already received interest from some!)

If we can raise more money, it will go towards  more printing. The better chance we have at getting these comics off their feet, the better it is for the long-run. If we raise more obey than that, some of it will go towards self-marketing costs. If we DON'T hit the £1000 target, what money we have raised will go towards printing as many as we can. 

We've upped the rewards since the Kickstarter Campaign, as we're in a better position to do so now. We're offering things that are not just cool, valuable and exciting, but connect you closer to the journey of the project. These include:
- Tickets to the Launch Party in August, where you'll get to experience the moment and celebrations of when these comics finally go on sale. (We may also be having another one in September for another branch, which you will be included in).
- Special 'thank-you' art that can be customised by yourself. It will be yours forever, and will be a sort of trophy to mark your support in making the project come together, and what it stood for. It will be quality-made, and will be signed by both the creator (myself) and all the team working on Dekko. 
- Signed copies of the two Dekko Comics issues we'll be releasing ~ post&packaged to your address, with a personal thank-you card attached. These will be two of the first issues ever released.
- DELICIOUS, (and we mean it!) artistic cakes from a highly talented bakery professional, Maggie Tennant. She has nearly 2000 likes on her Facebook Page 'Homemade by Maggie' and all from something she does out of a hobby, since she loves it so much. She has been passionately supporting us with Dekko and has kindly offered to make us special Dekko-Cakes ~ plus a £100 voucher to anyone who donates this amount. She doesn't fling those around lightly...
 

What IMPACT could this have...?

These comics are addressing an issue that has long been part of the education-system ~ in which reading is the primary form of communication, and the use of words. There was a time where if you were not a natural or good reader, you would have to work much harder and experience much more failures, or just accept your fate. The priority of reading still exists in the school-systems today, even though there are so many individuals out there who are more naturally visual thinkers, or kinetic thinkers, etc. 

As someone who struggled all throughout my school life, it was more than just my school subjects that were affected. Being shouted at by teachers and being made fun of by my classmates (and friends), if I had known that there was a way in which I could not only excel at education but ENJOY it - then it would have made such a difference in my life and would have saved me from so much grief. 

There are different ways of learning out there, and I see no reason why there has to be a gap between education and entertainment in any case. When we leave school we're often filled with a hunger to learn, because we're out of the stuffy education system we weren't engaged with or, (in my case), didn't excel or feel natural within. We also learn and pick up things from movies, games, music, conversations, dance, and more. There are so many ways to effectively communicate information, rather than just words alone. How much more interesting is a lecture when it's performed enthusiastically, for example? 
If there's one key attribute of Dekko Comics, it's that they focus on being a COMIC before EDUCATION. Focusing on the communication element ~ how you're getting across information ~ is what this project aims to emphasise.

We successfully have run a Kickstarter Campaign to gain raise enough money to put these comics into production. We were looking for £10,000 - we ended up raising £13,160. The experience with running that Kickstarter has been valuable to me, and it will serve us well when running this Indiegogo Campaign. I'm also fortunate to be working with a team of people who care very much about the project's cause, and are passionate about making the end product as good as it can be through their art. Furthermore, as someone who has been through some of the struggles these comics address, I can assure you it is my full intention to make the impact I claim it to. I see no point in making such claims otherwise. 

 

What are the Risks and Challenges that lie ahead...?

Having said this, we're not denying there are potential obstacles along the way ~ nor that things like this are ever easy. Running the Kickstarter Campaign (another crowd funder) before this back in April taught me that. I had to work very hard to make sure the word got around and that we were getting the money we needed to reach our target.
However, that is a big reason why we are well-equipped for this campaign ~ as we have been through the trials and errors that come with the crowd funding ~ and how much conscious effort and preparation is involved. We also came out of the other end of it successfully funded, so we also have experience is making a campaign meet its goal too. However, it is still worth going over some of the risks involved in this endeavour:

. Getting the word out: If you're a stranger to too many people, it can be hard to get them to watch your video; let alone reach into their pockets to donate something. One of the things highly recommended in crowd funding campaigns is being connected to a large social network of people that are familiar with you and know you, as they are far more likely to take curiosity and support your project that way. 
But since the Kickstarter, we now have a network on several different social-media pages supporting and keeping up-to-date with our project. This includes Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and Linked-In. We also have a large following of teachers, parents, students, pupils, schools and organisations from the Kickstarter Campaign that we've been growing ever since, and they are keeping up-to-date with any of the latest information regarding Dekko, and are actively sharing our links. (More always helps, though)!


. More work than anticipated: One of the reasons why preparation is so emphasised amongst experienced crowd fundraisers is that it's so much more work than people think. I have enough wisdom to know now that the funds don't just come 'rolling in'. You've got to persistently engage with people, give updates, and offer new material to get them more connected with the project with. 
​However, I am experienced with this now ~ and furthermore, I now have help. In my previous crowd funding campaign I didn't bring team help onto the project until the last couple of weeks. Having those extra hands to the pump was extremely valuable, and allowed me to focus on the main plan while they took care of spreading the word, etc. This time we're already prepared for that, and my Dekko Team will be helping me with distributing the news of Indiegogo and helping me with the tasks. I will also know how to coordinate them more fluently, based on my previous experience.

 

. But what about when/if we get enough money to print them? Will they sell? Will it be successful? There are crowd funding campaigns that do not work out even after they have been successfully funded. There is no guarantee of even completing the project, before they even get to taking it to market. And even then, will the world catch on to the idea you're projecting ~ even if the people who funded you thought it was great?
But since getting our funding in April, I have made sure that my team and I stay on schedule and we have managed to produce two comics per week. We are very nicely on track to the original release-date we promised in August, and we intend to realise that claim. Regarding sales, we have a MAILING LIST (which you too can sign up for by emailing info@dekkocomics.com) ~ in which we have a list of people, teachers, schools and organisations already signed up for purchasing the comics ~ receiving updates about the latest news. I have also spoken to independent comic stores that would be very interested unseeing Dekko Comics on their shelves, and they do get a lot of parents coming in. We intend to get these on the shelves on bookshops a little bit later - in September. By then we will have had a taste of how reactive the public is to Dekko Comics, and will make any necessary adjustments there. Money or not, we will also be putting some heavy energy into self-marketing.
Furthermore, we have a stall at the Scottish Learning Festival ~ an event swarming with teachers and school-representatives looking for new ways to teach their kids. Dekko Comics fits right into this, and Dyslexia and Autism instates are showing particular interest. We are already being advertised on the official Scottish Learning Festival website, and will continue to get the word out there about it ourselves also.

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Donations are obviously extremely valuable to us, however big or small. But there's other ways you can help besides donating:
- Get the word out there about our campaign. Tell your friends or, even better, a teacher or someone within the school-system you might know. Better still, a parent or someone who has experienced dyslexia or learning-struggles before. It's just as important to us that this project is funded by the relevant people who it means something to ~ whether that be of them liking the idea or being able to relate to it personally.
- Maybe you know a publisher who might be perfect for Dekko? fire our project their way. You never know what kind of collaborations could happen - and we'd certainly want it to profit both parties!
- SHARE this video and page via your social-media links, (indigo as options for you to do that to your preference). It's a cool project for a good cause and of a highly relatable theme for many. It's unlikely it will look bad on your page. We would say it's a project that's got WORTH in letting people know about it ~ especially in the long-run, if we're successful.

 

Please do visit our website for more about Dekko Comics. Check out the links below for your own interest, or email us if you have any enquiries at: info@dekkocomics.com.

Kindest regards to all of you,
Rossie Stone. 
(Creator)

OFFICIAL WEBSITE:
www.dekkocomics.com

PREVIOUS KICKSTARTER CAMPAIGN:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/660224835/...

BBC NEWS FEATURE:
https://vimeo.com/174408691

story:
Andromeda, or The Long Way Home cover

What is Andromeda?

Is it a surreal horror comic? An apocalyptic hero's journey? A psychedelic eco-western? 

At its core, Andromeda follows the journey of a nomad as he struggles to
understand, thrive and conquer the landscape that surrounds him.
It's also a platform for me to explore all the stuff that I love about comics, mythology, folklore, horror, symbology and storytelling.

 

The Book and What's Inside

This will be a 120 page Hardcover book with a cloth bound spine,  a copper hot foil stamped cover and high quality heavy paper stock.
Inside you'll find:

  • ​The previously self-published chapters Bugonia (2016)
    and A House On The Horizon (2017)

  • A new chapter entitled Our Mother The Mountain.

  • A selection of illustrations and sketches​!

  • An ambient music soundtrack CD!
  • ​A guest pin-up gallery  of some of my favorite artists like Mike Mignola (Hellboy), 
    Artyom Trakhanov (Slavic Nihilism), Frans Boukas (Bartkira), 
    John Kenn Mortensen     (Sticky Monsters ), Matt Smith (Barbarian Lord),
    Simon Roy     (Prophet) , Aaron Conley (sabertooth swordsman) and others!

 



Preview pages 1&2


Preview pages 3,4 & 5

 

Pin-up by Mike Mignola

pin-up by John Kenn Mortensen 

The Goal and Why I Need Your Help:

Self-Publishing is hard and expensive, especially if you want to make a fancy high quality hardcover book.  
With this campaign I hope to cover all the expenses in producing a print run
of 300 copies (or more in the off chance the campaign supersedes it's goal) 
and to show my work to a wider audience.  


 

Rewards







Before checking out: please request the PDF of available pages at  the.art.of.z(at)gmail.com. 
First come, first served!

 

Risks & Challenges

Honestly, there aren't many risks! The project is mostly finished (15 pages left to ink and the soundtrack needs to be put together) and should be done by the end of 2018. If the campaign is successful the book will go to the printers in early January and should be ready to be shipped by Late January 2019.

Other Ways You Can Help

If there's someone you know that might enjoy this project, please share it with them and spread the word on social media!

Follow me on Instragram to keep updated.
Thank you so much for reading this and  for your support!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Gregory Gregg and I currently live in Colorado Springs, CO. I have been working on my comic series since leaving the ARMY in 2016.  This comic takes place in a post apocalyptic era. 

Virgo (The constellation that takes human form) has an ongoing relationship with a being of great power. once she finds out she's with child, she then learns that the being is the ultimate evil which prompts her to place the baby in hiding..There’s an undiscovered prophecy that speaks of a vessel half good half evil walking the earth. The ultimate evil knows of the prophecy and wants to sacrifice his offspring so he can obtain the power of the 13th zodiac. The ultimate evil now has his followers killing and kidnapping any and everyone on earth in an attempt to find this child which throws off the balance of nature. Zodia (the God to all that is good) has been awakened because of the killing and kidnapping ordering his warriors (zodiac signs) to choose a vessel (human) and give them the powers and abilities to restore balance to a world.

I'm requesting that you guys help me to raise 2500.00 The proceeds will got to issues 3 and 4 of my comic series as well as new poster art. If the goal is not met, what ever is raised will still go towards this KTZ journey (poster illustrations and pages towards the next issue). 

Your contribution to the KTZ journey will give you the satisfaction of knowing that you were a part of something great in the making.Your names will be placed in an extra page created in the back of the comic which will be signed. This comic will bring you into a world where a bounty is placed on the head of a child who is a part of a prophecy. The constellations that we see every night when we look into the sky will be brought to life. some will be on the hunt and some will be out to help. Others may even be lost leaving you the readers not knowing who to trust. With this universe that being created, my hope is that it will grow to be an actual anime that we all rave about.

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

In the past, the challenges in creating my comics have been consistent regarding time. I have overcome these hurdles by sacrificing personal obligations in order to make my deadlines. Although hard to do, I have been successful regarding the dates that I have set. With your help, I will be able to set an earlier date present you with a quality story.

If you are unable to make a donation towards this awesomeness but still want to be a part of the KTZ family, please use any and all share tools provided by indiegogo. You can also use the website keystozodia.com (copy the url and share) or follow on IG @ keys_to_zodia.

My name is Gregory Gregg and I currently live in Colorado Springs, CO. I have been working on my comic series since leaving the ARMY in 2016.  This comic takes place in a post apocalyptic era. 
Virgo (The constellation that takes human form) has an ongoing relationship with a being of great power. once she finds out she's with child, she then learns that the being is the ultimate evil which prompts her to place the baby in hiding..There’s an undiscovered prophecy that speaks of a vessel half good half evil walking the earth. The ultimate evil knows of the prophecy and wants to sacrifice his offspring so he can obtain the power of the 13th zodiac. The ultimate evil now has his followers killing and kidnapping any and everyone on earth in an attempt to find this child which throws off the balance of nature. Zodia (the God to all that is good) has been awakened because of the killing and kidnapping ordering his warriors (zodiac signs) to choose a vessel (human) and give them the powers and abilities to restore balance to a world.
I'm requesting that you guys help me to raise 2500.00 The proceeds will got to issues 3 and 4 of my comic series as well as new poster art. If the goal is not met, what ever is raised will still go towards this KTZ journey (poster illustrations and pages towards the next issue). Your contribution to the KTZ journey will give you the satisfaction of knowing that you were a part of something great in the making.Your names will be placed in an extra page created in the back of the comic which will be signed. This comic will bring you into a world where a bounty is placed on the head of a child who is a part of a prophecy. The constellations that we see every night when we look into the sky will be brought to life. some will be on the hunt and some will be out to help. Others may even be lost leaving you the readers not knowing who to trust. With this universe that being created, my hope is that it will grow to be an actual anime that we all rave about.
People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.
In the past, the challenges in creating my comics have been consistent regarding time. I have overcome these hurdles by sacrificing personal obligations in order to make my deadlines. Although hard to do, I have been successful regarding the dates that I have set. With your help, I will be able to set an earlier date present you with a quality story.

If you are unable to make a donation towards this awesomeness but still want to be a part of the KTZ family, please use any and all share tools provided by indiegogo. You can also use the website keystozodia.com (copy the url and share) or follow on IG @ keys_to_zodia.

story:
Art Thibert's heroic duo, Black and White, celebrates their 25th anniversary, and Art is sharing the milestone with fans by creating this monumental crossover cover!

"Jump on board and grab your very own copy of Vampirella #1 as she celebrates her 50th birthday with a team-up cover of epic proportions." - Art Thibert

Pre-order your limited-edition, collectible covers right here, and you'll also have the option to get them signed by Art!

For Art's biggest fans, don't miss your chance to add an original inked drawing of either Black and White, or Vampirella! Just select any perk and you'll be offered the chance to add the sketch. (artwork will vary)

••••••••JUST ADDED!••••••••

Order the crossover event t-shirt or have it added to another perk during checkout.

 

Vampirella has also been celebrating her own anniversary of 50 years and, with both anniversaries happening in tandem, this cover couldn't come at a greater time!

"I’d say that a book showcasing characters with that kind of staying power calls for a party!" - Art Thibert

Whether you're already a Vampirella fan, or curious where to start, Vampirella #1 is the beginning of her modern story and there's a good reason why it has sold over 150,000 copies to date...

  • "Unexpectedly dark and trippy ride that's worth checking out for fans and newcomers alike." - Adventures in Poor Taste
  • "This is everything I could have hoped for... Highest possible recommendation." - SciFi Pulse
  • "The book comes together seamlessly, making it a strong start for a new ongoing series starring a character that has seen decades of stories." - ComicsBeat
  • "Gündüz is such a brilliant artist, carefully crafting each scene to deliver the most intensity and emotion." - Horror DNA

About Art Thibert

Art Thibert is a comic book artist who has been in the comics industry for over 35 years.  Art is primarily known as an inker; however, he also has a substantial resume as a penciler, writer, and creator.

During his many years as an artist, Art has worked on some of the best comics in comic history, including the ground-breaking Death of Superman series, X-Men, Ultimate X-Men, Ultimate Spider-Man, Cable, Spawn and others too numerous to mention.

The last few years has seen Art turn back to his indie roots by publishing his creator-owned series, Black & White and Chrono Mechanics.  His passion has always been in the total immersive and creative process, and he is having the time of his life.

FOLLOW ART THIBERT:

  • FACEBOOK
  • INSTAGRAM
  • TWITTER
  • DEVIANT ART
  • ART'S WEBSITE
  • PRE-ORDER THE NEW CHRONO MECHANICS GRAPHIC NOVEL

Risks & Challenges

The book is finished and ready for press, we just need to know how many copies to print. If we encounter any delays with fulfillment, they would likely be due to printer delays in Canada, depending on how the coronavirus may continue to affect production and shipping.

story:
What will happen if we don't reach our goal of $30 000? 

This campaign was run to engage the indie comics community in the idea of ComixCentral™, to build brand recognition and develop our user base. We have accomplished this goal and reached more people that we even dreamed we could! The money we attain from selling perks will be used for the sites development. The site is being built regardless of how much that is. By selling perks we wanted to give people the opportunity to become founders of ComixCentral™ and all that will entail in the future! (psst.Which will be well worth it, we have big plans for you guys!)

~

Join ComixCentral™ and Create a New Standard for the World of Indie Comics. Put the Power Back into the Hands of the Artists and Help us Create an Indie Comic revolution.

ComixCentral™ is The Hub for Indie Comics.

LEARN, SHARE, PROMOTE AND SELL YOUR SELF-PUBLISHED INDIE COMICS. 

We are revolutionizing the way Self-Published Indie Comic Artists work, sell, learn and collaborate. The Industry is dominated by a handful of big publishers, making it almost impossible for the vast majority of indie comic creators to get noticed. There is no one central place for them to learn new skills, collaborate with fellow creators, sell their work and be promoted online.  

We are the world’s first and largest community/marketplace for indie artists - by indie artists.

Learn new skills, share ideas, and teach others how to be better artists, writers, illustrators— anything indie comics.

Get everything you need in one place to promote your own work, read and share the work of other artists and turn your hobby into a real live business. And every account is FREE! 

Sell your art and your comics, host and promote your WebComics, and finally be able to make money in an industry dominated by “the big guys”.  

This one of a kind community and marketplace is first at providing hobbyists and up-and-coming Comic stars a place to distribute and promote their work without having to compete with the large corporate brands.

At ComixCentral™ creators are given everything they need for success and fans get access to fresh, unique and uncensored content in all Comic Book formats; web comics, print-on-demand issues, direct from seller and digital.

CREATORS UNITE!!

We are Indie to the core.

ComixCentral™ is grass roots from the ground up. No secret investors with their own agendas. It’s about our integrity.

We want to hit the ground running!

Our users will have everything they need to build their own successful Comics careers right away. They deserve all our great features with top security and privacy measures in place right from the get go!

Money raised will be used to complete the infrastructure and legal requirements. A 6-month pre-cash flow requirement for administration and sales staff is included with the expected start-up advertising and marketing expenses that will be required in the first year.

See More Perks in the Gallery Under Our Video.

Copic® Partner Pack

ComixCentral™ is delighted to have Copic® as a partner! Copic markers are the celebrated coloring tool within professional, semi-professional and hobby circles alike. This perk includes 2 Copic Multiliner Pens, a beta launch invitation, special newsletter updates for founders only and an on-site founder's badge.

Radioactive Stickers

The name says it all. Stickers. That are radioactive. Superpowers may or may not appear. We're not making any promises. Includes a Beta Launch Invitation, special newsletter updates just for founders and an exclusive on-site Founder's Badge.

Exclusive Online Masterclass

“How to be a self-published comic artist - without a paying a dime".

Have a burning desire to become a comic book artist - but can't afford art school? Indie Comic illustrator Leigh Jeffery will help you learn the skills you will need to achieve your ultimate potential as an Indie Comicbook creator. Learn great hacks for finding resources, scheduling your time, reaching your goals, getting attention for your work - all using free and available resources. This is no get awesome quick scheme, what it is, is a solid and tested plan that will take you from wannabe to professional artist.

League of Shadows Premium Pack

Hangouts with Industry Geniuses, priority booking for all ComixCentral™ events, special offers, super secret gifts from partners, access to the Premium Forum, a special site badge and more. Also comes with a beta launch invitation, on-site founder's badge, special newsletter updates for founders only and a CXC sticker pack.

CXC T-Shirt Pack

Choose from 4 unique designs made just for this campaign by the ComixCentral™ design team! Also includes a beta launch invitation, special newsletter updates just for founders an exclusive on-site founder badge and a CXC Sticker pack!

We have brought together a team of seasoned experts, dedicated to making ComixCentral™ a reality. Our founding team members range from 12 to 40 years of experience in the publishing, graphic design and marketing industries.

What types of comics will be available?

All kinds and all formats! As long as it’s Indie (creator owned) any genre is welcome in digital, print on demand and direct from seller!  


Will there be Marvel & DC comics for sale?

NO. ComixCentral™ is dedicated to giving Indie artists a place all their own. This means only creator owned content will be available.


Will creators have to apply to upload content?

NO.  Everyone is welcome to use their Profile and "ComixStore" to upload any Indie content they choose! (However, we will remove any content that is reported by users for spam or hate propaganda. No Nazis allowed!)


Who owns the work uploaded on ComixCentral™?
The artist or artists who upload the work retain 100% full ownership of their content. ComixCentral™ is only a portal to sell your work through, we do not own your content.

Will it cost money to be a member and contributor to ComixCentral™?
No. Every account is free. 

Visit Comixcentral.com for More Information »

Visit Comixcentral.com for More Information »

story:
"BOTTOMS UP! True Tales of Hitting Rock-Bottom" is an anthology collecting real stories of bottoming out from alcoholism, drug dependency, sex addiction, body dysmorphia, pornography addiction and more. These stories have been adapted into comics by a team of incredibly talented and diverse cartoonists. It was edited by J.T. Yost and will be published by Birdcage Bottom Books. 

(Cover art by Ben Passmore)

WHY THIS THEME?

The theme of addiction is very personal to me, as I have several close friends and family who struggle against it on a daily basis. A few have lost their battles, and I miss them. 

Some of the most powerful stories I've heard in my life have come from addicts. I believe a collection of these stories might provoke empathy in those who are not themselves addicts and recognition in those who are. My greatest hope is that those who are struggling with addiction but haven't admitted it to themselves will identify with the stories within this anthology enough to realize that they are not alone and that there is no shame in seeking help. 

The book will contain an index of organizations that can help with addiction. A percentage of proceeds will be donated to a local recovery program in New York. 

WON'T IT JUST DEPRESS THE READER?

I won't sugar-coat it: There are a lot of harrowing stories included in BOTTOMS UP!, but I've tried to balance it out with some levity (every addict has got at least one funny story). Both the story-tellers and the cartoonists adapting their stories are a diverse group, so there is a natural variance in both tone and style. 

HOW DID YOU GET THE STORIES?

I first hit up my family and friends. The original concept was that all of the authors would remain anonymous while the artists would be credited for the artwork. A few of the authors asked to include their names, but for the most part they are anonymous. This ensured that they could feel free to be brutally honest without fear of repercussions. 

I then set up a website to which people could submit their stories anonymously. These stories were all then posted for my curated list of cartoonists to choose from. Some cartoonists adapted their own stories or those of their own friends and family. 

WHY USE KICKSTARTER?

The short answer is that I don't have the funds to publish this anthology in a way that would do its contributors justice. I'm also hoping to be able to compensate each contributor monetarily. 

I am hoping to make this book available to a wide audience. Kickstarter will not only broaden the audience itself, but it will allow me to afford a professional print job of a large quantity, an ISBN & barcode and all of the trappings of a "real book" accepted by book stores and large distributors (a majority of Birdcage Bottom Books' publications are hand-made minicomics that don't fit that criteria). 

HOW WILL THE MONEY BE USED?

The majority of the funds will go towards the printing cost. I will be using a trusted printer in Canada that I have used for several previous projects. The funding goal reflects the printing cost with 5% going to Kickstarter's fee and 5% to credit card processing fees. 

Anything raised above the goal will be divvied up between all of our contributing artists. 

 WHO ARE THE CONTRIBUTING ARTISTS?

- Josh Bayer (title page)
- Haleigh Buck
- Kevin Budnik
- Josh Burggraf
- Max Clotfelter
- Peter S. Conrad
- Nate Doyle
- Rachel Dukes
- Chad Essley
- Mike Freiheit
- Tatiana Gill
- Danny Hellman (back cover)
- Jordan Jeffries
- Gideon Kendall
- Victor Kerlow
- Brendan Kiefer
- Sara Lautman
- Lizz Lunney
- Daniel McCloskey
- Chris Monday
- Fred Noland
- Adam Pasion
- Ben Passmore (front cover)
- Simon Petersen
- Summer Pierre
- John Porcellino
- Gillian Rhodes
- Matt Rota
- Kevin Scalzo
- Holly Simple
- Karl Stevens
- Michael Sweater
- Meghan Turbitt
- Noah Van Sciver
- Jamie Vayda
- Elaine M. Will
- Jess Worby
- George Wylesol
- Adam Yeater
- J.T. Yost

CAN WE SEE SOME SAMPLE PAGES?

Absolutely!

Sample page by Jordan Jeffries

 

Sample page by Sara Lautman

 

Sample page by Gideon Kendall

 

Sample page by Noah Van Sciver

 

Sample page by Daniel McCloskey

 

Sample page by Haleigh Buck

 

Sample page by J.T. Yost

 

Sample page by Matt Rota

 

Sample page by Max Clotfelter

story:
Golden Apple Comics

My father started Golden Apple Comics over 30 years ago.  I grew up in the store and, more importantly, in the world of comics. 


I decided to start a Production Company out of the shop after hearing so many stories from my Industry buddies who put their blood, sweat, and tears into writing and drawing a comic to have some big studio actually agree to turn it into a TV show or a movie.....and then nothing happened. Their book sat on a shelf somewhere because some executive who wasn't even a comics fan lost interest in it.  I want to change that...NOW!



I quickly realized in order to really make this happen, part of this company needed to be publishing.  There are a ton of independent creators out there (maybe you're one of them) who have great books or ideas for books that go unnoticed or unpublished because they just can't get their foot in the door in the Comics Industry.  I want to help bring those great books to life.  I want to tell that girl or guy who walks into my store with a cool book they've drawn at home, "This books is awesome.  I wanna make it."  


My goal is that Golden Apple Productions will be a company in Hollywood that's on the creator's side as well as the fan's side.  I know good books and I know what the fans like.  That's why I'm coming to you, comic fans for help. I don't want to answer to some guy in a suit with a ton of money, I want to answer to the fans. 


How You Can Help

Our goal is simple.  We have a handfull of books we're currently pitching around Hollywood.  So far so good, but we are at the point where we need cash to really get this company up and running. We need to create comic trailers for our books, look-books for pitching them, build a site for comic submissions & more...but we're cash poor. 

More importantly, we have a few books already written and illustrated that are just waiting to be printed.  Furthermore, we've got ideas from several creators, including top talent like Darick Robertson (HAPPY!, The Boys, Transmetopolitan, etc.) and Writer/Actor Michael McMillian from True Blood, that we need funds to have illustrated and fully brought to life.  These are just a few of our amazing books waiting to be created.  And my partner and I just don't have the money to fund all this ourselves and don't want to bankrupt my family's comic shop in the process.  That's why we need your help.

Crowdfunding through Indiegogo seems like a natural fit.  We have some creative "perks" that give you value and us some cash, a WIN-WIN scenario.

Here are a few Golden Apple books we are developing NOW and need money to fund:     

TRIAGE: This is a unique and inventive story about EMT Cassie Jurich who makes a miraculous recovery from an accident to not only find she has physical abilities she never knew, but someone wants to kill her for it.  It's an action/mystery with enhanced human abilities. What more do you want from a book?  The writer, Mairghread Scott (Transformers Prime), has issue 2 written and ready to go.  We want to hire an artist to bring it to life and keep this awesome series going.     

TELIKOS PROTOCOL: This is one of the most insanely cool books ever.  If you haven't seen it, check it out now.  Telikos is one of the most successful KICKSTARTER projects in history.

These guys have created  an amazing world and we are lucky enough to be working with them to develop it for TV, film and Video Game.  It's published by Vanquish  Interactive and I gotta tell you, these guys have some sweet new books in the pipeline.  Telikos is only the beginning and we hope to work with Vanquish to bring all their titles to the screen.

THE 36: Ancient Kaballah mythology says there are 36 people alive in the world at all times who are tasked with protecting the world, whether they know it or not. Kristopher White has taken this mythology and given it a smart super hero edge. This is a lush, rich world populated with real characters with real problems, who just happened to be the saviors of the planet. This is a must-read. Kris has Volume 2 mapped out and 2 stand-alone stories already written.  We just need money to hire artists to continue to bring this spectacular universe to life. This will surely be your new favorite series.   

JIMMY BRASS, 2ND GRADE DETECTIVE: This is a noir detective story starring a 9-year-old.  An awesome book that my daughter loves it as much as I do.  The writer, Jake Dickerman (Gormitti: Nature Unleashed), has created a funny, cool and unique world where a hard-boiled detective solves the mysteries of his school with the help of his flask-like juicebox and a butt-kicking Kindergarten girl, Opal. Jake has 3 issues done and waiting to be printed and many more in the works.  This is a fun series that we are eager to keep going and possibly sell as an animated or live-action TV series.   

What You Get 

So, the important part.  What do you get for your support?  We're offering a ton of stuff, from digital copies of our books, to a shopping spree at Golden Apple Comics. We'll even publish your comic book under the Golden Apple imprint! That's right. Your book can be one of the first books we publish and a part of comics history. Yeah, there are a lot of incentives from $5 to $10,000, please check them all out. There is something for everyone!  

The Impact

We could have gone after private money, but we don't want to deal with people who are going to squash ideas because they aren't "commercial." We are asking you guys for help because we want to have to answer to you. We want to give you what you want, and that's awesome comics and (hopefully) awesome movies & TV, too. We don't get in the way of the creators we work with, we let them do their thing and help their vision come to life.  

With Golden Apple Productions, I hope to continue on what my father started in 1979. Let's go out and make the new wave of comics!

Other Ways To Help

If you're on hard times, like we've all been (believe me, I know), then please help us out by telling your friends about us and linking to this page though social media (Facebook, Twitter, Etc.).   

Thank you for all your support!  Let's start making some awesome comic books and helping Indy Creators!

-Ryan Liebowitz

Legal Stuff

*Gift card can NOT be used on already discounted merchandise or consignment items.  

**Banner ad will be placed at Golden Apple’s discretion.  Golden Apple refuses the right to promote any business it chooses, including competitors or businesses deemed inappropriate by Golden Apple.  If Golden Apple rejects your company, your donation will be refunded.
story_txt:
Golden Apple Comics
My father started Golden Apple Comics over 30 years ago.  I grew up in the store and, more importantly, in the world of comics.  







I decided to start a Production Company out of the shop after hearing so many stories from my Industry buddies who put their blood, sweat, and tears into writing and drawing a comic to have some big studio actually agree to turn it into a TV show or a movie.....and then nothing happened. Their book sat on a shelf somewhere because some executive who wasn't even a comics fan lost interest in it.  I want to change that...NOW!






I quickly realized in order to really make this happen, part of this company needed to be publishing.  There are a ton of independent creators out there (maybe you're one of them) who have great books or ideas for books that go unnoticed or unpublished because they just can't get their foot in the door in the Comics Industry.  I want to help bring those great books to life.  I want to tell that girl or guy who walks into my store with a cool book they've drawn at home, "This books is awesome.  I wanna make it."  





My goal is that Golden Apple Productions will be a company in Hollywood that's on the creator's side as well as the fan's side.  I know good books and I know what the fans like.  That's why I'm coming to you, comic fans for help. I don't want to answer to some guy in a suit with a ton of money, I want to answer to the fans. 



How You Can Help
Our goal is simple.  We have a handfull of books we're currently pitching around Hollywood.  So far so good, but we are at the point where we need cash to really get this company up and running. We need to create comic trailers for our books, look-books for pitching them, build a site for comic submissions & more...but we're cash poor. 
More importantly, we have a few books already written and illustrated that are just waiting to be printed.  Furthermore, we've got ideas from several creators, including top talent like Darick Robertson (HAPPY!, The Boys, Transmetopolitan, etc.) and Writer/Actor Michael McMillian from True Blood, that we need funds to have illustrated and fully brought to life.  These are just a few of our amazing books waiting to be created.  And my partner and I just don't have the money to fund all this ourselves and don't want to bankrupt my family's comic shop in the process.  That's why we need your help.
Crowdfunding through Indiegogo seems like a natural fit.  We have some creative "perks" that give you value and us some cash, a WIN-WIN scenario.
Here are a few Golden Apple books we are developing NOW and need money to fund:     


TRIAGE: This is a unique and inventive story about EMT Cassie Jurich who makes a miraculous recovery from an accident to not only find she has physical abilities she never knew, but someone wants to kill her for it.  It's an action/mystery with enhanced human abilities. What more do you want from a book?  The writer, Mairghread Scott (Transformers Prime), has issue 2 written and ready to go.  We want to hire an artist to bring it to life and keep this awesome series going.     


TELIKOS PROTOCOL: This is one of the most insanely cool books ever.  If you haven't seen it, check it out now.  Telikos is one of the most successful KICKSTARTER projects in history.
These guys have created  an amazing world and we are lucky enough to be working with them to develop it for TV, film and Video Game.  It's published by Vanquish  Interactive and I gotta tell you, these guys have some sweet new books in the pipeline.  Telikos is only the beginning and we hope to work with Vanquish to bring all their titles to the screen.


THE 36: Ancient Kaballah mythology says there are 36 people alive in the world at all times who are tasked with protecting the world, whether they know it or not. Kristopher White has taken this mythology and given it a smart super hero edge. This is a lush, rich world populated with real characters with real problems, who just happened to be the saviors of the planet. This is a must-read. Kris has Volume 2 mapped out and 2 stand-alone stories already written.  We just need money to hire artists to continue to bring this spectacular universe to life. This will surely be your new favorite series.   


JIMMY BRASS, 2ND GRADE DETECTIVE: This is a noir detective story starring a 9-year-old.  An awesome book that my daughter loves it as much as I do.  The writer, Jake Dickerman (Gormitti: Nature Unleashed), has created a funny, cool and unique world where a hard-boiled detective solves the mysteries of his school with the help of his flask-like juicebox and a butt-kicking Kindergarten girl, Opal. Jake has 3 issues done and waiting to be printed and many more in the works.  This is a fun series that we are eager to keep going and possibly sell as an animated or live-action TV series.    

What You Get 
So, the important part.  What do you get for your support?  We're offering a ton of stuff, from digital copies of our books, to a shopping spree at Golden Apple Comics. We'll even publish your comic book under the Golden Apple imprint! That's right. Your book can be one of the first books we publish and a part of comics history. Yeah, there are a lot of incentives from $5 to $10,000, please check them all out. There is something for everyone!  

The Impact
We could have gone after private money, but we don't want to deal with people who are going to squash ideas because they aren't "commercial." We are asking you guys for help because we want to have to answer to you. We want to give you what you want, and that's awesome comics and (hopefully) awesome movies & TV, too. We don't get in the way of the creators we work with, we let them do their thing and help their vision come to life.  
With Golden Apple Productions, I hope to continue on what my father started in 1979. Let's go out and make the new wave of comics!


Other Ways To Help
If you're on hard times, like we've all been (believe me, I know), then please help us out by telling your friends about us and linking to this page though social media (Facebook, Twitter, Etc.).   
Thank you for all your support!  Let's start making some awesome comic books and helping Indy Creators!
-Ryan Liebowitz

*Gift card can NOT be used on already discounted merchandise or consignment items.  
**Banner ad will be placed at Golden Apple’s discretion.  Golden Apple refuses the right to promote any business it chooses, including competitors or businesses deemed inappropriate by Golden Apple.  If Golden Apple rejects your company, your donation will be refunded.

story:
The Totally Flapjack Publishing Project

I'm Gillian.  I'm responsible for Totally Flapjack, a comic where my son's toys appear in a comic and have adventures.  Hippo-Monkey - somehow loveable despite his opinionated nature - is the undoubted star.  You can see him and his friends at http://totallyflapjack.co.uk

A number of people have expressed an interest in owning a published Hippo-Monkey book, and this gave me an idea.  I want to publish some books and all profits from their sale are to go to the Queen's Medical Centre's ante-natal clinic in memory of our eldest son, Jasper, who was stillborn in 2007.  Hippo-Monkey had been bought for him.

This plan covers two things - the first, more frivolous, is that it gets Hippo-Monkey published in book form (all of which will be signed by Hippo-Monkey!).  The second, and far more significant and bittersweet, is that in donating to the hospital he was born in we can create a more positive memorial for Jasper than a headstone in a windy cemetry. 

 

What the Money Is For

The aim is to publish a print run of at least twenty books, but with additional funding we could print even more!  All profits from the sale of the books will be donated to the QMC ante-natal clinic.

 

The Impact

Obviously, this won't make a massive impact on the world, but it is hoped that the funds raised from the sale of the books will make a difference to some and, perhaps, help stop a tragedy like ours happening to them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute but want to help in another way, please consider publicising this campaign through your choice of social network!

story:
Death's New Lease On Life

Death’s New Lease On Life is a comic in the making. Or Graphic Novel, if you prefer. For children. Ostensibly, at least. About Death. Or, to be more precise, the Grim Reaper. And the need to feel wanted. And penguins. Adelie penguins. So many many Adelie penguins.

It was written by me, Brendan O'Connell, to be illustrated by her, Fiona Boniwell. It's 32 pages long and tells the story of how a forlorn Grim Reaper came to a better appreciation of life and, subsequently, death. It's funny. And joyous, in it's own way. And it has penguins. Many, many penguins.

What We Need & What You Get

Death's New Lease On Life is written. The story. The jokes. The funny lines. The twists. The turns. The happy ending. That's all done. But none of that is any use unless people get to read it. And for that to happen it needs to be illustrated, coloured, lettered and printed. Which, obviously enough, is where you come in.

In return for your help we are offering our undying gratitude. And, of course, some physical rewards such as copies of the book, t-shirts, original artwork, aluminium prints and even a chance to have your likeness (or a loved one's) as a background character in the book. But really we all understand it's the undying gratitude that you're most interested in.

All original artwork, including the Look It's Me characters sketches, will be signed and come with a certificate of authenticity.

Why Would I Do This?

Because you're a good person. And look, see, you could make that happen. You could make the Grim Reaper so happy. You could also help a lot of hard work come to fruition. Death's New Lease On Life has been a labour of love for a number of years and now it's this close to being realised. You can be the difference.

But What If...

€10,000 is the amount we want to make this book the best it can be (and believe me it can be great). But we have been very careful to ensure that each reward/perk is self-contained and can be delivered regardless of how much we raise. If you give us €10 for a finished copy of the book, rest assured we can deliver on our promise. If you give us €150 for a limited edition aluminium print, with all the trimmings, then you will get that beautiful piece of art with all the trimmings. So, in that respect, whether we get one backer or a hundred, it doesn't matter (otherwise we would have picked fixed funding). The difference having more backers will make is simple. It will afford Fiona more time to devote to the book (finishing much quicker), give us both more control over the final printed copy and, of course, allow us to do a proper print run. The only question should be do you want to be a part of making this happen. Hint: You do.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help by spreading the word. Tell your friends, your family, walk up to strangers on the street. Well, maybe not that last one but you get the idea. There are even buttons at the end of the page to make it easier for you.

Even if you're poor or, you know, miserly. That's fine, just spread the word. We'll still be grateful.

* The music in the campaign video was provided by Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
